text: Came here for the first time after a show. I've always wanted to try this place and I've heard only good things. Food was good. I ordered the crab bisque soups and the turkey sandwich. We ordered calamari and hummus for appetizers. The service was good too.

I had not been to Chicago in about 6 years.  Throughout the day I had gone bar hopping with my friend and was so let down by the bars we had visited.   Later in the evening we ended up at LUXBAR and I instantly felt like this was the Chicago I knew and loved.  Mike Finn was our bartender and was amazing.  He made us feel like we were the most important customers in the whole place.  Super attentive!   We also met Gunner who made sure we were taken care of as well.  I will definitely come back to this place because of these guys.   Thank you for making my Chicago trip a memorable one!

This has to the WORST restaurant in chicago. Food was absolutely horrible. Ordered: fish tacos, crab bisque, fried chicken, macaroni and cheese and truffle fries. Fish tacos had nooooo flavor and tortillas were stale. Crab bisque was extremely too thick in consistency. Looked like Nacho Cheese sauce. Crab was just poured on as if poured out of a can. Fried chicken was extremely bland, the breading didn't even have flavor. Last but not least I thought the truffle fries were their hot item off the menu and surprise surprise, I tasted no trace of truffle. This place is soo bad and I'm soooooo disappointed. I know GREAT food and Chicago is a city of GREAT culinary but this place should not even serve food. I wish I could give 0 stars.
Nice restaurant. Quite big, so you will find seating. Fast service, nice staff, generous and tasty portions. Good location. Highly recommended.

Great atmosphere, and the food was just okay for the high prices. Service could definitely be improved however. Our table asked for bread four times until our server finally brought it. (Although it was at the end of the meal, an hour after we first asked.) Don't think I'll be going back for a while.

The one star review is ONLY based off the kitchen staff. My server, Courtney, was top notch! I ordered my 8 oz. filet to be cooked medium. As soon as I cut into it, I knew it wasn't cooked as I requested. It was cooked medium-rare. Courtney offered to have it cooked up, or a new steak. I said cooked up was okay. THEN, the "cooked up" steak comes out... and really not that much of a difference. I had, had a long day and was really in no mood and was just going to let it go. Courtney offered to have steak comped from the bill. I really appreciated this, because I am not a demanding customer (you know who are ;). I explained I didn't want her to get in trouble etc. but she's the server... not the chef so it wasn't her fault at all. She was so cute and brought me out a little baby piece of steak that was cooked as it should have been the first time. So in short, Courtney thank you so much... appreciate you! I may come back for a glass of wine, but won't eat here again.
Delicious filet sliders!  A little crowded and chaotic feeling but service and food were very nice.

Love this place as I have been coming here since they opened as I even went to the grand opening.  I love the cool vibe and the great food. In fact, this is one of my favorite Gibson's brand. There isn't a bad table in the house as I have sat in the bar, outside, upstairs, and in the main dining room.  I have been here for brunch, lunch, dinner, and drinks and every time I have had excellent food with great service.  This is one of the great places in the 'triangle' to come and enjoy good times with great food.

This was a great dinning out time. It was a friendly staff and checked up on the table very often. The manager personally came around the tables more than ones to check if anything was needed. The food is good portions. Try the lux bar Snickers pie when you visit!

Eat there last night.  Wife had the avocado kale salad I had the roasted chicken and our son had chicken fingers.  First of all the portions are huge.  My wife liked her salad and my chicken was the tastiest I have ever had!  Juicy and extremely flavorful.  I also ordered the mashed potatoes and roasted brussel sprouts, both excellent and meant to be shared.  All in all very good service and food.  The only draw back was it was extremely load inside.

This restaurant is in a cute and trendy area near Rush and State Street. Outside seating reminds me of eating at an outside bistro in Paris. The inside is nice too. Lots of options for drinks and food. Sides options come are priced separately than main dishes. Dishes start at $12. My friend and I had the California Salad that has avacado, heart of palm, carrots, and other veggies with a vinaigrette dressing. Portion was good size.
luxbar Old fashioned is the best in the city, even the ice cube goes through a process. Check it out.

Great spot in the neighborhood. Right across Thompson Hotel. Highly recommend a basket of Truffle Fries for the table, Kale/Avocado Salad. My boyfriend tried the Lobster Roll and highly recommends it.
Had a great time at Luxbar the other night with friends. The menu is simple & easy to navigate. Somewhat pricey but it's definitely worth it sitting outside in front of the restaurant.

The food and the service here is so fabulous! I've gone here twice within two weeks now and have been very pleasantly surprised with how delicious the food is! I will definitely be taking out of town guests there as the walk to the restaurant and the surrounding area is enjoyable to walk through. I normally sit at the bar to eat or have a drink - the bartenders are always so friendly and so professional.  Again, the food is absolutely to die for!

I came here last night for dinner. It was my first time dining here, but only heard great things. Lisa was our server, she was very knowledgeable, kind and gave great recommendations! I started off with a last word and my date had an Apex predator. We ordered their Kale avocado salad, shrimp cocktail, steak frites, and cheesecake! Everything about our meal was perfect no and delicious. The service was impeccable! Thank you Lisa for the memorable evening!

I went to LuxBar for lunch the other day. Not only was the service attentive and top notch, the food was great as well. Definitely recommend this restaurant for lunch, dinner or brunch on the weekends.
Can't say I will or won't be back. Nothing memorable. Server was not welcoming at all. Food overpriced for what is served.
Great atmosphere and location.  Service was friendly and attentive, but food isn't spectacular.  I would go to the many other options in the neighborhood to get great food.

ROACHES!!!!! CENTIPEDES!!!!!! I am highly disappointed with my experience at lux bar...my fish was undercooked and slimy; my friends steak was rubbery, the potatoes were very watery & cold! I was displeased with the service I received. I noticed roaches eating crumbs at the door edge. I stepped on 3 centipedes. The decor is phenomenal but the health and safety guidelines were despicable. I'm disappointed with my overall experience. Don't be fooled by nice decor; don't pay extremely high prices for inedible food. Lux bar should do better. Location and decor aren't everything :(

Went here for a couple of fancy cocktails with my friends. We went on a Friday night around 10:30 and were able to get full service and a table at the bar even though it was pretty packed. Our server (I believe her name was Suzanne if I remember correctly) was super nice, friendly and attentive! She also gave great drink recommendations. I would definitely go back for both the atmosphere and the service

We were in desperate need of a place with great food and a place to watch the ranger game. This place definitely delivered. Our apps were fantastic and the drinks were great. The service was out of this world, and the waiters were friendly and gave their opinions about each dish. The fish we ordered since it was good  Friday had the skin of so it was pretty fishy. But if you work a little bit you can get it off. Overall pretty gooD!

Eh Luxbar is located in a very nice, high-traffic, Gold Coast location, but the food is so average. The ambience and service is pretty classy, with waiters dressed in handsome black vests.  The food is pretty plain - from the mac and cheese side I ordered, to the buttermilk fried chicken, I wish there had been more flavor all-around. I had a bite of my friend's warm winter harvest salad, which was ultra-plain. I also tried another friend's steak frites, which was tough. However, my fried chicken was a good value price-wise, (one and a half pounds of chicken) for $20.

Had lunch with our family of four today. Beautiful day in Chicago for sure. Tables set up outside and the windows open. Didn't have any tables outside so we ate right inside the door.  The food was just awesome. Best burger ever. Three burgers a corned beef a cup of soup and two bloody Mary's. 100.00. That's a lot.   The two drinks were really delicious but really small for 12.00.  The service sucked!! I get it was busy but when two are only drinking water then we shouldn't have to keep asking and waiting for it. After order is placed 5-7 mins later we are told they are out of Tuna. Ok. Five minutes to wait for a menu. Food delivered and asked for mustard. Ate half the burger and had to flag him down to ask and wait for it.  It's fine to charge more for location etc but then offer the service to go with it please.
My favorite bar in Chicago Downtown! Mike the bartender  makes the best cocktails, he is amazing! The service is good and the food is fresh and delicious. I highly recommend this bar/restaurant.

Luxbar is a casual, fun lounge/bar/restaurant with great food and reasonable prices. It can get loud at times, though. Sit by the fireplace and warm up. Great drinks, super wait staff and a nice place for anything from brunch to a date to dinner. And lunch or dinner outside in the warm weather is a lot of fun, especially for people watching :)

Great ambience and excellent service. Very lux indeed. I came here with a group of friends on a Saturday night, and the atmosphere is classy but somewhat casual. We first ordered drinks and apps to share, but unfortunately some of us had to send our Moscow mules back because it was essentially melted water. I don't suggest ordering this staple cocktail at this bar. We ordered pigs in a blanket and the house hummus to share. The pigs in a blanket are teeny bite size pieces, but enough on the plate for a group of 10 to each have one. The hummus was substantial and tasty. I also ordered the off menu buffalo chicken salad, as I had heard that it was delicious. However I was pretty disappointed. The chicken pieces were like bite sized pieces of fried stuff, with no chicken to be found inside. The sauce and veggies were great, but the protein itself was nowhere to be tasted. Regardless of my poor food choice, the service was pretty superb. Managers come up to say hi, and the food came out timely I would say.

Had a great evening with my husband. The interior is lux that's is for sure. The staff was friendly and so welcoming. The cocktails are on point, my Moscow Mule was a refreshing combination of ginger and citrus. My husband wouldn't stop talking about his Old Fashioned.  Definitely my go to Monday spot!

Rudest bar ever. The reception Natalie and the waiter were flirting rather than helping me. And gave me this cold look when I asked a question. Extremely rude. I felt like I wasn't good enough for this place.

Been to this bar a few times.  Sat at the bar, ordered my normal stiffy and mingled amongst the crowd.  Overall, nice bar, no baggery of the D going on here.  Enjoy this as a summer spot. Bar can get crowded, but it's a good when a place draws a crowd...for a good reason. Service is on point.
Great service! Happy hour is the best.  5 dollar wine and 5 dollar burger.  Best burger I have had in a while!!
Food is good but nothing exceptional. Place is nice and well decorated but very noisy. Service is too present and pressing.

Love this restaurant! Definitely recommend for anyone looking to go on a date, out with friends, or out with family. Casual but nice. The wait staff is friendly and the food is great. Had fried calamari and gnocchi for dinner. Very good

Luxbar is great for drinks! It's a really big restaurant that's perfect for groups. The bartenders are knowledgable and more than happy to talk about different drinks and spirits with you. I wouldn't say the food is anything spectacular but it's consistent!

We came here for breakfast after a failed attempt to get in to the Original Pancake House down the street. Well, there's a reason so many tables were available here on a Saturday morning.  Pros: The decor and ambiance inside are very nice. We sat near the fireplace and it was a very cozy way to spend the morning.  Cons: - I ordered the avocado toast, which had very little avocado to speak of. The runny egg entirely saturated the toast, and the mouth feel/texture was just blah. Hutch, in Lakeview, has a much tastier avocado toast that costs less. Or, better yet, buy an avocado and make this at home.  -Our coffee was served lukewarm. However, kudos to the staff, they replaced it right away when we let them know.  -The tables are all extremely close in proximity. I could barely get up from my seat without hitting my dining neighbor in the head with my elbows.  -Our breakfast was certainly on the pricey side - $40 bill for two entrees and two black coffees.

Went here for my wife's birthday.  Notified them and requested something special...do with that what you will.  Got a follow up call to confirm and they reiterated my requests.  Get there and they sit us right in the front by the door. No special cake or comped dessert.  No mention of my wife's bday.  Moving on from that,  the food was very average.  Oysters,  Brussel sprouts (actually good! ),  and filet mignon.  My old fashion was solid but nothing to write to mom about.  Very disappointed for such an occasion that it was a let down.
Chic setting, great location! Waitstaff was friendly and accommodating, excellent lobster bisque!

I give this place 5 stars! I love the vibe of this place. Service was wonderful and the food was fantastic. Even the manager stopped by to say hello and welcome us. I give extra props for that.  App: Mussels-these guys were huge and packed a huge flavor. I really enjoyed the chorizo   Dinner: Gold Coast sliders-perfection!  Side:truffle fries-let's just say there were only crumbs left at the end  I recommend this place

Better than I expected. The club sandwich was huge, didn't really care for the turkey meat on this sandwich was more like lunch meat off the shelf! Won't get that again . Brussels sprouts were great.  Had better king crab soup too. I don't have to go back

I back to Lux Bar time and time again. Whether it is for a drink or to sit down and eat, I adore the selection they have. My favorite cocktail is the Green Fairy (odd name, but great taste). The Royale burger is my go-to whenever I go in. The service is always great and they are always so nice. They check up on you throughout the dinner and make sure that you are doing okay.  One thing to note is that I wish that there is a bit more space. The walk way and space around the table and seats are a little tight.

We came in to this place with little expectations since we already ate dinner. The bar is a nice surprise with excellent bourbon and whiskey  selection. Customer service is topnotch. This place is highly recommended.

We have been going to Luxbar especially for brunch for years but it appears they recently changed their menu not for the better.  The Avocado toast for $12 is poor value.  I ordered an omelet that they completely botched and didn't offer condiments once they brought our food.  We hope they can improve the food and quality to what most Chicagoans expect.
Oh man.  This place changed their menu. Haven't been back in a few months.  The service is always great but the meal my fiancé and I always get is no longer offered.  Ouch!

I was able to make reservations the day of. Great place for groups, with lots of tables to accommodate bigger groups. They also have a bar area.  Drinks are strong! We tried 5 different types of cocktails and all were strong and very creative. Our server was well versed on the cocktails and what they tasted like.  Food:  Calamari: with bell peppers. The sauce was a little too much which made it salty. Interestingly, it the sauce made me think of Asian flavors.  Mac n cheese: fairly standard. one of the better dishes that didn't taste too salty. Came with this fried crispy cheese crumbly thing on top which was pretty good.  Sliders: so plain... only had meat with the bun. the meat was a bit too rare for our liking.  poke chips: wasn't a fan of the chips, i've had better. i felt like the poke could have been seasoned better.  love the ambiance of the place. it's a fun time, can get loud i recommend going there in groups with friends. good place to have a classier pregame before going out.

The star rating averaged from others' reviews does not come close to my fiancée and I'd experience here. First, the wedge salad was hands-down the best salad I've ever had. Period. I wish I would have had a bigger appetite to order more at the time. The wine the waitress helped me choose was phenomenal. Also, it is a very chic, cozy atmosphere nicely located near but not on (which I like) Michigan avenue. The service was outstanding. The general manager was very friendly and spoke with us for a while. He even had a glass of wine brought to me to match my fiancé's drink.  Bottom line: GO.

Great spot on the Gold Coast. Came here for brunch. I had the avocado toast with 2 eggs and salad. My sister had a turkey club with fries- I snuck some and very good! Others at the table had a Bloody Mary, breakfast skillet, chicken noodle soup, and a kale/Caesar salad. The ambience was just lovely. We were seated upstairs in front of windows and there was a light snow. Service was great! Definitely would be interested in coming back for dinner.

This is one of my favorite breakfast spots in Downtown Chicago. We stop here for breakfast EVERYTIME we come to this great city. The staff is great, the drinks are even better and the food is the best... The decor and vibe are great too... Full disclosure we have only had breakfast, but you can't go wrong with the Bloody Mary and go big... get the steak and eggs. You won't be disappointed.
Yo Yo Yo Grade: A  Had a great table ask for Matthias hooked us up. Sea bass was the bomb the filet was so good and Martinis were first class. Come here and live! Hell Yes.

Where do I begin...??  I rarely complain. I usually just ask the staff questions. It's interesting, because even they know when something's not right. We used to come here A LOT. Boy have things changed. It's just over a year since we'd been here due to traveling out of state. I asked our server if there was a kitchen staff change- and there has been. It's QUITE obvious. And a huge menu change. Blah.    So we dined here this past weekend (party of 4). All foodies. We all have different tastes and ordered 4 completely different things. Perch, the muscles, buttermilk fried chicken and the filet sliders. Hmmm. The muscles were a good size, but needed to be cleaned more. Some where good, but mostly mealy n bad. The perch, fried chicken and sliders all tasteless. No seasoning at all. We had to add our own. The sliders used to come with a small side of coleslaw or they asked if you wanted fries for an up charge. Now just 3 super thin cut pieces of filet on small buns looking so sad on the plate and lonely. So far 2 entrees, 2 appetizers. And an up charge to order fries instead of coleslaw.    *WARNING - if you drink wine by the glass and are drinking the same wine as someone else at the table ORDER A BOTTLE!!! The 4oz pours (I measure my wine at home for dietary reasons) for a $12 glass - epically ridiculously short!! That's over a %400 markup on alcohol. I said to the server after we received our glasses, I happened to have ask her "what's a better buy? The glass or the bottle?" She answers -bottle. Hmmm then why didn't you suggest that?   Between the quality of the food, tastelessness, presentation and 4oz wine pours for the $. And I know it's Chicago. I know it's the Gold Coast, but it's obvious the kitchen staff has changed (chef) and ownership doesn't care. I guess when you have prime real estate it doesn't matter. But it could be our faults too....it is a bar after all.    The manager did come to talk to us, which I was good with just telling the server and he comped a glass of wine (totally not what I wanted). We still tipped the server 20% (it's not her fault kitchen is to blame).    I wish I could give it 2 stars, but with all the other competition around and Chicago being a food Mecca I can't. It's too bad the wine and the fries were the highlights of our meal. We won't be back.

Great bar/restaurant in a great area. I wish I could have enjoyed it properly, but unfortunately my wallet was stolen inside of the restaurant. I ordered a drink, took out my wallet to show ID, put it back in my purse. Before leaving the restaurant, still inside, I look for my wallet to pay for the dessert at our next destination (since my friend's boyfriend treated me to lunch), and my wallet was gone. We looked for it everywhere. I had to leave there, file a police report. When notifying the restaurant, they were somewhat helpful. Said they'd look at the cameras and when they supposedly did, they didn't see anything.  Neither the police or I understand how a wallet can be stolen inside of a restaurant and not be caught on camera.  WATCH YOUR BELONGINGS. The same chance it could have been someone who was in there and walked by and snatched it, it could also be an inside job.  The next day, my cancelled credit card and international license was found miles away in a completely different location with cars driving over it.  Not coming back, but the food was ok.
great atmosphere....solid wine list...excellent charcutrie appetizer....overall a great spot for drinks or a light dinner in the V Tri...

I typically avoid places that scream club in general, but especially avoid them during daylight hours.  I came for brunch and was pleasantly surprised.  A lot less brotato than appears from the outside.  Shame on me for judging a book by its cover.  The mimosas were large and strong and the server was especially kind when we asked for "light on the oj."

We live out in the suburbs and love coming down to this area and restaurant for Brunch.  We have tried many items on the menu and always leave saying how much we love coming here. Food, coffee and location are great. You won't be disappointed.

The absolute rudest manager ever!! Watching the cubs game everyone is screaming in the restaurant and there has to be 6 Tv's on and he gets mad cause my phone was playing a video and yells at me to turn it off  How dare you!! As you sit on your phone talking and scrolling all night. But our server was AMAZING
Thoughtful menu, great environment, knowledgeable wait staff. A positive and exciting dining experience. Crab cake was very good.
I sat outside! Beautiful spot and they had over head heaters! My food was delicious and the truffle fries were to die for! Yummmmmy!

LuxBar is great if you want a fun energetic place to eat and drink in the Viagra triangle. The atmosphere is great, the service is top notch, and most importantly the food and drinks are solid. I had the Lux Royale burger and it was tasty and reasonably priced. The Lux Old Fashioned was the best Old Fashioned I've ever had. Overall, if you're looking to hang out in this beautiful part of town, you can't go wrong at LuxBar.

Hmmm last lunch not so good. the chix Sammy is way too sweet even without side sauce and really just not very good. perhaps its the sweet bacon that screams for a spicy sauce not more sweet. this is food 101 folks. I dunno and I dont care how just know the overall sammy too sweet and bland. Surprised this is the lunch standard here. beer was good came in right glasses. good service. kale salad was good if overdressed. and it takes me a lot to say that. side of slaw non memorable.  lunch summation: non memorable

I am normally a fairly healthy eater so when I have a craving for a burger, I want an amazing beef burger with awesome fries and that's exactly what I got a Lux bar.   Top it off with a good margarita, great service (Jillian) and patio seating during the last warm days of the year and it's sheer perfection.  This will be the go-to place for a burger from now and would return to try other items on the menu as well.

Had a private dinner here for work the other night and we were in a room on the second level with a private patio. The building is gorgeous, service was great and the food very fresh and delicious! I had the whitefish with crisp vegetables and some red fingerling potatoes. The mini desserts were very good and the passed apps also very good! Hope to be back soon.

This is place is nothing but sheer awesomeness. My wife and I had our wedding here this past weekend, and it was perfect. The staff was friendly, the food was great, drinks were the best, and they helped us set the perfect mood for our night. They were helpful the whole night and even had our things packed up for us as we were ready to go.(This was not asked of them, for they did it out the kindness of their heart)  Luxbar is great on an average night, but on our wedding night, Luxbar was nothing short of spectacular. Highly recommended for anyone looking for good drinks and food and I can't wait to go back.

This review is solely based on food quality. For an appetizer I had the sweet chili calamari. So crispy and the sauce on it for perfectly ! Then I had the filet mignon sliders and the crab cake. I was satisfied with every single bit. Yes I have had a better crab cake, but the atmosphere and food was delicious. Would literally recommend to everyone and anyone !

Nice spot for people watching and having a drink on a very beautiful day. Ordered the calamari and a couple of cocktails. I remember loving the flavor of the squid before but this time it didn't have the same kick. Service was friendly and on point.
Great food. Great service. If your a tourist you should definitely put this on your to do list.  Everyone should go at least once.

Five stars for the location, service, and the food!! We sat outside, perfect for people watching, and be oysters were to die for! Also had a burger. Delicious. This is a must stop when you are in the Gold Coast area.

I usually come for breakfast but haven't been for a while so forgot how much I enjoy eating here. First and foremost, the food and service is terrific. The food came quickly which is smart, by staffing up the kitchen for increased throughout they can turn over more tables, but that said, we never felt hurried our rushed to leave. Just the opposite, we felt welcome, appreciate and happy that our food came so quickly. Shortly after being seated, the manager came over, introduced himself, welcome us and told him to let him know if we needed anything which resonated with me. Nice touch.  Obviously he's comfortable enough that his ship is being run well that he can personally focus on the most important task at hand, a satisfying customer experience.  Second, Luxbar is deep in the heart of see and be seen country so it is as dynamic and vibrant a brunch people watching scene as you can find in Chicago. That said, many locals, such as I, who enjoy the beautiful flowered street ambiance as well can be found nestled throughout the posh crowd. I don't remember what I ordered but it came with freshmy made tasty home fries, fresh perfectly scrambled tasty eggs, deliciously spiced breakfast sausage,  fabulous double smoked artisan bacon strips and what appeared to be a home made jam. It was served in an iron skillet so it was nice and warm when it arrived. The portion was substantial. I recall making a mental note that the coffee was quite good as well.  My entire party enjoyed their food as well.  For my own selfish reasons I'd like to see them take more risk with more innovative menu choices but I also understand that given their volume of customers, the need to simplfy and focus on the quality of food and service. I also understand that they understand this is a more mainstream crowd then one finds in fringe neighborhoods.  Luxbar is back on my A list for brunch destinations.

I usually enjoy this place, but won't be going back for awhile. Today, we got sat at an outside table that was completely crammed between two other tables and a heater. It was impossible to move our legs at all and we literally bumped into the people on either side. I ordered eggs over easy and bacon. The bacon was undercooked and the eggs were so unbelievably runny, my plate looked like it was full of soup. I sent both back, and the eggs came back over hard and the bacon was like cardboard. I've felt sick ever since we left (going on 5 hours now) and I'm convinced it was from the food.

I love the atmosphere here and the food was great but the 3 stars are due to the incredibly slow service. I know it was a Saturday night and busy but our server didn't even come over to get our drink order for 20 minutes so we had to get someone else's attention. He barely showed up after that and the food took forever to arrive. The sliders and grilled cheese w/ tomato soup were amazing but not sure I'll be back if I have to wait so long for it!
Service, food quality, speed, and food quantity were excellent! Steak Frites and burger are suggested!

Wonderful experience at brunch today.  Our group of 12 was treated with care and concern. The manager, Mike, did EVERYTHING right from start to finish. Yes, the food and service were excellent. Yet it was management that brought this meal to "memorable". I will come back here over and over again based on this exceptional experience.

I've been to Luxbar a few times and have consistently had pretty mediocre service each and every time.  Fool new one, shame on you...fool me twice, thrice, etc, well...shame on you again.  The food at Luxbar is decent, for an upscale bar experience.  You can expect some steak and seafood options along with some pretty good sides (Mac n cheese is on point!) and sandwiches.  I'm a burger enthusiast and have tried the Lux burger and was super bummed to have a soggy, messy, plate in front of me. Honestly, I just feel like if you're gonna go out to dinner in Chicago, you can do better.  The service is always friendly, but good lord is it slow!  My most recent visit took 40 minutes to get our food from the time we ordered, and it was a pretty empty restaurant.  We had to flag down anyone we could find to close out because our server was non existent.  This could be a fantastic place is a great location; make it happen!

I wrote into the website asking for your brussels sprouts recipe. Have not heard back. Could you please please share it here? I Have tried ( with much wasted time and expense) to duplicate it using other recipes without success! Thanks in advance. Hope you read these reviews to see this!

One word consistent.  Luxbar has been a pillar of the Viagra Triangle for years.  I have never had a bad meal here, the atmosphere is great, awesome people watching, and the Lux Royale Cheeseburger is out of this world.  One of my go-to brunch spots in Chicago.

Had a fun time dining here on Saturday.  My friends and I split the mussels (huge portion, and waitress gave us tons of extra bread), ceviche was mediocre - the presentation was sloppy and the composition felt awkward but it was alright to eat.  Drink selection was ample and they have a nice outdoor patio, but I think overall the food was a let down for the area.  Service was prompt and our waitress was really splendid so I'll give this place another go.

The atmosphere was lively and many people were out today for 4th of july weekend. I had the fried chicken and my roommate had the lobster roll. She said her lobster roll was good. My fried chicken was a disappointment. I liked the crispy skin, it had a good crunch but the meat didn't taste seasoned. It also came with honey as a sauce, which I didn't get understand, but that might be an American tradition I don't know about. Other than that everything was okay.

Drinks: My dining companions always have good drinks here. Food: I had the skirt steak and eggs. I liked the hash browns., done just right. The steak was also very good (slightly on the small side). The eggs were well cooked as well. The bacon looked good: I want to try that next time at my next visit. Service: Staff was attentive.

Nice spot to eat breakfast outdoors. Tight squeeze on the sidewalk but great way to start your day! Service was attentive. We so appreciated the bottles of water on the tables. The oatmeal, yogurt parfait, and skillet was very good. The bloody Mary's at the next table looked tasty. I wish I would have had room for the glazed apple fritter.

Big fan of all of other Gibson's restaurants...LuxBar, not so much. Went on a Saturday around 1:00 pm ish, crowd (and music) quite ""clubby." Fried Chicken and BLT Wedge were good. Drinks were fine (liked the Build-your-own-Manhattan), service was perfunctory at best. Quite below the par of other of the Gibson;s group I have frequented.  Clean place with a great selection of spirits, just not stellar service.

Great food with options to satisfy all. Cool and hip  vibe right off of Rush St. Also, great outside seating . Crab cake Appetizer was the best . We enjoyed our visit and we will be back . I forgot to mention that from the greater to our waitress everyone was nice and provided efficient service.

Go here for brunch! Their lox is so fresh and filling. The patio is a little crammed, but we were content with getting to sit outside. Location is great! Service was a little slow, but our waiter was pleasant. They have a rosé cart which I find unique. Fun place to take guests from out of town

Went back with my family for an early dinner last night. Most people were sitting outside but my brother wanted to stay inside so we were the only people indoors. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. She brought out the bread basket when we asked and took our orders. My brother enjoyed his shrimp cocktail and my mom and I split the lobster cocktail which was pretty good, I enjoyed the Dijon sauce it came with.  For my entrée I got the BLT salad which is basically a wedge. I did not care for the bacon, but that was just me. I know a lot of people like it thick cut and chewy. My mom had the Maine Lobster Roll sandwich and she loved it. My brother got the Lux burger and said it was one of the best burgers he's ever had. We also got a side of the Brussel Sprouts, but they were just ok. I wouldn't get them again. We did try the turtle sundae and the snickers pie for dessert. The sundae was very boring but the pie was HUGE and very good. 4 people could likely share it.

I'm a big fan of Luxbar. I've eaten here 20+ times and it's sad to say that I did not explore the menu too much. I tried the filet sliders the first time I visited, and that's pretty much what I always got. The sliders are tasty little filet mignon's on soft, buttery buns. I order my steak medium rare... they melt in your mouth. I paired them with either mashed potatoes or broccoli. One little slider and you'll be hooked. ;) Try their brunch too.
Just delicious and affordable. 4 people's brunch, drinks and tip for $110! Still thinking about the bacon.

Second time coming here. Tonight we visited for drinks and small plates. Ambiance was good. Great service. Stephen was our bar tender. He was wonderful. I tried the milk stout...yummy! My husband had an old fashion...he said it was a standard but really good. We ordered the steak tartare. It was tasty but a little more sweet than what we like for our palate. Overall still a great experience!!
Great vibe, great sliders and great drinks. Good service fair prices and  indoor outdoor seating. I thought they did a nice job. Would come again and recommend.

Last week, my husband and I decided to celebrate our 40th anniversary at Lux Bar! (We go every Sunday for Brunch)..  We thought about going to London or Italy but wanted to enjoy our special occasion with our favorite restaurant our favorite drinks and favorite food!! John was great!! They really rolled out the red carpet for us.  This is the best managed restaurant in the city of Chicago with exceptionally attractive and comfortable ambience.  Did I mention how great the food is??  And the Strawberry Fields is my all time favorite drink!!  Mike Avella is a wonderful manager and his new hair style looks phenomenol!  George Clooney look out!!!

We went for drinks tonight to the lux bar and it was very disappointing. We ordered a bottle of wine which was a 2010 vintage and they only had 2012 and the manager told us that it would cost us the same amount even though it was not what was on the menu and what we ordered. He said that their supplier changed the vintage of the wine but charged the same amount for a 2010 and 2012 wine so we had to pay the same amount !!!We asked if they served a cheese plate and the waitress who by the way was awesome ( Danielle ) said let me see what I can do and came back and told us that they intend to add it to their menu but since they don't know how to charge us for it they couldn't serve it to us !!! Seems like customer service is not their forte ...

I wish I could give this a 3.5 stars. The food was good...not delicious, but good. We went for brunch on Mother's Day and had good service, however we didn't feel the price lived up to the quality of the food. Not a bad decision, but it won't be our first choice again.

Whenever we are in from Michigan to visit our daughter, we always make sure to be here on Friday for their perch. Not only is the fish outstanding, the coleslaw and fries are the best! The service is top-notch, from the busboys to the wait staff. The managers are always walking around and making sure that everyone is well taken care of and happy with their meals. The prices are reasonable for the area.

Great experience with each visit! Service and food is exceptional. We visit our daughter in Chicago frequently and Lux is always a dinner plan for us. Friday fish special is excellent. One of the managers, John, recommended peach cobbler when Michigan (our home state) peaches were in season. It was scrumptious! Both mangers are engaged with their guests. Much appreciated! Outdoor seating is available, with heaters if chilly.

Definitely worth checking out. Rush Street is the place to be. Just enjoyed a couples drinks here, but was a nice bar. Think they're definitely going for a theme here with their drink choices: Thriller, Purple Rain, Strawberry Fields.  Very Classy!!

I love the space here. The location is good, the décor is great, but the food and service needs to match. We came in here craving a mid-day snack and ordered calamari and mac & cheese. Pretty simple dishes that I would expect could be easily well-executed. The calamari was generic, with a great sauce over it - but the calamari itself was not cooked exceptionally well. The mac & cheese I was very disappointed in - particularly in Chicago with phenomenal food all over, you would expect "good." The cheese was hardened over some mediocre noodles. The server was a bit disinterested so between these two issues, 3/5 experience.

I love Luxbar's atmosphere and most of their dishes which is why I frequent it a lot. However, their salads are grossly overpriced for what they are. I paid $17 for a salad that consisted of 2 green beans, 3 very small thin slices of Ahi tuna, and 7 pieces of lettuce. I had to go to the grocery story immediately afterwards to make more food for dinner. While everything else on their menu is good, I recommend staying away from the salads unless you want to leave more hungry than you were when you arrived.
Great drinks, great atmosphere, great people. An awesome place to kickback and hangout.

I do not know how to love a bar more than LuxBar! I first found LuxBar when I first moved to downtown Chicago for work, in August, 2009, and can be found at LuxBar between 3-7 times per week when I'm in town, at least sometime throughout the night, if not most of the night.  LuxBar opened in September, 2005, in the historic Gold Coast region of downtown Chicago. LuxBar is yet another huge success by Steve Lombardo and Hugo Ralli, from Gibsons Steakhouse and Hugo's Frog Bar & Fish House fame.  LuxBar was inspired by the work of Adolf Loos whose "American Bar" was designed and built in early 20th Century Vienna. The bar captured an elegance in simplicity; a style that greatly influenced the work of Frank Lloyd Wright and other American architects in the "prairie school." Stone, glass, brass and wood bathed in natural light, presence in the neighborhood is welcomed and profound. This is a special place by design.   LuxBar is often referred to as a "neighborhood saloon" and is designed to convey that same simple elegance, just remember that the neighborhood is where you'll find the 40-something Neurosurgeons and Hedge Fund Managers mixed with the 30-something tourists and the 20-somethings lost from Division and Rush. The food is feel good fresh, natural and easily understood. Artisanal in style, the menu reflects what the partnership views as an accessible cornucopia of what you might eat on just any occasion. I feel like I've tried almost everything on the menu, and have always been extremely pleased. Some of my favorites are the filet mignon sliders, jumbo shrimp cocktail, and jumbo lump crab cake. Sometimes, they don't have what I want on the menu, and I'll have them make me something. My usual is a toned-down Caesar salad with light dressing and grilled chicken. The specialty cocktails are from natural, fresh ingredients: simple elegance. My favorite is starting with a glass or two of Champagne and from there, most of the bartenders mix me up my favorite fruity vodka drinks. Although, the "Drink Book" has a very impressive list of specialty cocktails, "Make Your Own Manhattan," wines, drafts, spirits, etc. For example, the bourbon list goes on for 2-3 pages, so you will definitely find anything you're looking for, and much, much more.   The staff at LuxBar is trained in the customer care philosophy that has made Gibsons Steakhouse and Hugo's Frog Bar and Fish House famous for legendary service. I enjoy the pleasant mix between the staff knowing my order and chatting, but not getting too personally involved. I have always received impeccable service. Oh, and for all of you restroom obsessed Yelpers, like most quality bars and restaurants around Division and Rush, there is a restroom attendant who makes sure that not only the restroom stays spotless, that also there are plenty of beauty accoutrements for even the most picky, so make sure to bring some cash to tip accordingly.  Of note... Parking is usually very difficult. The easiest for me, is to take a cab and get dropped off. Also, there is valet across the street for the hotel, which is always very accommodating, if I happen to drive. Private Dining and Party Hosting is Available  Events LuxBar often has seasonal events, so definitely frequently check their website. This Easter Sunday, there will be an appearance from the Easter Bunny from 11am-2pm. Mondays are "Industry Monday" with 50% off drinks and appetizers, in the bar only, from 11am-2am. Hours: Mon-Thurs: 11:00 am - 2:00 am  Fri 8:00 am - 2:00 am  Sat 8:00 am - 3:00 am Sun 8:00 am - 2:00 am For more information: luxbar.com I 5/5 highly recommend LuxBar!

As a whiskey fiend who gets off from work two blocks away around midnight, Luxbar makes for a great spot to unwind before heading home. They boast one of the city's most comprehensive whiskey selections, as well as a respectable draft beer and wine-by-the-glass list, and for that they (would) get five stars.  From the hummus to wedge salad to roasted salmon with celery root to meatloaf with mushroom gravy, food here is usually solid, although never exceptional or moan-inducing -- likely a symptom of being a part of the Gibsons family. I advise against the goopy, tasteless, heartburn-inducing steak and black bean chili, as well as the beef carpaccio, which suffers from a jumble of too many sharp flavors (pickled shallots, balsamic glaze, parmesan). Service, while efficient, rarely offers much in the way of warmth; a smile every now and then would be lovely. Maybe by the time I arrive, the staff has already had hours of putting up with corporate asshats and airheads. Shouldn't matter, though.  Whatever. I come for the whiskey. For those of you complaining about the prices, you know what area of town you're in, right?

I would say more like 3.5 stars, but I'll say 4 to be nice. It's pricey (gold coast, after all) but a nice atmosphere and everything I had was yummy. It's not somewhere I crave or am dying to return to often, but it's a place I would go if my friends wanted to....etc.

This is the upscale Cheers in the city of Chicago. Everyone knows everyone and it has a family vibe to the place. The drinks are fantastic and the pours are good. Food is very good, and easy to share!

Nice place to meet up with friends, i am just not a fan of their food. Waiter's are all over the place and extremely distracted. I felt like all employees were lost and no one had focus. It was one mistake after the other. Wouldn't go here again.

My boyfriend and I have stumbled in here for brunch a couple of times while out and about on Saturday mornings. The food is great, and prices reasonable. We're bar people so that's where we belly up to, and we never have an issue finding two stools together upon entering. Service is always impeccable, your water glass will never be empty and the bartenders are classy and know what they are doing. Definitely a great go-to option in the Gold Coast.

Stopped in for dinner after work and were greeted by a more than friendly staff.  Started with a couple of Moscow Mules that proved to be AMAZEballs, followed by a spicy calamari that was great on the taste buds. Our dinner entrées were plentiful and the dessert was ginormous! Couldn't have had a better dining experience. LUX definitely brought out the LUXurios treatment!

We had an absolutely fantastic brunch at Luxbar. It's highly recommended you make a reservation for brunch cause it get's packed. Then again, everything on Rush street seems crowded regardless of time of the day. I opted for the eggs benedict, which was amazing. Others in the group got the hash, steak and eggs, and calamari.  Bloody mary's and service were spot on.

I would've given it more stars if our waitress wasn't trying to rush us. It was very strange because it was New Years Eve and it honestly wasn't crazy crowded, but the waitress kept rushing us. We needed some time to order drinks and approximately 30 seconds went by and she came right back to ask again. It was ridiculous, that is not enough time to look it over the menu. I ordered a Moscow mule though and that was delicious. I really enjoyed it. I also got a half chicken. It wasn't that great. It was very dry. I'll opt out of that if I ever come back. Back to the waitress, when I was eating, the waitress took my napkin! I was super annoyed because she didn't even ask if I still needed it. Of course I did! I was still eating my chicken. She also kept asking to take our dishes when we were obviously still working on them. I don't remember who she was, but this place needs to work on their service. Don't rush customers out when they're trying to enjoy their meal. Maybe that's her personality on trying to keep things tidy, but it just ruined the experience here for us.

A place with a well-made Moscow Mule has a piece of my heart. I went with the classic grilled cheese and tomato soup which was a perfect fit for a cold Chicago day. We were stuck in a corner table that was a bit squeezy, but we made it work. Our server was friendly and very attentive which led me to try the Moscow Mule which I will not forget.  If I would go back I would try the Lux Club, a massive club sandwich + avocado and their homemade chips.

Went to Luxbar for brunch last Sunday.  It was crowded but we got a table in about 15 minutes.  Our server was very attentive and the food was great.  I got a burger and my friend got a chicken sandwich. Both were awesome.  I got the delux burger and it had some incredibly delicious bacon jam.  It was one of the best burgers I've had in a while. The homemade bun was fantastic.  The only reason I'm giving 3 instead of 5 stars is the burger came slathered in mayo and this was absolutely not listed on the menu. Mayo is the ultimate dealbreaker for me and it makes me irrationally angry when restaurants don't list it and then put it on your food anyways. Why not either clearly list it on the menu or serve it on the side? I know I'm not the only person who doesn't like mayo.  Personal pet peeve, but it gets me very riled up. I had to send my burger back and wait on another.  A waste of food and everyone's time that could be avoided if the menu accurately described the dish's preparation.

My wife and I stumbled upon this place in Chicago while going to breakfast. Prices were reasonable, food was good and service was great.  Nice atmosphere with a fireplace and low noise volume.  This has been added as a must go place when we visit Chicago.

Went for brunch.  The eggs benedict were good.  Hash browns were just ok.  I asked for a Bloody mary with a bottle of hot sauce on the side.  Instead, got a Bloody mary which was made by the bartender and way too spicy hot and vinegary.  Mentioned to the waiter, who asked if I wanted it hotter.  Told him no.  Couldn't finish the bloody mary.  If you ask for a bloody mary, I think you should get basically vodka and tomato juice.  If they deviate from this, they should at least tell you so you can just order vodka and tomato juice separately, then doctor it up to your liking.  (Once again, a place that makes things salty and spicy to get you to buy more drinks.)  Hubby had pancakes which were just ok.  We decided to go back for lunch on another day based on things we saw other customers getting which looked really good.  Ordered the bloody mary again, which was same as before.  Mentioned this to the waitress, who said this was made with their house mix.  Thumbs down once again.  Hubby ordered the turkey club, which was just ok.  I ordered the standard burger.  It was on the salty side and just ok.  At that point, we decided we were not going to give it a third try.  Overrated and not going back.
Delicious pancakes and bacon for brunch. Very reasonable and great service. Beautiful bar and restaurant

This is one of those well staffed...nice looking establishments that seems like they are trained to churn things out like clockwork getting people in and out. Ya know what I'm talking about you haven't even looked at your menu and your waitress comes over twice in 3 minutes while you are conversing and asks if you are ready to order.  Anyway with that said its a fine place in the neighborhood. Not so fitting of its name LUXbar... more like a family or everyday kind of place you go for a sandwich or a salad. Portions are large and quality is good. Nothing spectacular but defiantly worthy of a meal if your in the area.

This is my second time at LuxBar, and I feel this review is necessary to write, because the food and the service are both impeccable. Both times I've sat at the bar the same dude bartenders have been here. I believe Gunner and Gus are their names , are both are absolutely phenomenal! They are so attentive, I legit feel like a princess every time I'm there.  Not only is the service amazing, so is the drinks and food. Highly recommend trying the Last Word 1921! It has Chartreuse in it, which is the dominant flavor of the cocktail, ridiculously tasty and strong!  Got the crab cake and tuna poke. Both delish! I love everything about this place, and will be back!
The foods is very good but the customer service is exceptional.  For me customer service is as important as the food.  They are super nice there.  I am heading there today for lunch.

I've been here for brunch twice and will continue to return. The first time I got the Chicago scrambler, second time the breakfast burrito. Each time the eggs were at a perfect consistency. Both meals were very delicious. The drinks are also good. Very nice waitstaff.

My husband and I loved this bar until I  was  interrogated by both the bartender and restaurant manager on the evening of Sunday, November 1st. We had left the Jethro Tull concert around 10:00pm. I went to the bar to order cocktails for my husband and I.  The bartender said he didn't feel comfortable serving me. He called the manager over and they both proceeded to interrogate me regarding how many cocktails I had had at the concert. TWO!!!! That is how many I had. I have never been so disturbed by the actions of both a bartender and manager at an establishment in Chicago. Specifically,  the group that Luxbar belongs to. My husband was coming into the bar after paying the cab driver. I was on my way out. Never again will we go to Luxbar.  We crossed the street and went to Hugo's. They gladly served us. We had some appetizers and enjoyed the end of our evening. I spoke to the manager at Hugo's.  Hopefully,  something will be done. Good riddance Luxbar!!!!!
The service was phenomenal! The staff were friendly, food was great, and the food came out quickly. Also, the atmosphere was fun. Highly recommend!

Excellent food! We were here with a group event and the food was outstanding. Steaks, slider apps, lamb chop apps, staff was friendly and professional. Best steak I ever had. We are NY Mets fans and Watched game 1 of the series here. Very accommodating!

Upon entering this regal restaurant adorned in ceiling to floor polished wood; your greeted by a friendly hostess. Seats next to the window provide great people watching, however I arrived at 7:30 on a Monday night & by 8:30pm the place was packed. On weekends I can see how crowded this place can get. The noise level is high, talking drowns out the noise of soft lounge music.  I ordered a cup of chicken noodle soup, it arrived piping hot with no shortage of chicken or veggies, packed, great tasting firm veggies with marinated chicken I ordered an entree salad with arugula, pine nuts, quinoa, light Brie cheese, tomatoes topped with filet mignon, which was perfectly seasoned, in three large chunks, close to 8oz, great price value The service is average at best, if your talking to friends or enjoying the games on the tv's you won't notice. Park in a lot, street parking is very limited Great marble bathrooms, huge floor to ceiling mirrors, pretty clean

Really enjoyed our experience. Sat at the bar. The beet salad was delicious, as was the popcorn shrimp. What made the night was Sean our bartender. Great recommendations on drinks, bartenders choice, and they all were delicious. I will definitely come back.

I just came here for their 10 for 10 anniversary deal. Although I really enjoyed the ambiance, the food here was mixed: The popcorn shrimp was pretty good, solid 3.5/4 stars (simple seasoning and not too greasy, additional seasoning and some lemon would have make this a solid 5 star dish), however my friend had the steak and potatoes (i tasted the potatoes, they were bland and tasted fake, though I'm not sure they were..it was weird) and the steak looked over cooked, and she said it was not very good. I would give it a go again, however maybe just for apps.

First and foremost the Moscow mule is on point. I ordered the gourmet burger , hit the spot . The service was top notch, the bill was reasonable and the place has a very fresh atmosphere. Very clean and good for me.  Thanks guys....
Drinks and food were great. We ordered the white lady and 3 negronis, Courtney (our server) was super sweet. What else do you need for a five star review?

They make one large, delicious crab cake! Cole slaw could use some work though. Shared that plate and a bottle of Prosecco with a friend here recently and had a nice time.  We sat right by the open patio-facing windows which was great on a warm summer night. Service was good- quick and attentive. No complaints, but would need a complete dinner experience in order to bump the rating up or down. First visit was a success.
Our server Jackie had great attention to detail. She is traveling on a trip to Italy. I think she's a great addition to the exceptional service at LUXBAR.

You've got to go to this place for brunch. Eggs Benedict made to perfection. Staff very welcoming and friendly. Sit outside roadside under the arming for the perfect Chicago mid afternoon atmosphere. Ask for a cappuccino  made by Marena. She is very proud of her cappuccino !
So delicious! You have to get the truffle fries and Mac and cheese! We made a reservation and we didn't have to wait at all. Service was good and the wait time on food was not long at all.

My wife and I held our wedding cocktail reception upstairs at Luxbar and we could not be happier. Here are a few highlights... 1. The staff. Jaz, Kristin, Nicole & Liz = AWESOME. The team was so friendly, accommodating and patient. And the service staff the night of the event were so professional. ***I have to give a special call-out to Kristin (who walked us through the linens and the food and pretty much everything else prior to the event) and Liz (who was there to oversee our event that night). We couldn't have asked any more from both of them and we are very thankful. There was another guy who helped manage the event that night and I cannot remember his name, but he was fantastic, as well. 2. The food. Our friends and family can't stop talking about the food. My personal faves were the filet sliders, beef wellington and the jumbo shrimp cocktail. 3. The venue. When we walked in and saw what the staff had done to prepare for and set up the event my wife and I were blown away. We had something pictured in our minds and without really any specific direction from us the staff nearly executed it exactly how we had hoped! Within 5 minutes of working together the place was perfect and my wife and I had a chance to relax and have a drink prior to our guests arriving. 4. The next day. My wife and I came in for brunch the next day since we had to pick up some of the items the staff had held onto for us (which was awesome that they did this so we didn't have to clean up and take everything away the night of the event). Every item we had given them ahead of time for the event was neatly packaged in the exact same packaging in the exact same manner as it was given to them. We were so taken back by the amount of care the staff took with our items. And as I loaded the car the manager brought my wife a complimentary glass of Veuve. ***Yes, guys, I loaded the car while my wife sipped champagne. Welcome to marriage :) Overall, our cocktail reception was awesome and we received so many compliments. My wife and I are both grateful to the staff at Luxbar that we have so many fantastic memories of that night!
Great experience. Loved it. Highly recommend the Calamari. The meatloaf was okay and the salmon is solid. Hear the burger is their staple item so I hear.

Visited Luxbar for a work team dinner and was pleasantly surprised!  Service at the private bar was pretty quick even with 1 bartender and great selection of wine cocktails. Appetizers included fried calamari, bruschetta, quesadilla wraps, and hummus.  Calamari was delicious!  The other apps were ok, but nothing special. Ordered the filet for dinner and it was great!  Cooked perfectly and a large portion!  Mac & cheese on the side was by far the highlight of the day - I will definitely be coming back just to eat this! :)

My girlfriends and I went for brunch yesterday and it was really good. The portions are not so crazy that we had a lot of food leftover but were more than enough for none of us to leave hungry. It was a great way to start our day in Chicago!

We came here yesterday with my mom and aunts. The food was delicious, especially the white fish. We ordered a side of veggies, which was also delicious and enough to share among four people. Everything was fresh. But what seals the deal is the waitstaff : they were all incredibly kind, efficient, and accommodated every request in a timely manner. They give you a cute little postcard with your check. Overall wonderful experience.

I have dined in and ordered food for take out at Lumbar and I have had nothing but positive experiences. The service, food and ambiance all make Lumbar worthy of 5 stars.  The sweet chili fried calamari is a really good appetizer. The calamari pieces are really big and the sweet chili sauce is the perfect combination of sweet and spicy.  The classic cobb salad is really good and the rotisserie chicken they use gives the salad a little twist from what I have usually thought of as a "classic" cobb. I may be partial to this salad because I love Cobb salads in general!  The crab cake entree is really good, however it may not be enough food to warrant an entire, especially without an appetizer or added side. The dish consists of 1, very large and thick crab cake, with a slaw on the side. I aded saluted spinach as an additional side dish and between the two, I was full and satisfied.  Clearly, I recommend trying lumbar! They also have a nice drink menu and would be a great place to just grab drinks and appetizers!

Hands down one of my favorite outdoor dining restaurants. The food is always on point, fresh and absolutely delicious. The service is great and the moscow mules are to die for! Food Suggestions: Crab cakes, Lux Club, Tuna tartar ( the portion could be bigger but it's one of my fave's), cobb salad ( and they make half portion) and mashed potatoes.

Came per recommendation from the concierge, extremely busy, however got a table inside. It was a beautiful day in Chicago. Service was excellent the portions were large. I had the lux club, salmon eggs Benedict, veggie eggs Benedict. The food was very good. Well priced for the area. A bit noisy and the bathrooms are a flight high.  It's a nice place to come and have breakfast or lunch, however there are other places with similar food. It's not a must have place. Still good.
Fun neighborhood, didn't match up to all the hype it gets. But worth it just to spend time in the area.

Awesome cinnamon pecan pancakes.  My friend had the eggs bene and said they were great.  It was my first time in downtown Chicago and am glad my Chicago friend introduced me to this place.  Great neighborhood, quiet and quaint.

Average food choices for brunch. I wasn't t impressed with the skillet. Corned beef is the only thing worth it. My order came out totally wrong but the server and manager  were very accommodating  and remade it.
Favorite bar. Easy recommendation for my clients. Must try truffle fries and Moscow mule.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. I had the gourmet burger (Havarti cheese, arugula, jalapeno relish, bourbon bacon jam) with truffle fries, and it's one of the best burgers I've had in recent memory. Perfectly cooked, lots of great toppings. A little messy, but that's how you know it's good. The truffle fries are divine and definitely worth the extra couple bucks. Our waiter was really nice and was making non-cheesy jokes and conversation. I do have a complaint about the patio though: there are way too many table and chairs in such a small area. It was hard to maneuver into our seats, and we constantly felt in the way of food runners and other patrons. That aside, I would definitely come back if I found myself in the neighborhood. Good people watching!

We went for late night drinks.  Scotch and Whiskey list is extensive.  Ask for the larger list if you want to open up your wallet for a generous 2.5 oz. pour of the finer scotches and whiskey's out there.  Their Moscow mule is probably one of the best out there. Atmosphere on a Saturday is great.  It is quite busy and the crowd is a mix of younger to middle age.  Servers are attentive and the manager seems to know his whiskey as well so that was helpful and encouraging.  Nothing worse than a place with a great top shelf and no one that knows it.  They did! Not sure about food as we did not have much but overall a fun and delightful experience.

Luxbar has the BEST Moscow Mules in Chicago.  A manager recently told me they served 18,000 mules last year, and I believe it. The menu is diverse and everything I've tried is well prepared.  They used to have more small plate options, but recently changed the menu (wish they'd bring that back). A good option if you're in the Gold Coast and looking for a casual restaurant with a diverse menu and fun bar.
Everything was amazing about this place.  The atmosphere was speak-easy ish and the food was phenomenal as well as the service and drinks! 5 stars!

I'm really upset about the experience I had here. I went on a Sunday for brunch. Unfortunately, the food was cold. We ordered the chicken club and the filet sliders. The truffle fries weren't good either. Everything was just sort of blah, nothing special. Your typical bar food. Thankfully we had a nice server that didn't make it uncomfortable for us when we barely touched our food and left. I've heard this place is super popular and fun so maybe it was a bad day? I'd prob go back only to get a drink but prob will pass on the food.

Roasted bell and Evans chicken was delicious; and happened to be exactly what I wanted.  It was moist, cooked perfectly.  It came w an herb au jus that I could have drank by itself. My husband had the fried chicken and Mac n cheese - can you say food coma?  The Mac came w cheese crispies on top - did I say creamy, simple goodness?   The calamari was ok - little too much flavor for me; I like it a little simpler, but the squid was tender and fresh for sure. Crowd was a little bit too "posh" for our taste - really don't care if you have a Louie bag or not - I think everyone that walked in had one. Service was on que and our waiter was adorable.  Attentive, inquisitive and right on point.
Great brunch spot. Burrito was HUGE but nicely done. Service was attentive.  Would go back.
I want to like this place. The food was good and the cocktails were nice too. But I just don't like the vibe. Try it for yourself.

Wyatt. one of the best servers by far. He checks up on us from afar. Not too much or lil. Chill. Always on top of what we needed and more though we didnt ask. Amazing. Thank you. Food. CALAMARI IS A MUST. It was not the typical fried calamari and dippingsauces on the side. Good lord. Best calamari. now i cannot wait for the truffle fries and gourmet burger. They even split it in half for us when we didnt ask.  My boyfriend would not stop about how good it is the whole time and he does not give burgers a good praise but this one did it. this place is a must.

Came here for a weekend brunch and was not disappointed.  We sat outside along the sidewalk and had a great overall experience.  The service was prompt and they were very accommodating of our group having three children ages 3-8.  The prices were reasonable given the location in Gold Coast.  I had the luxbar skillet which was okay, but not quite as good as I had hoped.  Others had the pancakes, an omelet, and the salmon dish.  All thought the food overall was good, just not the "oh my, we have to come back" type of good that can be found elsewhere in the city.  On a sunny day, the sidewalk seating is hard to beat though.

Very poor service will not return here. Person who took our reservations was rude and got my name wrong (was still wrong when I arrived). When I complained via twitter manager reached out once I had to call him back twice within a week before getting a hold of him. He promised to be present when we arrived and promised free apps or drinks due to the bad phone service. He never showed up. No one at the restaurant ever apologized. They definitely need some 101 in customer service

Saturday night 8 pm. Table for 2. Place was packed. Hostess was nice, waiter was great.  Food was good. Shrimp cocktail to start.  We shared the Saturday night prime rib and order of mac n cheese. It was lots of foods for the 2 of us. Great setting, great people watching, nice staff and good wine and food, why would you not try it? We will be back. Not sure why some Yelpers are so critical.

Service is wonderful and the food was also great. We had the salmon and steak and both loved our meals.   Word of warning on the snicker bar dessert - it is huge and could easily be good for 4 people.   Enjoyed the meal and will definitely be back.
Luxbar is a cool spot to have a few drinks. The nice setting and decor draw a young professional crowd. The service is attentive and the prices are fair.

Great place!  We were staying a the Waldorf and they recommended Luxbar for an early dinner with our kids.  Everything we ordered was delicious.  Our server was attentive and friendly.  They even made my 6 year old a grilled cheese and fries, which wasn't on the menu.  We'll definitely go back next time we're in Chicago.

Went to lux bar for dinner with a group. We got seated about 30 minutes late but the manager was super apologetic and took care of a round of drinks. The food was delicious! Everyone's food came out how they wanted and it tastes great! The drinks were fabulous as always! We had a very friendly and wonderful waiter! Overall great dinner and experience!!

This place has a great atmosphere, it's in a great location, and the prices were very reasonable. I'd definitely come back. This is a really cool area to get Sunday brunch in Chicago. I highly recommend it.

Was told great things about this place, so after getting out late from work last night I decided to give it a go. Considering it is part of the gibson's brand you'd expect a lot more, but I guess it proves what happens when you expand too much. Though I have heard the brand was sold to landry's, which would explain much of this. We were not greeted at the door. We found our own table.   The food came out well before our drinks, clearly a kitchen looking to close up and get us out. The food was fine, nothing memorable. The chips was saturated with oil, as if they temperature of the frier oil wasn't hot enough.  The drinks were solid, but again took a while. There was hair on our table cloth, so clearly not changed between guests, or detailed at the very least. When we asked for dessert the server was quick to say the kitchen was closed, without even giving us a heads up. In my experience, if you done, no matter what time, you get the full experience. This was half assed, clearly pushing us out cause it was late, and I would return nor recommend this. There are plenty of other late night spots with higher quality food and better hospitality that would enjoy my business.

This is, by far, the most disappointing review I have ever had to give. I used to be a regular at Lux Bar until I ordered takeout this evening. I discovered a piece of plastic in my usual burger. Upon calling the restaurant, they asked me to please bring the burger back so they could show the wait staff. I did, and it was handled very poorly by JJ. JJ, the manager, made it seem like I was making this up and had no clue what had happened. In addition, he said he would credit me for the burger (obviously) and did not offer any apologies, did not take responsibility, or even speak in a sincere tone. He made it seem like I had made up this entire thing, even though he had the evidence right there! I will post a picture. Please, do not order from here. It's not only the plastic in the food, but it's the way the management handles a crisis. I am so disappointed and thought so highly of Lux Bar. Now, I am a former customer.

Food is great. But could the service BE any worse here? Rudest waitresses I have ever experienced and completely unprofessional - I am appalled. I have been several times and have never been treated in a professional manner. Maybe Lux Bar should learn how to train employees? Not sure that would even help at this point. Never going back.

One of my favorite places to sit at a table with girlfriends people watch. Inside is great, and if you can stand the redic wait for an outside table in the summer it's phenomenal. The Triangle at its best. Lunch/dinner options include some favorites -- all of the sliders are excellent, particularly the filet. The slider combo is by far one of my favorite dishes in this neighborhood to indulge in -- 2 sliders and a side salad for $12?! Literally cannot beat it.  My rub with LuxBar is brunch. I've had brunch at LuxBar a double digit number of times. EVERY SINGLE TIME someone at the table is served raw eggs. Either criminally underdone poached on a benedict or still super slimy over-easy.... I'm talking not cooked to the point that the servers obviously just don't observe the plates of food they are serving. ANY reasonable human could have pointed out these were not palatable eggs. The last time I ordered a veggie benedict, the eggs were literally barely holding their shape. That's how raw they still were.  So, as much as I love LuxBar I might have to permanently give up on brunch. But that doesn't mean I'm not coming back for sliders.

Caveat: I've only been here for cocktails at the bar. Definitely on the pricier side but I won't deduct for that considering the neighborhood. I had no reason to suspect any other price point.  Although consistently busy on the weekends, I have always magically gotten a seat at the bar. My favorite is their Old Fashioned. Just lovely. The giant ice orb melts slowly so as not to water down the delightful booziness. And their simple syrup is made from sugar in the raw which is a great flavor that I'm going to have to try at home.  A lovely place to grab a pre or post dinner cocktail.

Good food: truffle fries were solid, nicoise salad was too, filet mignon sliders were a perfect representation of where this restaurant's strengths lie, I would eat those every day if I could. Good environment Had a wonderful time
Eaten here for years. Fantastic menu and establishment. Buttermilk chicken is my favorite, but there are many other delicious entrée's. Highly recc.

Here for a business dinner and it could have not gone worse.  I told them I had shell fish allergy and they bring me crab.  Told them I have a gluten allergy and they put croutons on my salad.  I ordered a steak med and it was so raw and tough I could not eat it.  They took the steak after I had to say something and put the same  steak in front of me after I told them I was a bad steak. I would give them a zero if I could. Could not come back

Lux was something we checked out after the pancake place next door was too busy. It was one of the best decisions all weekend! I ordered the Lux Skillet complete with 3 poached eggs, hash browns infused with caramelized onions, bacon and smoked bacon and sausage links, complete with an English muffin and house-made jam. It was honestly one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. All of our servers were very professional and got the job done right. If I'm in Chicago again for breakfast, I know where I'll be taking my business.

These people are real Pros! The food is excellent. Hugh proportions. My pork chop was perfect! Very tasty. Wait staff was very good.  Deserts to die for. A fun place to go for dinner. Very nice facility, comfortable and relaxed atmosphere. Very nice bar also. When your done, walk across Rush street to the Viagra Triangle. Grab a park bench and expresso and enjoy some people watching. Great lively neighborhood.
Good mimosas and delicious breakfast! The service was really fast as well, and it's a beautiful restaurant. The service wasn't exceptionally friendly but would definitely return!

Such a lovely place! I went here with my friends for an Easter brunch and was not disappointed. The staff was attentive and pleasant, the atmosphere was elegant, and the food was delicious. The portion sizes we huge; you definitely get your money's worth. The drinks are a tad on the expensive side, but still not too bad. I would come back.

We used the private event space upstairs for our wedding's rehearsal dinner. It was an incredible experience. We had 40 people for a seated dinner and there was plenty of space... could have easily fit another two+ tables. TV's around the room easily hooked up to my laptop with the HDMI cord and played our slideshow so everyone could see it. I came in earlier that day to drop stuff off and test the AV equipment and they saw to it that we had it working before I left so there were no issues later that night.   The staff was fantastic throughout the night - very attentive to every request, checked in every so often to make sure things were going alright, and very friendly. They were super professional.  The food was amazing. We had 4 options - steak, salmon, whitefish, and chicken. I had people tell me the steak was the best that they've ever had. Mine was great. I also tasted some of the salmon and that was amazing as well. We had Carrot Cake and Snickers Pie for dessert and the presentation was a topic of conversation - it comes out as massive hunks presented to the table and then gets sliced to individual servings. They also have good beer selections.    Everything went super smoothly throughout the night and our guests were raving about everything - the space, the food, the service. We couldn't have had a better time. Luxbar knows how to make their guests feel welcome and well taken care of. I would certainly recommend the upstairs space to anyone in search of a private event space. Simply outstanding service and delicious food.
This is my favorite restaurant! Everything on this menu is amazing my favorite includes the turkey burger sliders with truffle fries. Great atmosphere for a night out with friends or with family.

Been here a few times now for breakfast & dinner. I really love the French toast, not heavy & very flavorful, not too sweet. My husband orders the breakfast burrito every time & loves it. Dinner didn't knock our socks off but we're definitely willing to give it another go.  Most everyone is really friendly & makes sure you're always doing ok, no matter how busy the place is which I really appreciate. I'm so glad this place is in our neighborhood!
Great food, nice location, excellent cocktails. Moscow Mule highly recommended. Apple BBQ fried chicken sandwich is very tasty. Place is crowded on weekends.

I'm so grateful to Mike and his staff for accommodating our big group in such a short notice. The service and the food was great. Thank you for the champaign toast my proposal day could not have been any better. Thank you to the staff at Luxbar, my future wife my friends and me had a great time. Mike if you guys ever wonder what was going on that day here is the clip  youtu.be/xHXM_1I3Ung . Thank you again appreciate the help !!!
Good food and atmosphere. Was hoping for better Bloody Mary on Sunday morning brunch though.
Great place to go with a group. There was good energy, lots of young people, and they even accepted a reservation. Gourmet Burger and Meatloaf were delicious.  I would go again.
