Super cozy location with great food. We were seated near an amazing fireplace. I recommend the truffle fries and the lux royale burger.
Sunday brunch - bloody mary's = excellent.  Eggs, hashbrowns, toast, all very good.   Bustling environment, excellent service.
I went during the summertime. I sat outside on the patio, which was a very nice atmosphere. The food was very good. I would definitely come back.

My coworkers usually choose someplace new to hang out  every couple of months. This time Luxbar wad suggested. I had heard great things about their lunch options and cocktails. They did not disappoint! I am still dreaming about filet mignon sliders, truffle fries and grasshoppers! Though more than what I would spend on a meal, $25 will  cover you for a shared app, meal, drink and your tip. Great, relaxed atmosphere to hang out with friends or just people watch. Thank you so much Luxbar! Had lots of fun!

This is one of my favorite bars in the city. Good drinks, classy joint and fantastic/lively atmosphere. People are there definitely to show off/flaunt cash but its fun to go as a change of pace from typical Old Town bars

Update: Luxbar called me to explain that, while I did indeed have a charge on the bill for our "free sundae", there was a credit listed at the bottom of the bill that I had overlooked. It's actually good to know they care enough to call to clarify with their customers (and read their reviews on Yelp).

We considered LUXBAR for our wedding and found it to be satisfactory on every point. Communication with their event coordinator Jaz was professional and responsive. I emailed her with questions and she replied the same day with clear answers. I called her about an impromptu visit and she was available. She did not pressure us in any way, shape, or form. The event space was above the LUXBAR restaurant and was divided into two sections by a bar in the middle. There was a fireplace and tall windows that opened out to a small balcony. If we didn't like the furniture they would swap it with something else from another Gibson Group restaurant. They could comfortably accommodate 80 guests on each side of the space allowing us to have a ceremony on one side, switch to the other side for cocktails, then back again for a seated dinner, and move on to dancing. An open bar, passed hors d'oeuvres, and a seated two course dinner for 80 guests including tax and gratuity would cost us $12,500 on a summer Saturday evening. Our guests would have a choice of five entrees. The staff would take care of set up and clean up. If we had decorations they would arrange them for us also. We would have to bring our own dessert or pay more for theirs. We enjoyed dinner at LUXBAR in the restaurant to see if we liked the food. We had Steak Frites and a Birkshire Pork Chop (pictured). Both were seasoned and cook PERFECTLY. The meat could be easily chewed without being too soft. The sauces did not overpower the natural flavors of the meat. I am having a hard time recalling if I've ever had better cooked meat - especially without any direction to the chef. My props to Chef Michael! The fries with the steak were narrowly cut and fried crispy and seasoned. They reminded me of shoestring fries. Even though we were not impressed by the fries we couldn't stop eating them! We finished with a Seasonal Cherry Pie. We loved the crumbly crust and the locally sourced vanilla ice-cream. Beyond that, the pie was satisfying. We enjoyed two of the Build Your Own Manhattan and were delighted that they had high quality options including hand-cut ice. I also had an adult hot chocolate (Jalisco Hot Cocoa) sprinkled with paprika (delicious) followed by the Eventide. The Eventide was surprisingly ah-mazing. It mixed my favorite beer (Left Hand Milk Stout) with Few whiskey among other components. It was smooth, mature, delicately sweet, and creamy. I had two of them! Dinner, dessert, and all of our drinks cost about $150. The service at LUXBAR was incredibly professional. The servers wore black slacks, white shirts, and black ties (even the ladies). They are well accustomed to satisfying the demanding whims of wealthy local seniors and then switching to the unpredictability of tourists. They are smiling professionals who are able to deliver a consistent experience across the board.

This a great place. They have the big screens throughout the dining space.  The for place is an added plus. The food offerings are great tasting with small portion on the yellow fin tuna. They take reservation. Shalom

I came here with a group of 4 on a Tuesday at 2pm.  We were seated promptly but it was unusually busy and it took the waiter almost 10 min to get our drink order.  Then another 10 min to get our drinks. However, after explaining our wait to the waiter, the rest of our experience was expedited and very pleasant. First, I am not a fan of their Moscow Mule. The ice they use is almost the consistency of a snow cone, so the drink gets watered down quickly and there is not so much of the actual drink inside the mug.  The seasonal Ginger cocktail was quite good though. For food, my favorite dish was the spicy calamari appetizer. The calamari isn't crisp, but it is breaded and sautéed in a delicious sauce with red and green peppers. I also ordered the fried chicken sandwich, with cheese, bacon and apple slaw.  The flavors of everything went well and it was an especially savory sandwich. I'd recommend ordering the half sandwich and trying one of their soups. The rest of my group seemed pleased with their food, when it finally arrived. Two of the guests ordered a couple bottles of wine which were nice to have as we waited for our food. The icing on the cake was that the manager visited our table and apologized for how delayed our service was at the beginning of the meal.  He bought us a round of drinks, but since we were just about through, we ordered a dessert in lieu of more alcohol.  The Snicker's pie is ENORMOUS (enough for 4) but delicious.  I'd save room for this next time I visit!

The girlfriends and I came for our annual Christmas outing. Honestly, we came across the site on OpenTable and, unlike many restaurants in Chicago on a Monday, they were open. SOOO glad we chose them! The menu is simple, but what they do is great! We got there at 11 for an early lunch, and we were able to choose anyplace in the dining area. We sat by the fireplace, which on a Chicago winter afternoon, is a great place to hang out! The servers always made sure that our water glasses were full, which is always a sign of a great restaurant with great service! We started off with drinks, and I had the El Diabolo, a tequila based drink with ginger beer and cream de casis. It was definitely different...a little bitter but it was good! Between the four of our, we shared two appetizers. One friend and I had the tuna tartare, which really hit the spot! The tuna was very fresh, lightly mayoed and served with a good helping of fresh home chips. I really appreciated that there was more than enough chips for the amount of tartare that was there. The other two had the appetizer mac and cheese. Not the best mac and cheese I've had, but it was definitely good and tasty! Honestly, what drew me in when deciding on coming to the Luxbar was the filet and lobster sliders! It was even better that I found out when we arrived that they had a slider combo with two sliders and a side salad or soup! I also really wanted to try the King Crab bisque, so problem solved! The sliders were.....simply....to die for! The fillets were cooked to a perfect medium rare, which is pretty difficult for the size of the meat! There was also a very large piece of lobster tail on top of the two fillets. Just perfect! The bisque itself was also amazing! Very rich and creamy, however not huge pieces of crab. The flavor of crab within the soup, however, was amazing!  Service was on par, with the waiter showing the perfect amount of attention and not hovering at all. We also never had to ask for a waiter when we needed it! I was a little nervous with the size of the table for four (on the small side), but they cleared plates away very quickly to make sure that everything fit on the table and that we didn't feel crowded. Since we came right when they opened, we had no problem getting a seat, but by the time we left, the restaurant was full, so I'd definitely suggest a reservation if you're planning ahead.  Great service....great food....we'll definitely be back!!

Great food, reasonably priced. The fried chicken meal is enough to feed two people and it was delicious. The staff was friendly and attentive. Don't miss out on the dessert either! Would recommend to anyone!
LuxBar is more of a restaurant than bar. Having said that, it's still one of the best bars in the Rush Street area. Great menu with everything from steaks to veggie burgers.

So if your looking for some swanky bar food in the gold coast this is the place. We had the chicken quesadilla's, shrimp cocktail, pretzels and sliders all were good but the sliders were the stand out. We ate in the private dinning area up stairs its was very nice and the view of bustling Rush st was great. I had the chicken its was fairly tasteless and under cooked but the mac and cheese and potatoes were very good. Other people at the table had the chicken and it appeared they also were not cooked all the way. The decor and wait staff were helpful and friendly. Drinks were on par for the area. Good not great nothing was over the top. Lots of choices in this area would be hard to go back.

I'm seriously disappointed. The meal would've been perfect if it cost $21.95 at a Denny's in Hammond, IN. The bone-in skin-on chicken was devoid of any seasoning- a simple pan sauce would have greatly improved it. The same counts for the roasted veggies and brown rice- a little s&p, some garlic or fresh herbs would have gone a long way. The tuna melt was utterly bland with zero flavor. The seasoned fries couldn't stand up to McDonald's fries. I wouldn't be surprised if our entire dinner was purchased from the freezer section at Costco and microwaved. I'm revising this review a day later. My meal was this: fried chicken, veggies, fries. I can get that at KFC for $10 and it's GOOD. I paid $85 and the meal couldn't hold a candle to KFC. I don't think you can be more objective than that.

My husband and I came in today for lunch. It was our first time to Luxbar and will definitely be coming back.From the moment we came in we were greeted by a warm and friendly hostess. We were seated by the fireplace which was really nice and warm! Our server, Kevin, helped to also make it great. He was upbeat and positive.He did a good job keeping our drinks filled and clearing off finished items.He appeared so comfortable talking with us and really made for a great lunch. Luxbar has made a repeat customer out of me. I don't know why this was deleted the first time but had such a great experience I had to repost :)

Great hidden restaurant in the gold Coast.  All their appetizers are great, I love the calamari from here. Also the entree have so much options as well.  This restaurant is also unique because you can get food from Gibson's Steakhouse to Luxbar. It's always packed too so you don't feel like you are a lonely restaurant.
Luxbar was great!  I stopped in one day for a really quick bit and thoroughly enjoyed it.  I had a seafood bisque or chowder and sat outside.  Very nice experience.

This place isn't bad, but it isn't the most amazing place, either. Let's settle the score and just call it average (but overpriced) food. I came to this restaurant/bar with a bachelorette party a few days ago and had a nice time. The servers were friendly and helpful; the restaurant was clean; and the wine was good, but my amish chicken with brown rice and broccoli raab? Kind of meh. My truffle fries? Kind of meh. The bite I had of their sixteen dollar Gourmet Burger? Also kind of meh. Simply put, if you're looking for life-changing food, you won't find it here. However, if you're looking for a good place to grab a drink with someone, this is an ideal spot.

Me and my friends decide to go for a late night dinner around 9:30 pm on Sunday 2nd. Restaurant was 70% empty, host who look like the MOD for the night greet us and present our table. He give us multiple options for seating, very professional from his side, we seat around the fire pit nice and cozy. The server from the other side was complete opposite. His eye contact was to the bare minimum, no suggestion on food or drinks what so ever, he was floating around with his look during he was interacting with us. He was acting like we need to order, eat and go asap. He took our drink orders and serve it to us, and the time till he took our food order he was saying to us " I'll be right with you " almost 4 times going back and forward in the kitchen and out on the empty restaurant.  Finally we order our food and it came out with no long wait, but here it is my friend had a question about her dish. We kind flag our server passing by our table and again I'LL BE RIGHT WITH YOU. Omg dude at least stop and see what is the issue STOP walking and talking to your guest who you making money out off. Probably multitasking wasn't your strong side then send someone else to check on us, don't live your guest waiting longer then it needs. If you need to be cut off early then your time, or you need to GO and we are your last table, don't rush us and give the table to the closing server, is that simple. And last but not least there is the check with wrong item ringed on and the veggies who my friend switch for her unsatisfying meal where added on as extra food, my scotch was ringed as other scotch who was more expensive. I ask our server  about the bill and he was surprised and made a comment OH THERE ARE THERE I FORGOT.  Guess what my dear friend the people who you serve on Sunday night are in the same industry like you are. Your Bar/Restaurant lost 4 guests who never gonna come back again.  If you are a FOH manager and really care about excellent guest service please fix this type of issues buy retrain your staff, or simply get better server than our "server". A peace of advice my college, a  good service is rewarded with returning customer, a bad service is rewarded by spread the word to mouth in 1 on 10 ratio...

I actually love Luxbar for breakfast and late-night snacks and will eat outside whenever possibly unless the weather has turned for the worse which will then last for months. LOVE the simplicity of the 2-egg breakfast with bacon which is to-die-for. Whatever they do to their eggs over easy is amazing. Something so simple but so delicious. Service is actually rather friendly and efficient considering the area. Late night Caesar salad and mac n' cheese another delight. Great wine and drink list. Moderately priced.

The food is okay, and the pricing is decent, but the servers are just okay, and the management is laughable. The last time I was in I heard John (I think that was his name) make sexual comments about another guest and I just left. So over all, the food is fine, a step above Chili's perhaps, but the management is a joke.

Second time we've been there for brunch and both times the service was really good and the food was great too. The general manager stopped by and ensured everything was great. And it was. Service like that goes a long way.
Surprisingly a decent pregaming spot. The high boys in the eastern corner of the bar = good people watching

Loved sitting outside and in general I just like this neighborhood. The wait was kind of long even with reservations, but the service and the food were excellent and it's a cool place to eat in gold coast if you want to feel kind of "fancy" :)
It's an ok restaurant. The food is ok. The drinks are ok. Everything is just ok. It isn't terrible but it isn't a go to restaurant.

In my opinion there are way better restaurants to get a full sit down meal, but when you are wandering the gold coast and in need of a quick pick me up on a beautiful day, Luxe Bar patio is where you should be headed. Their Moscow Mules here are some of the best I have had, but I think it is the crushed ice that really takes it to the next level for me. The pretzel appetizer and shrimp cocktail were both large and the perfect thing for a warm fall day.

We are regulars...well three times in three days may qualify us for family status. But when our group is in town this is go to place. Tremendous variety on menu, can order breakfast until 3, great sliders, fab turkey sandwich, delicious yogurt parfait, great fries but they are never ever hot. Hip atmosphere. Excellent service

I like it here for breakfast. Didn't know they had breakfast here, we went to go to pancackehouse but they seem to be always too busy. Luxbar has a good parfait and ou waitress the one that is going to art school was so nice!!

I always love eating here when I'm in town. I typically visit for brunch but I also know they have a good nightlife and dinner scene. But this review will be about brunch. When the weather is nice, their patio is great to sit on and enjoy a good meal.  The food here is pretty excellent and adds to the nice environment. My two favorite things on the menu are the breakfast skillet and the cinnamon pancakes. I suggest sharing a couple plates because the food is too good to pass up. The cinnamon pancakes melted in my mouth and I kept having another bite. The skillet came with eggs, sausage, potatoes and bacon and made for a hearty meal. A perfect sweet and savory combination.  I will definitely continue to visit every time I'm in town!

I love LUXBAR! Great spot in V triangle for some grub or drinks.   Usually a lot of people that were planning on going elsewhere and just stumbled into here...which makes for a great crowd Staff is always nice. Usually busy, but not ridic The one thing I really dislike is you have to walk up and down the stairs to go potty, but I can get over it.

My wife and I ate here for brunch last Sunday when we were in town for the weekend. I had the Luxbar Skillet and my wife had cinnamon pancakes. both were excellent. the Luxbar Skillet had eggs, sausage, hashbrowns and bacon all on a square skillet. It was outstanding. My wife's pancakes were very good too. We ate outside and there was a slight problem with bees, but it wasn't a huge problem. We will go back on our next trip to Chicago.

Compared to the other places around, this place is usually not as crowded. I've been there twice now and we never had to wait for a table even on a Saturday night. On both occasions we ended up here after realizing that we'd have to wait for at least 20 minutes at other bars. I didn't try the food there too much, but the drinks are quite decent. The Moscow Mule is very well done. You definitely pay a premium for the location though. Service is generally very nice. Our water was efficient but also funny.

LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!!! Great place to eat, I've never had better service. Great atmosphere with Great Food. My brunch meetings never tasted better lol filling the table with Eggs Benedict, Hash browns, Belgium Waffles, Meat lovers Omelet with house made Jam.   I didn't get to see the Upstairs but heard good things & it's on my to do list next go around.

Pretty good for lunch! My aunt and I split a burger and chicken tenders (ok, our diet starts tomorrow). The burger itself was pretty good--nothing totally incredible, but perfect for satisfying your craving! The fries that came with it were tasteless, but tolerable. Next time, I would try the garlic aioli fries. The chicken tenders were really good though. Fried, but not so fried that you wanted to die afterwards. The honey mustard they use is good, but the barbecue sauce...not so much. The coffee was great! Overall, a decent experience. I wouldn't protest coming back.

We ordered the calamari, fried chicken, and fried fish.  Food - I am not impressed by the food here. Calamari tastes almost like an Asian dish. Fried chicken and fish are both on the dry side. It could've been much better. But I guess the price is alright in the 14-16 range.  Service - excellent service!! Very attentive. Very professional. They even clean the leftover on the cloth with this nice tool looking like a ruler.  Overall, good service but food is not good enough for me to want to come back. Location is great though!

Drinks are outstanding, service is great. The breakfast options are cooked to perfection, including the breakfast burrito and corn beef hash, which is out of this world. Make an appearance here at least 2-3 times/month for brunch!

I love Luxbar for brunch.  I've tried the pancakes, breakfast burrito, house made turkey sausage and they were all great.  The outdoor street dining is a nice spot to sit in the sun and dine.  The staff were all very nice and service was fast
Luxbar is pretty average. Nothing spectacular but nothing horrible. They have a good turkey burger and  margaritas are good

We came here for brunch/lunch with friends and had a great time! Decor: On a nice day, outside is where you want to sit. However, those tables are where EVERYONE wants to sit. But inside is nice too. It has a kind of old school pub look/feel to it. It's pretty cool. There is also plenty of space if you have a big group (like we did). Although, I will say that the tables seem VERY close together (and this is coming from a New Yorker!), we almost couldn't even pull chairs away from the table to sit down. Bathroom: It's nice and inviting. Not too well lit but neither is the restaurant itself. Staff: Our waitress was fine, nothing special. She wasn't speedy but wasn't slow either, and all our food came out at the same time. She could have been better about keeping our waters filled though. Food/Drink: General consensus (of the whole group) was that the food was good. We had the sliders (pretty standard) and the club sandwich w/ chips (DELICIOIUS!!). We also had a few beers, of which they don't have a very extensive selection. Value: Given the location the prices were reasonable. Depending on what you order you definitely get your money's worth (e.g. the club sandwich is a great value!) This was a good spot to grab a bite and I would return, if I were in the area, for another meal (hopefully being able to sit outside!)

I can't believe I've never written a review on this place as it absolutely one of my FAV spots in the city.  I've been here numerous times and don't believe I've ever had a bad experience.  Even one time we came for St Pattys Day brunch to start off our day (which has become a tradition) and our server spilled some Guiness on my white sweater, the manager was happy to take care of the cleaning bill.  The staff is great from the hostess to the servers to the bartenders, hell the bathroom attendant was great too.  The food is AWESOME, I don't think I've had a bad meal here once and the drinks are SUPER yummy, regardless of what you drink.  One suggestion, the old fashion with Buffalo Trace, YUMMO!  I also had a yummy watermelon drink made with cucumber vodka, talk about a refreshing delight on a warm summer day.  I just can't say enough of this place and will continue to come even after I move away from the city.  SO many fun times have been had at this place and it's a GREAT place for groups!
We stopped in for breakfast and found the omlets, sausage, pancake and waffles to be very good. The only thing to make it better would be if they heated the syrup!

My girl and I decided to try out a new restaurant to eat for lunch. The appeal went down fast. 1. No greating from inside host and giving us a blank stare. 2. Food arrived 25min after order taken. 3. Food came out cold and burnt. 4. No table touch from a Manager. Terrible experience here. We don't recommend this place and will not be returning.

Total FAN! Buffalo Chicken Salad. Get it? Got it? Fab! I love this whole place I would build another location next to my house if I could. The atmosphere, the servers, the bartenders, are just top notch! Will be going back often!

Great Gold Coast spot for a casual lunch or dinner. Lux is always bustling with people - great vibe! Food is always great and service is equal. We just had lunch one of the sandwiches came a bit different than described and my wife are it anyways. After the waitress asked how everything was my wife told her it was not expected that the sandwich would have all of the condiments - she gladly removed it from the bill.  Highly recommend.

Went here for the first time last week and can see it becoming a staple.  High quality food, great service, reasonably priced.  Unique mixed drink choices available and mine was delicious.  The guy next to our table ordered the fried chicken which made my mouth water.  Definitely plan to go back!

Absolutely delicious fried chicken. Fries were far too salty but manger was  very professional and apologetic and gave us a sundae on the house which was good too. Great food and atmosphere, definitely worth a visit.
I love this place. I've eaten here numerous times and each time I am impressed.

This place rocks on a number of levels. Service was beyond fabulous. Host (Paul) was so concerned that it took about 20 min longer than what he estimated.  No big deal (to us) but he felt badly.  The server Damien was fantastic. Gave great suggestions, had great energy and even told us a few hidden things we could order OFF the menu. The outdoor tables are great on a warm summer night and lastly the food was awesome. Fried Chicken was enough for  a BIG person and was way tasty, hot and crispy.  If you are going to consume 10,000 calories it needs to be worth it. Moscow Mules were great too. And value was amazing too. Can't wait to go back. Way better than the overly saturated neighbor Tavern on Rush next door. Thanks all for a great evening!
Whenever I have been to Luxbar it has been busy. However I wasn't all that wowed. The drink and food options are good but it's pricey and loud.

Good place for lunch. Horrible for dinner. First went there  for lunch and prices were reasonable, burger was good.  Went for dinner and prices were still reasonable, but the place was LOUD LOUD LOUD.  Got the hanger steak and it was dry with no flavor. Mashed potatoes  had no flavor and the Mac and cheese tasted like it came out of a box.  But the noise was overwhelming and irritating. People were shouting because they couldn't hear each other. Not good. I give it 3 stars because the burger at lunch was good and it's quiet because it wasn't crowded.

I've been to Luxbar many times in the past, but I must point out that my past visit was exceptional. We were seated quickly during the busy lunch hour in the Viagra Triangle area on a Friday which was the first plus. It was a special day for me, as I had just 'said yes' to my wedding dress down the street with my family & bridesmaids. We had a party of 10 and the manager- Michael (?) promptly asked what we were celebrating, and upon finding out the occasion, he served us two complimentary bottles of prosecco to toast! It made the day just perfect. It's nice to know that this place still regards customer service as the utmost importance; small gestures go a long way! Thank you Luxbar!!

It was a stormy night and we wanted to show our girl in from Cali a good time. After running through a lists of restaurants I decided to go with my old faithful Luxbar :) I have been here for brunch and dinner and like always this place is pack!! Just like always though the staff is friendly and with no reservations at 9:30 on a Thursday night they were able to squeeze us in and we got a table in a matter of minutes. Our waiter (shout out to JJ) was a sweetheart. We were ready for some cocktails and he did a great job helping us make our selection. Watch out for the Rose! It has a light taste but will sneak up on you...2...3 of these...lol and your done. The Hibiscus was good as well. I wasn't a fan though of the orange blossom.  My girl called it "the no playing around drink " it was strong and the taste I would liken it to peeling an orange and then just chewing on the peel for a while. The truffle fries were good, but I wish they had been a little less crispier. Chips and dip were average. As for the atmosphere it's lovely and everyone looked like they were having a good time. I know we were. ;) I forget about this place a lot, but always have such a good time when I go!

An absolute solid bet in the Gold Coast. Granted, there is stiff competition and everything around here is good, but I really think Luxbar is the hidden gem. By NOT facing the triangle, it tends to be slightly less crowded. I was able to walk in on a Saturday night recently and get seated at a table immediately. By 7:30 it had filled up, but everything else at 6 was already jam-packed and had a wait. My brother put it very succinctly after his first visit: the service is well-above expectations. The servers are professional, attentive, and prompt but not overbearing. Frankly, this is exactly how wait staff should do things! A definite hat-tip to them for having their act together. The food, in general, is quite good. Luxbar is owned by the same company as some other popular Gold Coast places and they clearly use the same suppliers, which equates to some high-quality food without the inflated prices. I am a particularly big fan of the burgers and I believe they've been consistently top-rated in the city for a number of years. I did brunch here once and liked it, but would much rather visit for the hamburgers. Make Luxbar your go-to place in the triangle. It is a bit more relaxed but still very enjoyable without insane prices or unbearable wait-times.
They have legendary crab bisque and the atmosphere is quite vibrant. Pretty popular place at the weekends.

Quick tips: Cute "hip" place in "Viagra Triangle." Right as we were seated we saw a significantly older man with a younger woman and tried to figure out if it was a father-daughter relationship or the neighborhood name was truly accurate. Great ambiance, good food, and poor service.  The honey butter that comes with the pancakes was the highlight for me.  The coffee was the low point.  Food: We ordered the pancakes and the chicago scramble (prime ground beef, sautéed onions, bell peppers. hash browns, toast). The food was good, not bad not great but good. Again, I would come back and get the pancakes just for the honey butter, it added the perfect sweetness to my pancakes, I didn't need syrup. However, I would get coffee before I come here next time - it was quite bitter.  Ambiance: i think the main reason I would come back is possibly for a drink on their outside patio. Lots of fun people watching.  Service: Poor. I wanted to give our tip directly to the busboy because our waiter wasn't around. That may be due to our specific waiter because it didn't seem like the restaurant had him slammed.

We got our mixed drinks at the very busy bar and were seated shortly at our reserved table. My boyfriend and I shared some sliders. I would say in a city like Chicago, this place buzzin' like any place with a decent menu and good drinks should be on a Friday night. It's a good spot to go with friends, relatively loud, and has enough options to keep everyone satisfied. We had good service and drinks, our food was decent, so overall you get three stars, Lux.

Waste of money!  Food was bad!  It tasted like it was frozen and microwaved. My salmon tasted fishy and their shrimp cocktail was the smallest 3 pieces of shrimp I have ever seen.  We waited 20 minutes for our drinks and when we tasted them they were obviously weak and mixed improperly.  The service was nonexistent and annoying to have to keep waiving down for a napkin or utensils.  The ambiance was uncomfortable- louder than average and the tables are set too close together.  Also the chairs are very uncomfortable. We wanted to leave immediately, but made the mistake of "just try it".

Positives: good beer list, very nice server, my beet salad was yummy and it's nice to be able to order the sliders a la carte. Negatives: my friend ordered the buffalo chicken salad and it looked terrible (chicken was dry too) and we sent it back. She then ordered a filet slider medium and it came out mooing.

Excellent service from Christina. Delicious calamari with an Asian influence. After being fried with a light breading, it seemed they added a drizzle of sesame sauce -just a bit. It was excellent. Also included in the mix were lightly fried red and green bell peppers. Nice touch!  The shrimp cocktail was good, but nothing noteworthy.  We dined outside and as the evening rolled on, the air became chilly. Christina had no problem allowing us to make a mid-meal move to a recently vacated table closer to the heat lamps. It was table for four, but we were just two.  I enjoyed a couple glasses of a light, crisp Sauv Blanc from Marlborough NZ. Tasted his French Chardonnay, which was similarly light and fitting for this meal. Note: I was not a fan of the lipped wine glasses.  Roasted beet salad was so beautiful! I asked for it to be served on a bed of greens and they happily obliged. The light-handed dressing and large chunks of blue cheese scattered throughout pleased me. It was a large portion and I was happy to bring home leftovers.  Steak salad with iceberg lettuce cooked medium was made just as ordered. The peppery steak took center stage on this plate and were well-supported by a generous helping of crumbled blue cheese.  Not much else going on with this salad. I would have welcomed the addition of red onion and cherry tomatoes.  Overall great experience. I will be back!

Luxbar may seem like a few different things at once such as an Irish bar in a hotel with a Malibu like front patio but the Prince Edward Muscles did not disappoint. The young, handsome barkeep was friendly, chatty and totally peeled away the snotty perception I had about the place. It's not so different from the vibe in nearby Gibsons, but sorry,  you'll also have to go upstairs to let those beers lose.

My wife and I were in Chicago on vacation.  We ended up at Luxbar from walking around, and were lured in by the picture perfect sidewalk patio.   It's like a scene from a movie.  We made our reservation for dinner, and had a wonderful time.  Being from L.A. we aren't use to professionals who know how to run a place, rather than come and go wanna be production types.  The food was wonderful, and the drinks were just perfect.  The bar is epic, and the place has such a welcome vibe.  We felt as if we were adopted.  Michael took care of us, along with the others.  We never felt rushed, even though the place was packed.  Chicago is awesome.  Luxbar is awesome.

It is a good, consistent, and dependable restaurant. The food is good, worth the experience. I usually get the burger, it's better than average. The fries are just average. The staff is very friendly, try very hard, make the experience welcoming, and seem to care. The bar is nice. The rest of the menu is also good, and the deserts are very good, above average.  All in all it's good local place, if you are not from the area and walking the rush street area, it is worth a try.

luxbar,  you are the real deal. industry night on monday's for fellow hospitality slaves. waitresses are classy, professional, and know the menu. food is fresh and drinks are mean. managers always come over and check to see how your doing. what more can you ask for? see ya monday ;)

I had been wanting to check this place out for awhile. Decor very chic, Service...great! The truffle fries I thought were overrated. The seared Yellow Fin...AWESOME!!!!!! Tuna Tarte....UGH! Will I go back? Absolutely! The atmosphere for a Friday night was very laid back not what we expected in the Viagra Triangle. Definitely a date or girls night out place

Always a solid spot with many options on the menu. My staples are usually the grilled calamari (has a great kick), the truffle mac and cheese, and the buffalo chicken salad. The drink options are fantastic, and they also make a great Moscow Mule. The desserts are ginormous. Perfect for sharing with a huge table.  The place gets packed around the bar area at happy hour and on weekends, but the bartenders are quick and attentive.  Love coming here for lunch in the summer when you can sit outside.

Being new to Chicago, it is a new concept for me to have to make a reservation nearly every time I eat out. With that being said, I finally learned my lesson and made a reservation for my boyfriend and I to dine at Luxbar on a Friday night. Unfortunately, making a reservation does not always shield you from the effects of an over-crowded restaurant.  We were seated near the host stand (UGHHHH) and a family of four waited to be seated with their backs literally touching our table. Standing in front of our table, they also blocked the television so we couldn't watch the basketball game which was our reason for going out. The table behind us was so close that there wasn't room for the server to get between our chairs. The server had to pass my drinks/plates down the table to get them to me.  Busboys tried to take my half-eaten burger away like 3 times before I was finished! Didn't even ask if I was finished the first time. I know I may be a small woman but I would like to finish my meal...thanks. Then to top if off the server brought us our check without asking if we wanted anything else. We were 100% planning to hang out and drink for a few hours! Instead we paid and went somewhere else for more drinks. Definitely got the vibe that they wanted us out in order to seat everyone that was hoovering over our meal.  On the positive side, the Gourmet Burger (medium rare), fries, grapefruit cocktale, and club sandwich was great. However, I was very irritated throughout our entire experience so it was a challenge to enjoy...

There was a wait and when we decided to leave since we were starving the FOH Manager was amazing and hooked us up with a table upstairs by the window where it was much more quiet and intimate. (An ideal) The most amazing burger, and perfect lunch spot. The staff couldn't be any friendlier or nice.

Luxbar isn't your average bar. They have a great selection of food to choose from and the hospitality is always fantastic! They also make some of the most original drinks around. There's so many good things on the menu. But the the last time I was there I had the cured salmon for brunch and it was delicious, not too salty like some places. It's also very nice to sit outside in the summertime because you're in the center of everything. The Manager John is the best too! I noticed that he stopped by nearly every table to make sure everyone was enjoying themselves. Would highly recommend Luxbar for an all around great experience.

Went into here on a -20 degree day and it was worth the wallk in the door. It's been a few months since I've been but I do remember the food was excellent and so were the drinks. The star of Luxbar is the bar. Don't order off the menu. ABSOLUTELY make sure you sit at the bar and start asking the bartender to make whatever (s)he suggests. Top notch drinks, never before heard of spirits, and an amazing night!

Love this place.  Made a reservation for 1230pm today for 10 peoples which included 4 kids under 10, including a 5 month old.  By the time we got there the young one was asleep in her stroller.  The place was packed and we assumed they would not allow us to bring the stroller to the table.  To our surprise, the staff let us bring everything to the table.  Everyone was very helpful in getting us situated. On top of that, the food, as usual. Was awesome.  One of our favorite spots...

I've been to lux many times and the best way to describe it is consistent. I've had many different things and most of them didn't blow me away. I would have to recommend the chili and the skirt steak as those items were the best of the meals I had. The desserts are pretty good with the snickers pie headlining the group. It is huge and can feed at least 3 people.  The service has been hit or miss but never completely terrible. It is usually pretty slammed and they like to put the tables close together. I wouldn't recommend it if you're looking for a place to have a quiet conversation but it is a decent place to get a meal and some drinks in the Gold Coast.

Delicious food. The service was great. The location was perfect. Very modern Place with great drinks. The tomato soup with grilled cheese was so yummy. And their chocolate chip cookie dessert was perfect and chunks of chocolate

This review is for brunch only: it's solid. Pecan pancakes and eggs benedict were well done, no complaints. Good ambiance and good service. Got a table for 2 on Saturday at noon without a reservation or a wait! That may have just been luck + polar vortex 3, but still, a pretty decent option as a last minute gold coast brunch spot.

When hungry and in the good old Viagra Triangle, LUXBAR is always a safe bet. While the food isn't slap ya mamma (and run) amazing; it is consistently good. The service is also top notch with I always appreciate.  LUXBAR is also a great place to come to to enjoy some adult beverages, especially in the summer time. I seem to make my way here at least one Saturday a month in the summer (don't judge me). If you decide to dine here I recommend you try: - Appetizer: CHIPS & DIP house cut waffle chips, caramelized onion dip - Entrees: Buttermilk Fried Half Chicken & Country Style Corned Beef Hash -Dessert: LUXBAR Snickers Pie (this is HUGE and can be shared between 2 - 3 people)

Had dinner there the other night, the whitefish was awesome and great quality for the value! I really enjoy a place that had good signature cocktails. The ambiance is fantastic and our service was very good too but too awhile to get our cocktails. The cookie Sunday is a must!!

Luxbar was underwhelming and overwhelming at the same time. A group of six of us came in this weekend around noon for brunch and right off the bat, I was apprehensive about the atmosphere.  For the overwhelming part, it was packed at noon this weekend for brunch - not surprising, but the way they pack those tables together is just horrible! We had a table in the back corner on the first floor next to the fireplace, which was nice until they seated the tables around us. I had to scoot my chair in closer to the table (TOO close to the table) in order to not hit the girl sitting behind me. At one point in time, I was trying to talk to the two girls next to me but it was literally so loud in the restaurant that they couldn't hear me, even when I was yelling.  On the underwhelming side, the service was barely there - took our orders, dropped the food off, and never checked back. The bus boy who cleared our table used my dining space to collect and re-organize the plates he was carrying and at one point even left a few of my friends' half-eaten dishes in front of me because he couldn't carry them. It was super uncomfortable and just all around not even the minimum service I would expect. The food was uninspired...I mean, I got oatmeal, so I wasn't looking for anything too special, but the pomegranate jam had little flavor and the oatmeal itself seemed to be overcooked. The ladies I was with ordered a variety of soups and salads and I didn't hear anyone even comment on their food, much less rave about it.  The more I eat in the Gold Coast, the more I'm feeling like the food there is overrated...hoping to find a restaurant soon that debunks that thought, but Luxbar was not the place.

My partner-in-crime isn't big into cider, he's into rye. When my date for Cider Summit had a conflict, he knew he had the pleasure of being my stand-in. To try and sweeten the deal, I suggested we hit Luxbar afterward. Manhattan's have become hot. Personally, I have an aversion to scotch, whiskey and many other brown liquors, but when it comes to Manhattan's, I have his back. I follow 312DD's blog and saw a feature on Luxbar's Make Your Own (Rye) Manhattan special for the month of February; strangely, the menu isn't really promoted. If you're interested, ask for it - had I not read about it, I don't think we would've been the wiser. I wasn't sure what to expect from Luxbar; I intentionally avoid the Viagra Triangle whenever possible. Frankly, I was pleasantly surprised; while the decor seems very classy and upscale, on a Saturday afternoon the vibe was quite casual. He started out with the bartender's signature Manhattan and then followed up with his own creation choosing his rye, vermouth, bitters and type of ice. I went with the Red Azalea, at the recommendation of our server. We loved our drinks; mine, a mix of vodka, shiraz and mulling spices was surprisingly excellent. We also had a snack, the seared yellowfin appetizer; good, but nothing so unique it would warrant a trip back for it. While Luxbar hasn't changed my feelings about the Viagra Triangle, they make a great cocktail and would get my business if I were nearby again and parched.
Great burgers, great service and a good whiskey selection. A good alternative to other places in the area. Decent choice of craft beers on draft too.
Great place for brunch. Amazing corned beef hash. Reasonably priced for the neighborhood it is in. The wait staff is all friendly and the place is very clean.
Love this place...consistently great food and  service. I have been here probably 50 times and have left extremely satisfied every time.

Make reservations. Great place for fun loud dinners. Bathrooms on 2nd floor. Valet. Apparently across from Viagra Triangle (Where young girls hang out to meet much older men), you can order food for kids but no apparent menu for it....

Return review:  not awesome.  Sadly this place was not the hotspot it once was.   Truffle fries. Awesome. Mac and cheese.  Just ok. Filet slider.  Didn't finish, and not memorable.   Pair that with an overzealous busboy who was reaching around us like an octopus  to clean off the table while we were all 4 trying to put our coats and hats and scarves and gloves on(it is Chicago, right?) and you have an expensive and just ok food night. Hope it was just an off night!

Wow! They make some big deserts here! Not only that but they have some amazing burgers, truffle fries and drinks too.  My only advice is to order desert FIRST! That way you can doggie bag your meal and have room to eat it! This was the first place I wasn't able to finish the whole desert.  The snickers pie is essentially a giant cake of ice cream! Service could be a little better, but overall a good experience.

Great spot for brunch in the Gold Coast area. It's usually easier than some of its close competitors to get a table as well. It's owned by the same group as Gibsons - so their sliders are fantastic.  I highly recommend the Moscow Mules if you are in the mood. Fair warning - expect to pay $12 for each one. Definitely the best I've found in Chicago.
Nice and relaxing atmosphere.  They make a pretty good burger.  Besides the burgers not much else really excites me on the menu.  It is a good place to go to once in a while.

Everything about this place says understated elegance.  The location in the heart of the Gold Coast, right near Tavern on Rush.  The darkened, intimate decor and lighting.  The custom drinks made for someone who knows, and appreciates, their liquors.  And finally, the food: from truffle fries that will rock your world to a lobster slider that will make you forget beef hamburgers even existed.  Luxbar takes what a lot of other restaurants in its neighborhood are doing, and then elevates it.

I really enjoyed the service and food here.  The waitress was really knowledgeable on suggesting something delicious.  A friend and I were just on Michigan Ave shopping and ran into this because we walked by one of the side streets.  Service was fast and there was a nice atmosphere. Wow and their Mac N Cheese was delicious!!  I forgot what burger I got, but it was really good too (Gourmet burger or something like that) lol. I will definitely be back to try more of their food and some of their drinks!
Delicious Moscow Mule! Also amazing food! Great atmosphere for special occasions. Also wonderful breakfast!

This was my go to brunch spot in my neighborhood for the past several months.  At one time coming here on a weekly basis.  The breakfast items are fantastic.  Great eggs benedict, omelets, etc.  Nice bar with plenty of options for brunch style cocktails, and a great little front patio for nice days. So why two stars?  I ate dinner here.   To start off the menu on here, their website, and in the restaurant are all completely different.  So don't explore the menu, as they don't find it necessary to update it.   We started with a couple of appetizers: Lobster Bisque and shrimp cocktail.  The lobster bisque was great as usual, but the cocktail sauce for the shrimp was pretty much just ketchup.  I added more horseradish, but it was old and jarred so had no heat or flavor.  The waitress wasn't very good throughout the meal.  She couldn't explain dishes, didn't talk to us (seemed shy), and had no recommendations for anything.  Had a bottle of wine, which wasn't good by any means as the wine list is non existent, and when the girl bought it she just unscrewed it and filled our glasses.  First time i've ever bought a bottle and not at least been shown the label. Now for the reason I won't be coming here anymore.  I had browsed the menu via Yelp and saw they had a 10 oz filet for $38, and was excited to have that for my meal.  As I said the menu online (everywhere) isn't the one you get here so obviously my steak was no longer available.  I asked about it and the waitress said they had a 7oz filet still so I opted for it.  When my bill arrived she showed me that I had a reduced price because it was only 7 oz; total $38.  I said that the 10 oz online was that price already and thought surely I would be charged less as it was 30% smaller.  I was told I saw the menu wrong, that it use to be $41, and I had already received my discount. Well Luxbar, it was nice knowing you.  I hate being lied to, over charged, and treated poorly.  So I hope your $10 or so you gouged me for is worth the couple hundred dollars in business I brought you month over month, not to mention bringing my friends in.  I will not be back, and I can only hope that you don't take advantage of all your customers.
Stopped in for a late breakfast on a Saturday. They had a cozy fire going. Eggs Benedict were great and the service was excellent. Nice energetic atmosphere.

I'm writing this finally because of the fantastic experience with the New beverage head Matt "choo"! Food has always been great. Best accommodations in town I would sat. Hummus platter to die for. Recently my stop however was  Enlightened when Matt was behind the bar. Crafting my cocktail and explaining everything to me. Then answering all of my Eritreans about his other drinks on the list.  The mulled cider cocktail was divine. Everything was. Kudos luxbar for bringing some diversity to the triangle.
Dropped into Lux after Cubs game and had a drink at bar. Bartender Will makes a great Manhattan. Everyone is very friendly. Great spot!
Great atmosphere, good beer and cocktails. The food was delicious and the desert ice cream cake was massive- 6 people easily fed off of it- and it was only $8. Vegetarian friendly menu.

Came here for brunch on a Saturday around 2. It was pretty packed but we got a table quickly. It's a very classy looking location but the noise level detracts somewhat. We were served by maybe 3 different people, one to take our order, another to bring the food, and one to take the bill. Even so, service was quick and courteous. I ordered the corned beef hash and it was delicious. It was crispy and chewy in all the right ways. Runny egg yolk from over easy eggs and some toast to sop it all up made for a fantastic meal. My friend had the Lux burger and I think he said it was pretty good though I can't personally attest to it. I did mooch off some of his fries though and they were pretty good too. We also ordered some mimosas. It's always a good thing when the mimosa is mostly champagne and that's exactly you get. But at 9 dollars a glass they add up quickly, and you can never really have just one mimosa. Great food, fun atmosphere, good service. Check it out.

Lux Bar had a great atmosphere. You kind of feel like you should be dressed up when you go in, it's almost like you've gone back in time and want to put on a flapper costume. The drinks were made pretty strong, which is always a plus for me. :) The food was decent. We did some basic appetizers, chicken fingers, guacamole, quesadillas and fries. They were pretty standard, the guac and chips were probably my favorite. Warm corn tortilla chips and chunky fresh guac. I got the Sesame Crusted Tuna as my main dish and was not super satisfied. The presentation was excellent however there wasn't really too much taste to the dish as a whole. Maybe I should have asked for more dressing!  Definitely a great bar to stop by in you're in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way to grab any food there.

Been there many a time with family, long wait but like the views of mag mile, food is subpar for the location, always packed even during the week. Its a good place to bring tired guests after shopping for the experience.

Had dinner here at our friends' suggestion.  It's a very nice, inviting place, friendly service.  Three of us just headed straight for the prime rib, which was just right, pink nearer to red.  Excellent.  My hubby bucked the trend by ordering the fried chicken, which our friends have had before and suggested.  Delicious!  Couple bottles of great wine, and we were set for the evening.  Very enjoyable.
I love this place.  The food and the service is excellent.  I had the best turkey burger that I've ever had here.  The Moscow Mule cocktail is fantastic.
I've never actually tried the food here... but I have been here maybe like 7 times... only for the amazing Snickers Ice cream pie.... amazing. $8
Outdoor seating is nice except for when you have to sit next to the awkward trees. Truffle fries were on point! Customer service was alright. Overall, good dinner spot.
Had breakfast here a couple of days ago. It was a good breakfast. Not crowded. They has good prices. I will definitely go back.

Went here for Sunday brunch. It was pretty standard breakfast fare. Could have been better, could have been worse. Excellent service though. Nice hostesses, good management presence. We had Eddie as our server who was one of the more personable and attentive servers I've had in a while.

This place has a great atmosphere, awesome wine menu, and delicious food. The best part about it though, was definitely the service. The staff was very friendly, we were asked how everything was going by servers/bussers who weren't even taking care of our table. Amazing fries. Great mussels, and crab bisque.

Great location with outside seating, excellent service.  Had an Irish coffee and sipped it like it was 10 dollars (it was) but it was good and my group seemed pleased with their meals.  We had a good time there.

While in Chicago last weekend for one of the greatest rivalry's in baseball, the Cardinals vs.the Cubs, my friends and I woke up with some empty stomachs. With the much anticipated game approaching rather fast we all decided that we needed to get ready and go somewhere for brunch. The lady that we were staying with (my friends aunt) decided on taking us to Luxbar. It was one of the only places she could think of that serves brunch and she insisted that it was delicious. Now let me tell you, she was right on the money. After reading the menu I decided to go with one of my favorite breakfast dishes, the breakfast burrito. When the waiter finally approached with our food I could not believe my eyes, the size of this burrito was very unexpected. When ordering a breakfast burrito at most places I'm expecting them to be a decent size but not this large. At the moment I laid eyes on my plate I became overwrought with joy. My first and much anticipated bite I couldn't of been more pleased. The combination of egg, chorizo, peppers and onions were in perfect ratio with one an other. But that wasn't it, BLACK BEANS !!!!!! I have never had a breakfast burrito with black beans. With my love for black beans I was completely overjoyed. This was definitely one of the best breakfast burritos I have ever had. Beside from the food the service was excellent. There was never a time through out the whole meal where I had to wait for a drink or even ask for a refill. The waiter we had was also very knowledgeable about the restaurant and the food he was serving. Luxbar also gets some or all, (I cant remember what he said), their food from a local farm near Chicago. Personally to me a cow is a cow and a chicken is a chicken, but to you whom care about such things I thought you should know. All in all luxbar is a great place for brunch. Everyone in the party enjoyed their food and as you can see I enjoyed mine. Thanks for reading and if you ever venture to the windy city and wake up to late for breakfast or too early for lunch try some brunch at......... Luxbar.

This is a favorite of mine. When I first moved into the GC hood one of the managers told me " we want you to think of this as your second home" WOW.  Needless to say no one has ever said anything like that to me besides for my ex father in law to be :) Alas it was not to be. Recently I have become a fan of their Tuna melt which is just as good as the steak. I may have to take a break from eating here for a few months or just start eating the salads since that what my trainer for working out and nutrition has told me to do. Or maybe I can stick with the salad. This is a good place to socialize with others or to meet people who are interested in socializing
Very conceited staff. Turkey burger just okay. Everything overpriced. Don't even ask if they have any specials, you will get a rude response.

$12-15 burgers - The burger was decent...but I've had way better. But for $12, plain potato chips are not an acceptable side to even offer, what was I thinking? Their draft beer selection is pretty good, but at $8.25 and $11.25 for two different draft beers - that is just outrageous! (Oh don't worry about not putting the prices on your menu, I'll just find out how much you are raping me when I get the bill). The top craft beer bars in the city (Maproom, Hopleaf, Local Option , etc...) wouldn't charge $11.25 for the beers Luxbar features. I probably won't return.

This is a great place to be a bar. Luxbar is a bar with upgraded food but still at very reasonable prices. We went twice in the same week with a couple of friends and had a good time. Service was attentive and very nice, the food as said is not your typical bar food, it's much better, well cared for. Sliders with filet mignon? Yes!! The Hummus is pretty good if you like hummus.  Tomato and Grilled Cheese soup  -my buddy had it and said he liked it, smooth and creamy Steak and Chili beans soup- rich, nicely done, good quality of meat, a hearty soup. As mentioned the filet mignon sliders were nice, and we also had the filet mignon dish, nice and tender.  This place has also a decent varieties of beers and we tried a few from microbreweries. We liked them all, Goose Island 312, Cross Of Gold, Sofie. It's a nice place for when you don't want to splurge in a restaurant and you want a more casual environment but you still don't want to be limited to fried food and some regular burgers.  Location of course is great, in the Near North area.

I began the celebration of my 21st birthday here by accident! Originally planned on going to The Cedar Hotel but they had closed last minute due to weather, and we ended up at Luxbar. There was about 8 of us to begin with and ended with about 12. The staff was AMAZINGLY accommodating for such a big group at the last minute. Their service was above and beyond. Extremely nice and speedy service! They even provided a round of shots on the house which was just so nice!  Our waiter, Travis was awesome as well as the host/manager, not sure of his name, Nick maybe?  The food was also amazing! I got the turkey burger and it was so delicious!  Overall fantastic experience and I couldn't have asked for a better place to eat at for my 21st!  Thanks Luxbar and everyone who made it a great night!

I wasn't able to spend as much time in this place as I wanted to. That being said I was pleased with the service and the cocktails. The bathroom was exceptionally clean and the place had a nice comfortable feel throughout.
Went Wednesday night for dinner with my cousins..food was amazeballs, service was excellent, atmosphere was cozy, yet lively, I will be going back!
Unbelievable Small slides... Beef my preferred.. Nice place, reasonable prices for the service/food quality
Great martinis, great sevice, must try the jalepeno, bacon mac n' cheese, to die for!!!!! short wait for a table on a Thur. night.

Like other places in the area, it's the place where people with small penises and fat bank accounts hang out.  Honestly, I'm searching for a reason to eat here but can't.  It's not like anything is bad, it's actually pretty decent.  The veggie burger was respectable, although far short of the "best I've ever had" label my girlfriend gave it.  You can always drink.  I hate the area, the crowd...etc.  Not my thing.  It's the place Don Draper would eat at if Mad Men was written by NBC.

Had such a fantastic lunch here! Luxbar is very much a "scene" as it's situated right in the Viagra Triangle. We made a reservation in advance (necessary for a beautiful Sunday morning) and scored a table outside with Rachel D, Amy F, and Sunny H.  To start, our waiter was funny and attentive. He was present from the beginning to the end of the meal. Additionally, he was able to split the tab amongst four credit cards which was very helpful. Luxbar has a huge menu and we had the misfortune of having to choose between breakfast and lunch. I'm going to need to go back for breakfast, some of the menu items made my decision incredibly difficult. I ended up going with the soup/sandwich combo of rotisserie chicken soup and the Lux Club. The soup was flavorful and tasted homemade, which is awesome. The Lux Club was a large sandwich that featured turkey, avocado, cheese, etc., and was delicious. I was really happy with my choices. My dining companions had salads and the tuna melt, all of which looked fantastic. The tuna melt was a gargantuan, melty creation that everyone was envious of. Overall, I'll definitely be back for a great meal in a very convenient location!

I come here a lot after work for drinks and apps. The hummus plate is one of my favorite things on the menu. Fun bar scene,but not too loud that you can't hear the people at your table talk. The staff is great and very friendly. If you like Moscow Mules, this is your place!  I'm not giving it 5 stars because they took off my favorite thing on the menu - the tuna tartare with mango and wonton chips.

Loud and crowded on a Sunday morning, but in a good way. We sit in the bar area so we don't have to wait for a table. Excellent service, great breakfasts, fair prices. Wasn't a fan of their cappuccino, but the fresh-squeezed OJ was divine. I love the spinach eggs Benedict and the breakfast burrito, both of which are huge portions.

Exterior: 5/5 Interior: 4/5 (I don't like that the tables and chair are REALLY tall and hard to get into if you're under 5'6") Customer Service: 5/5 Presentation: 3-4/5 (nothing special, or un-special) Drinks: 2.5-3/5 - Nice location and roomy.  It's in the Gold Coast, Viagra Triangle (for non-Chicagoans, explained in the next paragraph).  If I ever come here (I usually don't), I sit here for 1/2 a drink and some TV before going to The Drawing Room for a real drink, then Gibson's bar for food.  I LOVE Gibson's ribs at the bar, if you went to cotillion or learned how to eat ribs pretty, def give it a whirl here. **note: Viagra Triangle is an aerial view "triangle" of buildings in the Gold Coast.  These buildings are generally night clubs, bars, nice dinner spots.  It's "Viagra Triangle" because it's nightlife is populated by older (like 40/50+) successful sugar-daddy businessmen and young (20-28) young girls who are generally dressed and packaged nicely.  In my experience, it is true that the men in this locale are older than you'd find in River North locales. For example, Hub51: men 28-40.  Gibson's bar, men 38+.  At Luxbar, they're 40-45+.  Once my 22-year-old friend was unrelentlessly hit on by a 55-60 year old who has a 21-year old daughter.  Very strange, but supposedly typical of the area. - Mediocre drinks (not great, not bad).  Of course, drinks are a little pricier, but for this price you can get a 50x better drink at The Drawing Room. - Nice customer service, friendly.  Once I came with 2 friends, 1 was under 21, but they let her sit at the bar with water. ----- I'd recommend to stop by once, and then head on over to Gibson's or the Drawing Room or Privet.  Gibson's has a nice atmosphere somewhat similar to Hub51's, though more upscale.  The Drawing Room makes amazing drinks that are strong, but un-noticeably so.  Also, it's very classy and nice but low key.  The waiters and bartenders are great at the Drawing Room, make accurate recommendations, and are friendly.

We went in on a Sunday afternoon for a drink and something to eat. I found the place to be very relaxing and comfortable to be in. Food and drinks were great. Service was fantastic. We will be back!!!

I had a pretty memorable filet minon here.  The service was always pleasant and it wasn't too spendy.  I really liked the fireplace on a snowy day.  The service was way better than most places in this price category.
Always a great time...good food, reasonable prices and a fun crowd!

Update: I had a chance to come back with my wife today for lunch. The burger royale was amazing as usual. Greasy but amazing beef flavors. The restaurant was also accommodating and allowed us to have the baby stroller at tableside in the back. Our orders were taken fast and the meal was perfect!

My boyfriend and I were hungry, after having met up with his classmates for a happy hour. Instead of getting food there (not exactly a ton of choices), we made his way back to his neighborhood. For a Saturday night, I was pretty impressed at how quickly they were able to get us a table (we only waited about 10 or so minutes). We were both in a burger mood, so the Luxburger it was (and I got mine with a fried egg on top- one of my favorite things on a burger). The burger definitely hit the mark- exactly what I was craving. A bit messy, yes- but that's what you get with a burger with a fried egg on it. The truffle fries were also worth the extra fee, and the truffle mac and cheese was also divine.

I passed Luxbar while walking to my apartment last week and was intrigued. I invited a friend out to dinner on a Friday night and we were able to get a reservation the same day for 8:00PM. I was surprised to get a same day reservation, but I kept an open mind regarding my expectations.  The ambience was different from what I was expecting. It had more of a family Italian restaurant vibe than a Gold Coast restaurant, but it was comforting. I ordered a pomegranate martini which hit the spot. I also ordered a burger with their truffle fries. Both were delicious, but the burger kept falling apart and made for a messy meal. The truffle fries were worth the additional $2.  I would definitely come back here for a late night dinner with friends.

This is a late review as I took some out of town friends here in late February for dinner on a Friday night. The place had a great vibe with ultra-accommodating servers. What they did to help a guy in a wheelchair maneuver through a crowded restaurant was fantastic. The food was very good and moderately priced for Gold Coast with the only possible negatives being the loudness of the music and how close the tables were to one another. My friends liked it and I like the extra effort the servers always show so this is an easy four stars for me!
great place, always come here with girlfriends and sit at the bar. Drinks and dessert its perfect.

It's a little past 11pm, after a failed attempt at hitting up a closed Tortas Frontera at the airport, we had the worst combo of tired and hungry. On top of that I'd lost my voice. I was in no mood to go anywhere with swanky dinner theatrics, but Luxbar was like a shining beacon of sustenance.  Compared to the weekend brunch crowd, the late weekday dinner scene was my kinda atmosphere. A quiet handful hanging out by the bar, a cozy couple seated in their own section...romancin'. We opted to sit in our own little booth. My dysfunctional voicebox left me playing charades with our server. She was so sweet, noticed how painful it was to communicate that she offered to bring me some honey with my tea. The soup and turkey sliders hit the spot. The boy's wedge salad with steak was a nice filling option. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised by our dinner. A solid choice for our next midnight meal!

I like this place to eat when I am looking for some good bar food!  Kids like it to.  Can't go wrong when you are just looking for a place to sit back relax, have a few drinks and share a bunch of yummy scaled up bar food.
Luxbar was nice, and the food was decent.  Had the calamari and while it was rather tasty, it was a bit on the soggy side.

What happened to Luxbar? The food is equal to Dennys. We ended up going there for Sunday brunch bc Yolk was too busy.   The truffle fries were saturated in oil and cold. The California salad looked like a plate of chopped up veggies fit for rabbity food. The Gold Coast omelet had a nice mushroom sauce, dominated by bland omelet filled with chives. Next time, will be more patient and wait in line at Yolk.
Great food, great service....an all-around enjoyable visit every time! The truffle fries are a must.

Very cool atmosphere, but the food for a large group definitely fell flat!  I asked for the salmon to be cooked medium, but it came out much rarer and it was quite fishy tasting...yuck!  For a large group though, the service was very quick - 5 stars for that!  I'd give the bar with a small group another try...but not rushing back when there are so many great choices in Chicago!

Drinks are strong and the food is delish. More bar food with fewer healthy options, but loved the sliders and calamari. My martinis were the size of my head, so I was good after 2, well worth it! The managers were great and came over to check on us after we were finished up. Great location too - walkable to all the Rush Street bars.

I love this place!  The food is really good and the prices are reasonable.  They have a friendly staff and the service is good.  They aim to please.  It's usually very busy, but there isn't a long wait for your food after ordering it.  Also, it has a nice ambiance.

I have to say, the service was so outstanding that I could overlook the average food. Jeff, our waiter, could not have been more accommodating or charming. My girlfriend was celebrating a quiet birthday with me, and Jeff's attention made it seem like a special occasion. (Not to mention the other 4 servers who would ask us if we needed anything every time they walked by...) Throw in the hospitable Manager (Baby-faced) Nick (who comped our desserts because my Patty Melt was just a little underdone and then entertained us with funny conversation), and Luxbar has the best service in the area.

LuxBar used to be a staple for us. It was always solid food, the staff is friendly, and the drinks are really well made. Unfortunately, LuxBar's menu has taken some hard hits over the last year: they almost completely removed their variety of sliders (which were awesome), they introduced and removed appetizers so fast that the menu had changed multiple times between visits, they took the Crosstown Classic off the menu, etc. Seems like they're going for a new direction, but they can't decide which direction that is. Stick to what you're good at, LuxBar - solid American food, great drinks, and good service.
Service is perfect, the atmosphere is nice, the food is fine.  Nothing spectacular, but enjoyable nonetheless.

LuxBar fits in well with it's Viagra Triangle/Gold Coast location and has good food, good drink selection and a very "be seen" crowd. I went on a Thursday night and there was a decent crowd, but luckily not too busy that we couldn't get a table right away.  For dinner, I had the filet sliders which were pretty good. The filet was cooked perfectly, no surprise given LuxBar is owned by the Gibson's folks. It was served on a pretty average bun, however, and came with a side salad that was mostly just iceberg lettuce. Next time I might just try the steak by itself. My boyfriend had the portabello mushroom sandwich, which was also very tasty, layers of portabello, mozzarella and pesto on grilled sourdough bread. Overall, food was pretty good and prices were quite reasonable for the area. Also good people watching, as it seems to attract the well dressed trust fund set of Chicago most nights.
How can I possibly say anything bad about LUXBAR. We had such a wonderful experience here. The food was fantastic, and our server, Mike, was great!  ratewait.com/restaurant/…
Pretty decent food here! I like the place a lot and the servers are nice and polite!

Thanks to everyone at Luxbar for a great stop for my cousin's bachelorette!  We ordered desserts and drinks to end our progressive dinner before getting on a trolley to go out.  Everything was delicious!  Our waitress was really terrific too...it's not easy taking drink and dessert orders from 20+ girls and getting us out in an hour, but she did!  Thanks again.

In my opinion, you're paying for the ambience and location. Sitting on the patio on a mild summer night is wonderful. The people and car watching is definitely an experience, especially on weekend nights.  The food and drinks are medium quality, but high class prices. I have had most of their salads and appetizers; all decent, but also not worth the price.  Service has been great during all my visits. Dining room and patio are pretty packed. I've had to crawl over people to get to the rest room. But this is expected for the area.  Beautiful people and beautiful ambiance sums up the experience.
This place is good.  The food is decent, and the service is fine.  The atmosphere is nice- it's like an upscale bar and grill.  Overall, good.

Fantastic cocktails in a gimlet cup, which is always fun.  This place was great! - good atmosphere, great food, great drinks, and everything was fairly priced!  Loved the truffle fries and portabella sandwhich.

Came here for Sunday brunch the Sunday before Christmas Eve. I made a res, but it took a little while for them to get our table ready. Hey, no big deal, busy Sunday. We settled into a booth on the second level where's there's a fireplace, a couple TVs with no sound, and a Christmas tree.  The calamari was amazing! The pancakes were meh. I love pancakes, but these were pretty bland. When we told our server, he said it was the first he'd heard that. Maybe it was just an off short stack? We all ordered breakfast/brunch items and none of us were really that impressed with our food. That never happens. I think we were just expecting something a bit tastier than what we got. I'd imagine this place is better for drinks, and from what it looks like from other reviews, better for burgers.

Did someone say anything negative about Luxbar?  I popped in with my friends for some quick snacks and a cocktails Saturday night. My drink was great, service was great and food was great. Granted, I didn't food order for myself (I substantially mooched off my friends), but based on what I tasted and saw on the menu, I'm definitely coming back.  I also really liked the selection of music at the bar. Don't usually pay attention to that, but they seemed to play some of my favorites one after another.  I didn't give all 5 stars only because of the bathroom. Someone said it's one of those with a bathroom attendant. Just my personal distaste for that practice. No problem though, I crossed my legs and took care of business at the next place we visited ;)

I know Luxbar sometimes gets a bad rap, but I like it.  Good food, friendly service (granted, I've only been there for brunch or dinner...so I'm not sure how it is at night).  Prices are reasonable for the area and those pretzel sticks - yum!   I visited the last two times with work colleagues and had fun both times.  A nice glass of sparkling to round out some work success is always nice, and Luxbar is a great spot to get this.   Food - 4 Service - 5 Bathrooms - 3 (I don't like bathroom attendants...no offense to them, but I don't like this practices). Value - 4 Atmosphere - 4

HUGE portions! I had the fruit and greek yogurt and there was so much fruit, I couldn't finish. The prices are decent for the location and portion size. The service is fantastic! Both times i've been there I've had questions about the menu and the waiter would go to the kitchen and promptly be back with the answer. The menu is small but you can't really go wrong with anything you pick.
Great Menu, Duck is amazing and desserts are Crazy Good. Have Terry as your server or visit Clint in the Bar...EXCELLENT!

They have awesome pumpkin spice martini's, so I highly recommend stopping in for one of those. Service was good, I can thank our server for not having a hangover the next day since our drinks ran dry a couple times.  Not too busy for a Saturday night, good location, and did I mention how awesome the pumpkin spice martini's are?! Oh, and the moscow mules and apple cider martini's are a bit underwhelming so beware. Nice bar to stop in at if you want to avoid dirty bathrooms and tourists.
Order the Lux Burger. It is perhaps one of the best burgers I have ever eaten. I have yet to try anything else because I can't stop ordering the Lux Burger...yummy (and reasonable).

This is a nice option for a good meal without the huge price tag in the Gold Coast. It's owned by the same people as Gibson's and Hugo's, so you know the food is good. You can also get a Gibson's steak there, which is nice if Gibson's is too busy. The best parts of the menu are the slider combos (filet, buttermilk chicken, lobster and filet, etc.) and the truffle fries. Seriously. The truffle fries. :)

This is always a favorite of mine! LuxBar is good for any setting and any meal: brunch, lunch, and dinner. I've come here for brunch plenty of times and they are willing to customize orders, so I usually get the veggie egg white omelette. They have great coffee here and the prices are very reasonable. The dinner here used to be better when they had the Kobe Sliders, but they still have a good menu that caters to vegetarians and non. They have truffle mac and cheese, which is to die for. This place is a ton of fun in summer because of all the outdoor seating.

LOVE Luxbar. The atmosphere was nice and elegant and fancy, including the staff! Server came around made sure we were okay. We only went for appetizers, the pretzels were a little toooo salty, but the chicken tenders were really amazing, I am sure the entrees would have been great as well! Overall it is a great place to go for drinks and a nice dinner with a date ;-)
Heart of the Gold Coast... great atmosphere and staff.  Appetizers were amazing!
