My boyfriend and I stopped in here on a Monday for lunch. All around, great experience: 1. atmosphere - has an upscale gastropub/lounge thing going on thats nice. makes you feel fancy eating a burger there, but not too trendy. warm and cozy 2. food - excellent. we had the tomato soup and it came with a small grilled cheese wedge - delicious! we also had the turkey burger which had a lot of flavor, as well as the filet and lobster sliders. for the price - i couldn't believe how good they were. the lobster and beef were cooked perfectly and of great quality. 3. staff - very friendly and accommodating. the owner was working that day and he stopped by our table several times to ask how we were doing, and then gave us complimentary drinks at the bar before we left. very nice touch overall - its a great atmosphere with good food.

I'm writing an update because their brunch is getting better.  I had the eggs benedict and it was really good.  But the best item on the brunch menu now is the new breakfast burrito with chorizo.  The chorizo is nice and not too oily.  Luxbar has gotten better and good for you.  Hash house is terrible so you should stay busy.

Went here on 10/17/12 as part of a group of 6 for a corporate dinner. We arrived drenched from the rain, but our surroundings were cozy and warm, and we were soon settled and comfortable. The place was pretty full when we arrived, which may explain why our food service was a little slow. But the food itself was WONDERFUL. I had the filet, which was melt in your mouth delicious. Others at my table had meatloaf and salad, and everyone loved their food. Waiter service was generally good - he was very pleasant and attentive, but there were a couple of times when we were wondering where he was. We had several birthdays in our group, so dinner finished with us sharing a giant, sinfully good piece of cake.  Overall, I can't give this place a perfect 5 because we did have slow service. I would give it a 4.5 if I could. But the food was a 5 easily, and overall we did love our dinner experience. I would definitely go back for a fun night out.

It's a place to be seen, that's all. Not worth the hassle of getting down here. Food is average to poor, service is slow due to the crowds, and you have to scream to be heard. Not recommended. Unless maybe you're single and 50.

Brunch!!! In my recent visit to Chicago, my husband and I met some friends for brunch on a Saturday afternoon.  This place was insanely crowded, I only hoped that the reason it was so crowded was that it was so delicious, and was right!   Three words for you - CINNAMON. ROLL. PANCAKES.  They were amazing.  I'm not a "syrup on the pancakes" kind of person, so my judgment on pancakes and French toast is always based upon whether or not you need syrup - and these were melt-in-your-mouth kind of pancakes.  Delicious!  I also indulged in a side of bacon - some of the best bacon I've ever had! My husband had the breakfast burrito and gave it his seal of approval.   It is important to make reservations if you plan to come for brunch on the weekends - I am not making an understatement when I say this place was packed to the gills.  Aside from that, this place comes highly recommended!

Went here on a Thursday night to get dinner with the g/f.  The wait was about 30 min but well worth it.  Ordered a burger, the buttermilk amish fried chicken (awesome), and truffle fries (amazing).  The food was a surprisingly large portion and was delicious, definitely worth the price!!! It was also a good environment to eat in, the service was very good and the noise was a bit loud but that's not always a bad thing.

I don't think Luxbar is anything special, although it's in a good location and there are multiple big tables for groups.  The sliders are good, but everything else is a little mediocre in my opinion. It's good to go if you're in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't go out of my way for Luxbar.

Luxbar is right behind our apt so after 6 months we finally made time to check it out. It was quite disappointing. The calamari was fried then coated in sauce so it may not as well have been fried at all, though it was actually the most successful dish of the night. We also had the blackened tilapia sandwich and fried chicken sandwich, both bland and the chicken wasn't crispy. The fries were crispy, but also not seasoned. Unimpressed. PS It's more like a ritzy sports bar than what its name suggests. You have to ask if you want the bread basket.

Went for a Tuesday after work dinner, and was impressed with the large portion sizes and the fast service.  I was disappointed when they were out of one of their specialty drinks and our waitress didn't recommend anything else.  For those eating dessert, I suggest splitting with your companion as they are very large.

Ever sit at a bar and converse with the bartender about unmentionables with your speech volume, one-knot below a mouth behind a bullhorn? Ever transition the convo from last nights playboy fest to disliking your current boss -- all the while everyone in elbows reach is soaking this up -- of course unbeknowst to you? And you don't care right? Because no one knows you, right? Then, ever get interrupted by the gentleman seated to your left, also seated at the bar, who just happens to think your rant about your boss is f*ckin hilarious? And finally, have you ever exchanged business cards with that gentleman to your left, for networking purposes, and his card just happens to read VP of the hotel you just tore to shreds? Yep, this is one of my many cherished experiences at Lux Bar and one I definitely learned from six years ago! The experiences (not the food) drive this joint - some of the waitresses are EXTREMELY easy on the eyes -- so they only enhance the experience!  If I want to eat -- I'll go across the street to Gibson's or Hugo's but if I want to EXPERIENCE the UNEXPECTED with a cocktail and an appetizer -- then no question and no doubt about it -- LUX BAR is my spot!

Meh. A big disappointment. Was one of 3 brunch spots enthusiastically recommended by a native Chicagoan.  The food was very mediocre. Amateur service.  I asked for a cafe au lait and our server had no idea what it was. When I said coffee with steamed milk, she brought out a regular crappy mug of coffee with a small pitcher of cold cream.  Really?!?! I had the breakfast burrito which was huge but bland and greasy. Nothing like the tasty, flavorful breakfast burritos we have in ca.  I should have known better. After a weekend eating at several places in Chicago, I know that it's not on par food wise with other top tier cities like San Francisco, ny or la.  What a shame

Had an absolutely wonderful meal.    Great smoked trout salad, perfectly done hunter steak (ribeye), delicious manhattan and a generous pour of a good California Chardonnay.    Attentive and friendly service.   Very comfortable atmosphere.  Reasonably priced.   The manager stopped by to welcome us and offered to buy us a nightcap (we politely refused).    We ate at many fine restaurants during our 5 day stay but this was the best overall experience.    when we returned to our hotel about five blocks away, the concierge confided that he often eats at Lux Bar when he is off work.   You cannot go wrong eating or drinking at Lux Bar and i am only sad that we live in San Francisco so will only have a few chances on business trips to enjoy this fine establishment.

Disappointed. It's a typical Gold Coast "to see and to be seen" spot, but when it comes to the food, I think it's quite bad. We came here on a Saturday for brunch. Husband and I both got the Egg Benedict. It was bland, the eggs were a little over cooked, the hash was meh. I showered my eggs with salt and pepper when the waitress was looking, but apparently she didn't get the clue to ask me "how's the food..." One upside is the waitress must have come at least 10 times to ask if we needed more coffee. All in all, very below average brunch. In a city with so many other great options, skip this place unless you are one of those people want to go to a Gold Coast location just becuz...

Food was good.  Service was a bit slow for a Tuesday afternoon.  I won't sit outside again, very cramped and diesel trucks spewed exhaust everywhere.  The inside is very nice and the Gold Coast neighborhood is also very nice area to walk around.

Staff is attentive and prompt. Very friendly.  The manager has visited with us on a number of dining occasions to be certain we were beyond happy with our experience.  Gotta appreciate that!  For late night dining options, I'd say GREAT food.  Beyond decent vegetarian options and definitely accommodating in generic ways of at least veggie burgers, truffle fries, portobello burger and guacamole among some other items and they are all done very well. Nice comfort foods done in a classy style like fried chicken sliders and tomato soup with grilled cheese. I've dined indoors and outdoors-Often late enough where a reservation has not been necessary.  Outdoors is nice with other diners all around you enjoying the social nature of having a tables on sidewalks in Chicago.  We stay in a hotel nearby Luxbar and always end up here.  Great for comfort food done in a classy, fun way with urban appeal. I could just order sides for dinner like mac n cheese, fries, broccoli and mash potatoes.  The only downside is I'm tired of the sportsbar atmosphere BUT the dining opposite the bar and outside is a different environment without being surrounded by TV screens. We'll be back!
Attended a catered cocktail party on the 2nd floor; very nice space to reserve for an event. Very pleasant atmosphere.
Nice clean atmosphere!  Just had a glass of wine and felt very welcome!! Excellent menu choices, including Lobster and Filet Mignon sliders !!

We dined at Luxbar while staying in Chicago's Gold Coast area recently.  It was an outstanding meal: our server was flawless, the food was wonderful, the atmosphere is terrific, and the price very reasonable given the area. i can't think of a single thing I would change. Can't wait to return.
Breakfast was good I had the egg croissant sandwich with fruit decent coffee.

I've only been to lunch/brunch here, but the quality is always good, and the menu selection is huge. Another great spot in the rush st area to people watch. I have never had an amazing meal, but never had a poor one either. Best bet: your Sunday Funday brunch for an always consistently good meal that has a menu to please everyone.

I left my phone on the Luxbar restaurant table after a wonderful meal there, and within minutes, it was gone.  Last I saw was restaurant staff cleaning the table, and despite us standing by the restaurant for a few minutes and chatting, noone came to hand us the phone.  Even worse,  upon returning to find it, no one would confess to finding the phone. Way to go Luxbar, for hiring honest staff.   Very disappointing and a reason for NEVER to return to your restaurant.

Ahh good ol Lux Bar!  My mom lives right around the corner from Lux Bar and before I moved to Chicago this was our go to spot for brunch/lunch/dinner when I would come to visit. When it's nice outside they have plenty of tables set up outside which is great for people watching and taking in the gorgeous Summer Chicago weather. As far as the food goes- I have two staples. The two eggs scrambled, challah toast and hashbrowns for brunch or the chicken noodle soup for dinner. The soup is soo good and perfect for a cold Chicago night! Overall, in the past week there was one day when we had both breakfast and dinner at LuxBar. That says it all, I'm a fan!

Luxbar is a great place to go for dates and with small groups of friends. The bar is always packed, but both the indoor and outdoor dining is enjoyable. Outdoor dining is worth waiting for because of the location-tons of people watching! The waitstaff is great and attentive. The sliders are the best around- especially the steak and lobster slider. The buffalo chicken salad is also a classic and something I get frequently. You have to try the cookie sundae if you go; it's the best I've ever had! I have never had a bad meal at Luxbar and dine there frequently. The menu is very reasonably priced and a great place to go for either a quick bite to eat or a longer, relaxing dinner.

I came here a couple of weeks ago with my boyfriend and we absolutely loved our food. We ordered the crab cake appetizer which I was a little nervous about because I am from Baltimore and I typically don't find good crab cakes outside of Baltimore, but this one was delicious. I ordered a turkey burger sandwich and my boyfriend ordered the pulled pork sandwich, yuuuummmmy! We will definitely be going back there. The service was great, the atmosphere was great and the food was fantastic. I am only giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because none of the drinks has free refills because they are all from bottles instead of from the fountain, luckily our waitress slipped us some free lemonade when the bartender wasn't looking!

My wife and I were in Chicago for our daughter's graduation.  We went to quite a few restaurants while we were there and being from San Francisco, we are very familiar with fine food but what really made our visit to Luxbar was Cesar Rocha.  The first night we ate there,Cesar was our waiter, we are particular about our food, and Cesar not only listened but delivered.  It was very busy in the restaurant and he handled the pace well and seemed to enjoy the challenge.  Our experience was so enjoyable that we went back a couple of nights later only to find Cesar as the front of house.  He remembered us right away and when challenged even remembered what we had ordered.  It was once again very crowded but it's a good feeling to be recognized, to be welcomed, and enjoy excellent cuisine with a personable, intelligent, professional waiter.  And by the way, Cesar is not only a waiter, front of house, but is also a bartender at the Luxbar.  Great guy, very fun place-The Luxbar

The mac and cheese... it's probably the best I have ever had besides Gale Street. I mean it is out of this world! Talapia slider, eh, lacked flavor and maybe some garnish, but the filet mignon slider, is mmmmmmmm, good! You don't need any garnish or sauce or even bun; cooked medium rare as I expected, melt in your mouth morsel of yummy. Drinks are stiff and the waiter is honest about them. Will be back for sure.
Liked the mini-burgers and sweet potatoe fries!

I have been here on several occasions for lunch and dinner, and we also rented out the entire upstairs for a private party. In terms of coming for lunch and dinner, the food has always been good, but on several occasions service has been just OK. There tend to be a lot of drunk and loud people, which I guess is not the fault of the restaurant, but can be very annoying. In terms of the private party, we had an amazing experience. The manager was so helpful in making sure that everything was set up exactly to our expectations. He went above and beyond to get our slide show uploaded onto his computer as we couldn't get it to show on ours. The food was very good, and the service for the private party was great. The bartender was quick and attentive, and the waitress was always checking on us to see what we needed. I would highly recommend renting out the upstairs for private events as it is a really great space with good food and excellent service. The truffle fries and truffle mac and cheese are pretty amazing too.

They are serving free breakfast through May 4th, which is essentially which brought me out of my five block radius at this time during the morning.  The food is similar to other places to get breakfast in the city, only with less options.  This is a posh place to visit, so expect the same out of breakfast.  It is not your typical diner from the north side.  The coffee is tasty, and the service is good.  I say that it is worth a try, and worth going back if you live within five blocks. ;-)

This is a nice little spot in River North that I've gone to for brunch a few times.  Not a huge menu, but quite a bit of variation and a few specialty dishes as well (they make their own homemade berry jam!).  Quality is good for the price in the area.  I've eaten both inside and outside and I would definitely recommend outside if it's a nice afternoon.

Somehow I ended up here twice within one week; not that I'm complaining, but with all of the options in Chicago, I don't know how it happened. Nonetheless, the experiences were as pleasant as before. We hadn't any reservations and at first they said it would be about a 20 minute wait but we stepped aside and literally a minute later a table near the bar opened up for us to take.  We had the truffle fries which seems to be a favorite here and the sweet chili grilled calamari. The calamari was cooked nicely and came with bell peppers and hoisin chili sauce, needless to say it lived up to it's name: sweet and spicy.  I stuck to my usual tequila on the rocks and rum/cokes, but there's a nice cocktail list for the ladies and fans of sweeter, more creative drinks. The service was solid, I never waited on another drink, it was one after another, just. how. I. like. it.  (I think I finished 4 before my date finished one of hers, oops). The bill was a little pricy as it was before but it's expected so that's not much of a complaint.

Once I found out the mushroom burger was a burger + mushroom and not a veggie option, that left me with the Scottish Salmon dinner special which wasn't great. I am curious what the LuxLager beer is from Jacob Leinenkugel Brewing Company because it tasted just like regular Leinenkugel's.

We had fantastic drinks, meal and atmosphere!  Service was very personal and our server gave great recommendations. We will return when back in Chicago.  I am not getting to detailed on the food because everything I tried was great.

I ate outdoors on one of those "I can't believe its this warm in Chicago already" days.  The service was quick, but not warming.  My over priced Cobb salad left me wondering why I didn't make it myself. I heard that everyone else really enjoyed their food, so I might try something else if I go again, because the mushroom sandwich looked amazing. Their bread is good. Great location in Chicago on Rush Street, and not as expensive as I thought it would be.  Just don't get the Cobb salad. Street parking.

Luxbar is your average American trendy restaurant that you find downtown. You know what the menu is going to be more or less before you sit down. Granted I came here for dinner after eating Kuma's for lunch so surprisingly I could only eat a beet salad. It was a good beet salad, but nothing that I can't find anywhere else. The truffle fries were delicious, but again not a novelty. I'll probably come back if I have picky-eater friends in town, but I think Chicago has more to offer.  If you are looking for some place downtown to look/feel trendy, but not venture out of your food comfort zone, then you would greatly enjoy Luxbar.

I came in here for the first time last week for a glass of wine and was pleasantly surprised!  It's not at as pretentious as most places in this area, our bartender was very cool without being overbearing and the prices are moderate! I will definitely be back!
Luxbar is a great place for drinks and food.  Always a good place for a late night snack.  The lobster & filet sliders are really good.

Had an extremely delicious meal at LuxBar with amazing service.  Extremely Classy Restaurant! Highly Recommend the BBQ Pork Sandwich and the quesadilla. The tvs are hard to see from certain areas, wouldn't recommend to watch a game with friends, but extremely classy place for family dining or date night.  Small coke bottles were a nice touch!

Drinking in Chicago is just overpriced...three beers and a dirty martini, $33. We had chicken fingers, truffle fries (don't undertand the bad reviews, they're amazing) steaks, caesar salad,chicken and turkey sliders and truffled mac and cheese.  Food was great and service was excellent.  The crowd was crazy, then again it was Saturday and St. Patrick's day and March Madness.   Ladies room was awesome and the attendant was so funny laughing with me about the crazy drunks.   Will be back.

Tried Luxbar last night for a late snack and drinks. I had the slider combo which came with 2 sliders and a soup or salad. I had the house salad and the pulled pork and fried chicken sliders. Everything was good. I also ordered 2 chocolate martinis and they were decent. A good balance between strong and sweet. The crowd was over 25 which I was happy about. The decor was also nice. I would go back again if I'm in the area.

I ventured into Luxbar yesterday to meet up with my brother and cousin before going to a different place for dinner.  The first thing that I noticed when I walked into the bar was that it was a very upscale and classy venue.  The decor and ambiance were very inviting.  I doubt that one would find anyone of a questionable maturity level in Luxbar.... which is a good thing, especially if you're not into that whole "college-bar scene".     While we didn't stay for too long on account of our dinner reservations elsewhere, I was very happy with my overall experience.  I haven't had the food yet, nor have I tried any of the mixed drinks, but based upon my initial impression of the place, I will definitely be going back again!

I took my wife after an appointment downtown.  Everytime we go out we choose only new restaurants.  Just to give you a gauge on our taste - we found Purple Pig to be good food and a decent value.  So we found Luxbar to really miss the mark.  I should not have had tremendous expectations due to the fact that we went during restaurant week and they were slow.  Most of the restaurants around them were packed.  I mean packed.  The food was substandard.  My pregnant wife didn't finish her salad.  Really?  My burger was over $12 and they managed to mess that up.  I asked for medium well and it was nearly raw.  I try to be understanding, but when you order a $10 draft beer the thing better be filled to the top.  Nope.  Sorry Luxbar, I've got no love for you.  I felt like I was back in Los Angeles.

Great atmosphere in the Gold Coast. It's definitely great for date night or getting a group of friends together. Foods pretty good, I recommend the burgers. And, for dessert, you have to get the snicker's pie. But you'll definitely need to share- it comes with it's own steak knife!

Been here 3 times now so definitely justifies a review.  Luxbar is a trendy spot right in the Viagra triangle. On the plus side: Cool decor, some fairly interesting specialty drinks, and very reasonable food prices for the area. Every time its been an energetic scene that trends slightly younger than neighbors Tavern or Gibson's, and I really can't complain about the service.  The downside? They make up for their low food margins by nailing you on the drinks. Before you call me cheap, let me defend myself by agreeing that had we ordered specialty cocktails or nice glasses of wine an average price of $12/drink would be justifiable, especially given the neighborhood. But for Jim Beam and Sam Adams? A bit of a rip-off. I'm not saying don't go--I would have to guess I'll be back at some point in the next 6 months--just make sure you do a little pre-gaming first.
Get ready to be "cougared" if your a guy and a get ready to be hit on by an old man if you happen to be a girl in your mid to late twenties. For the rest. itself, the burgers are pricey and dry!

I've given Luxbar 4 stars for its overall appeal as an accessible, easy place to dine in and socialize with above average food.  I've been to Lux several times, but after dining here tonight with my husband, our two babies (aged one and two), and my mother-in-law, I am compelled to share our experience.  I was, at first, apprehensive about how we would be greeted with our two little babes in tow, and I was pleasantly surprised.  The hostess jumped to open the door for our stroller, and the two hostesses and a few servers at the hostess stand were visibly pleased to see us, smiling at our babies and welcoming us in.  They took our stroller and stored it for us, happily, I might add.  They brought us to a very comfortable and spacious booth in the back of the dining room where we would be out of everyone else's way, which allowed us to relax a bit not having to worry that we were disturbing anyone.  Our server was very hurried and a bit annoyed he had the table with the kids, but it barely affected our service. (He did have to be prompted to bring out the kids' meals ASAP, but I wouldn't expect anyone but a parent to be aware of how important something like this is.  He brought them out soon after we asked him to, though, when we realized that they wouldn't be coming out early).  Needless to say, it was nice to be welcomed so warmly with a family in a place in this neighborhood. We had the chicken tenders appetizer and a side of mac n cheese (for the kids, obviously, although they both were delicious) the beet salad, a variety of the sliders, and, of course, the truffle fries.  I, personally, love coming to Lux for their sliders, as they never disappoint.  We had the filet, the turkey burger, and the buttermilk fried chicken sliders.  I usually order something like the hummus plate, the beet salad, and the sliders, and it is always consistently good.  I think that this is the thing that I like best about the food at Luxbar-it is ALWAYS consistently good.  The variety of option on the menu is great, I always know what I am going to get, and I have to say that many places really struggle with consistency.  So, I suppose that this is why when I am eating out in the GC, Lux usually is the first place to jump to mind. The only thing that I don't love about Luxbar is when I've been there later on in the evenings, it is so noisy that you cannot hear a thing.  Aside from that, and seeing that my kids have solved that problem, I will for sure be going back to this great GC spot, especially once they get that patio re-opened in the summertime. One more thing...there was a group of guys sitting at the booth across the room from us, their table littered with frosty copper mugs.  This means only one thing: Luxbar serves MOSCOW MULES!!!  Amazeballs...if you don't know what this is, just go and find out for yourself.  Best vodka drink EVER!!!

Service is better in here during weekdays. But Actually I really like this place especially in a summer time. Great place to get together with friends and get some drinks. Place is very loud so if you are going on date choose a different place:)

I love fruity drinks, but I like 'em strong. Where can a girl get a decent martini in this town? At Luxbar! Lori L, Josh V and I headed over to Luxbar for a little afternoon delight of the boozing persuasion. Sure, it was only 3pm, but it was a Saturday. That's my story and I'm sticking to it. After carefully studying the menu, I went with the Pear Essence Cosmopolitan (I believe it was about $13). I'm a vodka girl all the way and a sucker for all things pear. It was really good, just the right amount of alcohol vs sweet and sour. However, as good as that Cosmo was, I had a bit of drink envy when I took a sip of my friend's Lavender Lemon Drop Martini. I'll be back and I won't make the same mistake twice. I'm getting my hands on a Lavender Lemon!
Tremendous brunch on weekends.  Nice atmosphere with superb food and service
Great spot for dinner and a drink.  Better than any of the pub bars in the area.

This update is based on the follow up I received from management regarding the service I received.  I posted a review on here, but also sent a complaint through the company website.  I received an email from one of the managers apologizing for the service I received, and to compensate, I was given  $50 gift card for the restaurant.  He also advised me to ask for him once I get to the restaurant.  I am really happy about this because it shows that someone really cares about everyone having an enjoyable time at their business.  I will be going back and fully expect to enjoy myself better the second time around.  I'll post an update!

I had dinner here with friends after we waited a little too long to make reservations at another restaurant we were hoping to try. (Gilt Bar, for the record, which I've heard nothing but good things about from my friends in the Chicago area.) We were able to make same-day reservations at Luxbar for our group of six and were seated immediately upon arrival.  The tables were all really close together, as some others have said, but we were seated in a booth at the back and had plenty of room on and around our table. We started out with the hummus plate (delicious + generous), calamari (didn't try but heard no complaints from my friends), and shrimp cocktail (it's pretty hard to screw this one up). Those who ordered drinks were disappointed by the price/size ratio.  There is a lot on the menu, from comfort food (fried chicken or meatloaf) to burgers to sandwiches and salads, to fish + steak entrees. I ordered the braised short ribs and they were delicious -- cooked perfectly and seasoned well. However, everything else that was ordered at my table (salmon, a burger, and a filet) left us nonplussed. The burger especially was disappointing. It looked like they'd left off the meat, but we finally found it by peeling apart the layers. It was thinner than a Wendy's patty and my friend said it wasn't much tastier. It DID have a fried egg on it, so that was sort of a consolation prize for the beef deficiency. Hence the three stars -- at a place like Luxbar, with beautiful decor and prices that, while not outrageous, aren't exactly cheap, either -- the menu shouldn't be a minefield. It seems like they're trying to do too many things; maybe if they pared down their menu they could focus on doing a few things well.

I thought this place was a bit better than the reviews.  4 of us went for brunch on New Year's Day; everyone liked their meal.  The strawberry jam is wonderful.  The corned beef hash was good.   The place was crowded and there were two loud tables of 'pretty young things' next to us but it wasn't overpowering.  The service was good; definitely didn't rush us. Luxbar may not be 5 star but I'd be back for a good meal, nice atmosphere and the service.  So many places are just average, this was above average.

Mind your wallets.... This place gets very busy very fast when the clock strikes the witching hour of 10-11PM.  The place cash's in knowing that the location is prime, but that doesn't mean that the food and drinks has to be mediocre.  There are so many other places near here that can give you more bang for your buck. This place is like that  smart guy in high school that coasted through college.  We expected so much more.

I went just last night for the first time, New Year's. I had never been to Lux Bar or heard of it before a friend suggested we go there for some drinks after dinner. Fortunately, even though we didn't have a reservation they seated us.  The place itself looks really cool from the outside and has a really trendy interior. The service was really good for the night. However the drinks were not spectacular. If you are going to charge $9.50 for an Amaretto Sour it better have spun gold in it and served in a much larger glass. The "Perfect Margarita" was alright. My friend enjoyed her "Pumpkin Spice Martini" and our waiter was kind enough to give her more whip cream. I've definitely had better drinks for the prices they charge elsewhere.  The food was okay. Definitely not worth the prices. You can tell they are definitely cashing in on the location of the bar, being in River North. Overall it wasn't terrible but I'm not pining to go back to Lux Bar.
if your trying to impress a group of friend out to eat before clubbing  GO HERE!

Went here on a cold, rainy, Saturday morning. It was super packed with a line outside at PANCAKE HOUSE next door. Not sure if it's really called Pancake house, and my girl and I were not gonna stand outside for breakfast food. We walked into Lux Bar, got a table right away.  Our British accent and very polite server gave us our menu's with a huge smile. I ordered a cheddar and broccoli omelet (came with hash browns and toast-bread of your choice) and my girl got a veggie one. Both came out with great presentation and were delicious. Coffee was served right away and it was great, strong. Both omelets ran under 11 dollars each, not so bad.  Great location on Rush/Division area. I didn't even know Luxbar served breakfast. What a different environment compared to nightlife there. I can't wait to step back into this great serviced, quiet, friendly, place to be! Perfect way to start your morning in the city.

So this review is based on two trips here with the same outcome. Cute place (day time and evening). In the evening its packed and a wonderful place to socialize in River North. So in short, great for people watching, especially if you sit outside. On the other hand, the food was lackluster as well as the drinks. I had the highly rated truffle fries but yet it was not super exciting. Ordered a few drinks and they did not have that pizazz I was looking for. A plus is every person who works there is super friendly and I know I always value that. Would I go with friends, absolutely, but moreso for drinks (mind you they are kind of pricey). If I had an option, would I pick Luxbar..maybe not!

This is my #1 pick for the Gold Coast  - appropriate place for fancy dinner date or casual lunch/brunch with family. I think its a phenomenal value and the service is good. At most a short wait for a table because they have attentive service. Great deal, good food, good drink list and always a great crowd. If I'm in jeans or a dress they still treat you well. Love this place!

I love a good sesame crushed ahi tuna. And it is GOOD here! Also love, short ribs with super creamy mashed potatoes and SPINACH! although the whole dish is a little salty....salty is better than bland!  short rib! short rib! short rib!
Loved this restaurant.  Had a great night with girlfriends.  Food was perfect, drinks were perfect, service was amazing.
Pretty nice classy atmosphere. Food is OK. Bar area upstairs is louder and ok for dancing too.  Good spot  to go on the triangle :)

Such a cute place. My friend lives right around the corner so she and I went to grab a quick bite. We sat outside and had a great view of Rush Street and it was extra awesome because there were built-in heaters so we stayed warm even though it was chilly out. Then came the food. We split the steak and lobster slider which was delicious. Then we each got the tuna salad and wow, delish! I also though it was really nice that when I checked in on Foursquare (it pushed my checkin to Twitter) they responded on Twitter asking how my experience was. So thoughtful! I've saved the best for last though... and it's called the cookie sundae. Holy moly. It comes in a little pan fresh from the oven. It's crispy on the outside, gooey and doughy on the inside and then has a fresh topping of ice cream. It's heavenly. My friend and I split it after having our super healthy salads, and it was so good we didn't even feel guilty for it either. I want to shake the hand of the waiter who recommended it to us. Delish! Since then, I've been back with my boyfriend and my aunt and I will not hesitate for a second to go back again!
The hostess was very attractive, the ambience inside was vibrant and great but the menu seemed very limited. The food I did get was very good though.

On Saturday October 22, 2011, my wife and I brought a couple who are out-of-town friends of ours to the LuxBar for a pre-theater dinner.  My wife and I arrived before our 6:00 p.m. reservation time and before our friends.  The host offered us a table outdoors or indoors and said that we could change our minds once the rest of the party showed up.  We opted for an outside table, but subsequently it became a bit chilly.  We asked the host for an indoor table, and he accommodated us immediately with a smile.  Unfortunately, our friends became lost downtown and were delayed.  During that time, the restaurant was filling up fast, however, our server Hanna told us not to worry and she could not have been more understanding or friendly.  Eventually our friends arrived, and we ordered a variety of foods that was all delicious, but we especially liked the king crab bisque and the filet mignon sliders.  The atmosphere in the restaurant was vibrant, the food was perfect before the theater, and the service was attentive, friendly, and professional.  We all had a great experience.
Solid service and nice warm atmosphere. I had the grilled cheese and tomato soup which was good and satisfying. Steve was my bartender and he was attentive.

I had the waffles. They were delicious, but they do give you way too much better, and a little bit too much syrup. I don't eat meat, but my brunch partners' turkey sausage looked perfect. Their strawberry jam is awesome.

I've been coming here for 5 years and have yet to experience a bad meal. I absolutely love their King Crab bisque - if the crowd wasn't as attractive as they are, I'd probably put the bowl to my mouth for the last few drops of soup!  I really love their wedge salad with filet medallions. That's my go - to favorite for take out from them.  I always enjoy their Sunday brunches - if you're prepped to wait at least half-hour for the outside tables, then the scene is so fun, lots of good looking people, killer Bloody Marys and their Fall Classic burger with short rib and arugula is absolutely delicious and perfect after a crazy Saturday night.  I wish it were on the corner instead of Tavern on Rush, which, in my opinion, has TERRIBLE food compared to this place.

After a pretty packed night out with a good sized group, we wound up at Luxbar for a little more substantial food that ousted the dirty martinis previously consumed (it was that kind of night). The vibe inside is hot. Fun. Flirty. Loud. Perfectly expected and openly accepted. It's a place where you want to bring your friends, date, one night stander...whatever the case calls for. It's a happening spot that seemed to be popping inside and out for the time we were there. Rather than taking a seat outside, we opted for the bar area and crammed the lot of us into one of the bar tables and ordered up. The service was quick and very attentive. Never were our glasses empty from the bottles of wine that were drifting onto our table. We ended up ordering: Sirloin Sliders: Small, cute, bite-sized. DEVOURED. Don't let their size fool you, they're tender slices of tasty glory that will get you salivating.  Truffle Fries: Oh sweet hell-foodgasm. That is all.  Great service, that was unexpected with such a busy crowd. I was completely sold with the truffle fries. The scent brought me in and the taste hooked in the carbolicious treat. I would definitely want to try Luxbar for a full sit-down dining experience and really experience it that way, but for this trip, 4 starros is well deserved. A golden shout out goes to the fabulous woman in the washrooms. Loved her humor-she was all laughs and fun to talk with. I mean, when you're in a bathroom with a wall to ceiling mirror that covers the length of the room-you've got to find some humor--even if it is with yourself. But for her, it was with all of the ladies coming and going.

Came here on a beautiful Saturday evening and sat outside. The service was impeccable and the food was great.  I decided to have the Monaco club sandwich which has roasted chicken and a fried egg on it as it came highly recommended from my aunt who had dined here previously - it was pure delish. Also had a side of their mac and cheese and that hit the spot too.  Finally, I want to comment on their Pina Colada Martini...I LOVED IT...my aunt and I had 2 each and they were so refreshing and came in a cool glass with LUXBAR etched in the side of it. I would love to come back here and sit outside but it looks like the weather in our city is about to turn cooler. I wouldn't mind sitting inside because the service and food are just THAT good.

Luxbar? More like Suxbar! I honestly do not think I have ever consumed a more disappointing meal than I had last weekend at Luxbar! I've read the stellar reviews for this place, and that just makes more annoyed. We ate inside. The restaurant was really busy, and so it took a long time for our server to come to the table. No biggie. Then it took a long time for him to come back for our food order. Still not overly concerned. The place was definitely packed. Then it took a LONG LONG time for our food to arrive. At this point I'm starving, and getting ready to head over to Starbucks for a muffin, lemon square, ANYTHING ...  After all that waiting, the server finally brings our food. What did I order? Oh a lovely spread of horrendously dry corned beef hash encrusted with chunks of blackened burntness. I tried to salvage what I could, being starving and all, and broke open one of my poached eggs in the hopes that the yolk would add a bit of moisture to the mess. No luck. The poached egg was hardboiled. I'm a good sport (or an optimistic fool) so I take a bite, and find that my hardboiled egg is laden with pockets of vinegar...  so now my mouth is filled with burnt, dry, hardboiled , vingarness and the manager breezes by our table to ask if everything is OK, but keeps moving, not waiting for a response. Thanks buddy. Perhaps an off day for Luxbar, but I will NOT be going back. There was nothing about the atmosphere, service, and certainly not the food, that would entice me to give it another try. I would recommend Tavern on Rush as an easy alternative. The food is consistently good, especially the egg pizzas.

Eaten here a dozen times.  Never disappoints! I've been going to Lux for going on 7 years now, and I'd have to say that my absolute favorite foods are the Lux Royale burger and truffle fries as well as the Wisconsin Cheddar soup.  The drinks are reasonable and well-mixed every time!  The decor is nothing special--upscale sports bar, but with a burg as good as the Royale, you don't really care :)

Really shitty experience at Lux last night. Terrible food, worse service, a general air of nobody gives a fuck across all the staff from the general manager down to the busboys. I've been a regular patron for years, but now I'll never go back. Never.

Took my family to enjoy a Sunday dinner. The service was good.  Mostly everyone got the Fried Chicken and really enjoyed it.  I had a couple of different sliders which were good too.  Would go back for sure for drinks and or dinner.

Best Moscow Mules in Chicago. Vodka, ginger beer, and lime juice are in every Moscow Mule. Some places also use the copper mug. Very few bars will also serve the MM with crushed ice. That makes a huge difference. Lux Bar is run by the Gibsons Group, so you know the food will be consistent. This is not the place that is going to WOW you with something you've never had before but it will be good and you will get what you expect. Plus, the menu does change quite a bit so you'll get something new just about every time. The Monaco Club is great, get the Buffalo Chicken salad with grilled chicken instead of fried, and ask them if they can do Alaskan King Crab quesadillas for you (they can).

Came here for sunday lunch today, food was very good, had the luxroyale burger which was a good size and the truffle mac/cheese( alittle bland but good) The one  thing that  has to be said is the service, the woman in the bar, who did not even bother to give her name was terrible. Rude and could care less if you needed anything or not. Did not come back to check on how t hings were, couldnt bother to offer coffee when we ordered our final course.  She walked by many times and did not even look over at us to see if we wanted more drinks.   Good food takes a  place so far but service matters quite a bit and this woman acted as if she could care less. we spoke the the GM and he was very nice and invited us back, I hope if we do go back, we dont get the same service, was  a big let down for a good meal

I'm not really sure what happened to this place. As I said in my previous review we used to go here once a week. Slowly the customer service has gone downhill, they keep taking menu items away, and the prices are going up. Its a shame they didn't keep their standards up because we stopped going here about a year ago.

I don't know why people wait to get in here.  It's not bad, it's just fair and in a city of fantastic dining options why would anyone settle for fair?  If you want a good dinner and you insist on being in the Triangle don't pick Luxbar.  Why go to Luxbar?  Because you have some time to kill and want a cocktail before you enjoy a much better meal at Gibsons, Hugos, Merlot or Le Colonial which are all a block away.   Luxbar brunch?  Fair to Poor.   Much better options in the neighborhood.  I would pick Feast on Delaware. I am not saying I will not go to Luxbar.  If I have friends that are going I have no problem going because I enjoy my time with others, I will just make sure I eat before I go.

This place is fun, very chill, casual yet upbeat and vibrant! Def. a place to check out for a quick lunch or even dinner in our amazing city! I had the tomato soup with grilled cheese that rocked my world and a friend had the filet mignon sliders. Everything was super yummy, I wouldn't say it's overly unique food, but definitely tasty comfort food. I can't even remember which grandiose dessert we had because dessert is something that I always should remember, but it was HUGE and we had to leave most of it! We just got some bubbly for drinks because life is truly a celebration especially when eating good food. The only thing I didn't like was the hostess, she was kinda b*tchy and we had to wait a lil while for our table even with reservations. But she won't stop me, will be back!!!

I love this place. It's pricey, but such a great place to go for a drink or food and not caught up in the general milieu of Rush Street. The bartenders are fabulous and remind me of some of the old fashioned bars in New York where the bartenders have worked behind the bar for decades and can make anything you throw at them. They even have hard boiled eggs at the bar-- a particular treat for my old school friend who was visiting. My favorite time to eat here is brunch-- you can always get in without a reservation (as opposed to the neighboring Tavern on Rush and The Original Pancake House) and their french fries (which I always sub for potatoes) are to-die-for. A great place to go back to again and again.

Well what can we say about LUXBAR that hasn't already been said?   I have always wanted to love this place.  When people asked me, "What's your favorite place to have a drink when you are in the area?" I wanted to reply effortlessly, "LUXBAR, of course!"  But, like many things in the culinary world that have left me unsatisfied, my visions of LUXBAR were not to be. LUXBAR is just so...underwhelming.   First of all, the hostess was a downright bitch (and, interestingly enough, someone my dining companion had worked with at another restaurant in a whole other state about 8 years ago in college -- apparently this is not new behavior for her).  Luckily the hostess didn't recognize my friend, however, I think she said something along the lines of, "So, are you here for lunch, or what?" which *could* be some kind of warm greeting in the Land of Biotch, but I'm not completely sure on that one.   We were seated at possibly the worst table in the whole place (granted, I had no reservation, so beggars shouldn't be choosers on a Sunday morning, but c'mon -- the place wasn't nearly full!) so we had the luxury of listening to Princess Bad Attitude of the SS LUXBAR chatter on the phone and critique the customers (so help you lady with the "cheap" Chanel bag and the dark roots wherever you are because that hostess tore you a new one).  She would occasionally break from her customer-slamming to either text or seat someone.  But there was no visible rhyme or reason as to how long she would force people to just stand around awkwardly before she would acknowledge them. The waitress apparently went to the LUXBAR School of Restaurant Etiquette as well because her personality was just as sparkling.  When she could be found, that is. Anyway, that doesn't even really phase me anymore, unfortunately. What I was really disappointed in was the food.  There were few meat-less options and so I went with the Roasted Portobello Sandwich and evidently there was a big sale on arugula that day.  Because that's essentially what my meal consisted of.  Arugula salad on a piece of bread.  Yawn.  My friend had the sliders which she loved, so LUXBAR gets a star for that.  And, I will admit that the truffle fries are a strong contender for "best fries I've ever eaten" and that's impressive since my diet is 75% fried potatoes (not really, but it totally should be).  So all in all, I would consider the food to be the gastronomic equivalent of the guy (or girl) you dated in 9th grade; sure, it was fine for that moment, but it's not something you are really going to care about much and will most likely forget about in six months anyway. There is one thing I love about LUXBAR, that I will always love about LUXBAR and, try as I might, cannot find a Milwaukee-based equal for: the Bloody Marys!  I am not, by nature, a huge fan of the great hangover drink, but for whatever reason I cannot understand, LUXBAR has the best ones I've ever had.  I am continuing my search for a "local" version of the LUXBAR bloody with no success (a few close calls, but no winners...yet).  And, for that, and that alone, I give LUXBAR an A-OK rating.  This place will carry a (tiny) piece of my vodka-loving heart with it, always.  Damn. 2 people; 2 entrees, 1 app, 3 (delicious delicious) bloody  marys about $70

Luxbar is a breath of fresh air in the neighborhood. It isn't stuffy and isn't full of wannabes or predators. Their food is simple and great. Their staff is attentive and helpful. They are usually very good with hosting large groups. I am devastated that they took the amazing Wisconsin Cheddar Ale Soup off the menu for the summer but I have been reassured it will make its way back on come fall. The chili is outstanding! The appetizers and the sliders are delicious! I have not had one bad thing here. It's great!
Perfect place to grab lunch the lux-club is a great update to the classic comes w/avocado, cucumber I just wish they would bottle their hot pink mayo!
I went here on a monday and  the place was packed.  We didnt have to wait for a seat at the bar though.  Drinks were overpriced.  Food was good.  Id go back for the half price deals thats about it.

Something keeps bringing me back. This was my second visit and it won't be my last. Luxbar is nice yet casual. I came back with a friend. She (a foodie) enjoyed her salmon. I had a jumbo crab cake for starters and it was delicious. Not too much bread and filling to make it appear bigger. It was actually crab in that cake. I also had a southern fried chicken club. It wasn't amazing at all. It was nothing but some fried chicken strips on bread. Hmmm I won't try that again but I will be back.

Hi folks, I went to Wine Country for a few months but now I'm back and have made my Yelp return. Lumbar was coo. Sat outside on a nice sunny day. The host CLAY is a nice fella.  He told me he doesn't play Tennis on clay courts because he feels that would be disrespecting his own name. Turkey burger was good and fries were good. Neither were bangin though. The Hummus on the appetizer section was real good.  The patio is really packed which was kinda of a fiasco, but you know that will be a dabocle going into this fallacy we call Lunch.

With a couple hundred dollars in gift cards for the Gibson's restaurant group burning a hole in my pocket I decided to have a couple meals at Luxbar.  Fairly early on a Saturday we stopped by for lunch. There was no table for two available outside, so we sat inside. I'm fairly certain if they could stack tables on top of each other, they would. The tables on the sidewalk are smooshed so close to each other, if you're looking to make friends, sit outside.  The food was very good. I had the Cross Town Classic burger, a brat patty with a butterflied polish sausage, sauerkraut, onions and mustard on a pretzel bun. It was delicious. I was starving when I got there and between the meat sandwich and the fries it was the perfect lunch for a lazy day of shopping. I've also had the sesame crusted tuna salad, and it was divine. A perfectly light salad with seared tuna, just the right amount of seaweed amongst the lettuce, red and yellow peppers, and a ginger-wasabi dressing. Ooohhh so good.  Of course, you can always order a Gibson steak here. Of course, why not just go to Gibson's if that's what you're looking for? If you're at Luxbar, enjoy some of their tasty creations.  The service was outstanding, as expected at this type of establishment.  With a few hundred more to go on those gift cards, I suspect I'll be back at Luxbar, enjoying an Arnold Palmer at a sidewalk table, cuddled up with the stranger at the table next to me.

Went for breakfast,and have been here before,so we went back. Guess it was a bad idea. When our breakfast came it was wrong, ok easy mistake right? Well 3 tries later we got the right order.....almost. It wasn't anything difficult, oatmeal? Please.....anyway they comped the breakfast and gave us a warm pecan roll for good patience. We will think about another breakfast place next time. Food was ok just frustrating.

Classy and elegent without being pretentious or rude.  Fabulous staff, delicious, mouthwatering entrees and desserts along with great drinks.  Hands down, Luxbar is one of my absolute favorite restaurants in Chicago.  I have celebrated 2 birthdays here and they were fabulous.  I recently celebrated my 21st birthday with several friends at Luxbar and the service and food was better than I had remembered.  The manager is so sweet and came over repeatedly to make sure we were enjoying everything.  Along with that the desserts were on the house and we received an extra one on top of that!  The desserts are absolutely to die for and they are huge.  I definitely recommend the Snicker's Pie (soo good) and the chocolate cake!  One dessert is more than enough and can easily feed 6-7 people!  I come here any chance I get!  Love it! You will not be disappointed!  Love the atmosphere and you can get all dressed up or come casual!  You won't be sorry!  Fabulous restaurant!
If you're in the neighborhood, this place is worth checking out.  A little hipper, younger crowd than Gibson's or some of the other bars in the area.

Nothing too amazing here -- bar/restaurant with pretty good food and drinks at an average cost of food downtown. I wasn't a huge fan of the crowded atmosphere; I'm not really a fan of eating with my back pressed up to a stranger. I had the mahi-mahi which was really good but that might have been because I love vinegar and the sauce was very strong. The asparagus that came with it was not so great, it was hard and bitter (they really need to learn how to broil with olive oil).

Mmm! My meal here was delish! The waiter was able to tell me that he knew for sure that the meal I wanted (it was a special: broiled mahi mahi with a mushroom vinaigrette, asparagus, and rice) was gluten free which was helpful. The fish was cooked perfectly and the vinaigrette was very tasty. My friend had a club sandwich and fries and said it was good too. Service was good. Didn't try any desserts but they looked good on other people's tables! There were a couple things on the menu I thought looked good so I'd definitely go back!

This place makes a great spot for people watching. On the few occasions I have eaten lunch here I have witnessed the following scenes 1. The real housewives of the gold coast : drinking champagne at 1pm on a Friday afternoon with their tots in tow (Why was I there at 1 pm on a Friday? We had a bridal beauty day for a wedding I was in and we ate lunch there aka i called in sick) 2. Someone my age with plastic everything with someone as old as my grandpa's arm draped around her waist. She is usually wearing a fur coat and he is bald.  3. Tables of dudes cheering on the Bulls or Blackhawks. Some looked decent others were in sweatpants.  4. Tourists 5. Any other genre of ppl out there The food is average, the service is great, come here for an interesting scene.

I had heard such good things about Luxbar but I rarely hang out in the Gold Coast so I just assumed they were all true. I went Saturday night just for drinks, so I can't speak to the food. The atmosphere was must different than I expected, in a positive way. From what I've heard and the fact that it's in...well, the neighborhood it's in, I expected something much more pretentious. I was pleasantly surprised. I had heard from a friend that dirty martinis made with pickle juice instead of olive juice are quite delicious, and though they weren't on the menu at Luxbar, they made me one. It was gross, but that's not their fault! I appreciated that they were willing to make me something off the menu and humor me.  I would definitely like to go back for dinner some time.

Came here for Sunday brunch. Food was excellent. Eggs Benedict was made to perfection. The orange juice was warm...thought that was a bit odd. Service was okay but it was busy so I figured it wouldn't be the greatest. Lots of seating and I loved that we were able to sit at a table that was half inside and half outside. (No direct sunlight for me!) Can't wait to head back there this Sunday!

just had brunch at luxbar, was a pretty poor experience. today was the first day in several months that had warm weather, so i knew things were going to be busy. a friend of mine had made a reservation a few days prior and requested to be seated upstairs. our reservation was for 12 pm and our friends didn't show up until 12:20 pm. we were seated downstairs despite having made reservations for upstairs. the hostess was rude at best and insisted that we didn't want to sit upstairs. being overtly insistent to customers when you're restaurant staff is a good sign that you suck at your job. our waiter was nice and he was pleasant to interact with. despite this, we received unusually slow service, even relative to the other tables he was serving adjacent to us. many people were seated after us and were served and even left *before* we were served. we were seated at 1220 pm and got our entrees at 130 pm. i had requested 2 types of beer that both ended up being out but it took the waiter 10 minutes each time to tell me this. 30 minutes after i first ordered a beer i had it sent to the table. overall the food was pretty good but my friend found the veggie burger to be *terrible*. others at the table tasted it and corroborated her conclusion. the waiter clearly noticed our dissatisfaction and removed the veggie burger and my beer from our bill. i will never come back to this place, the service was awful. the place had a good atmosphere but this is not europe and the quality of the food was not worth the unusually long wait.

I've been to Luxbar for dinner (pretty good burger) and brunch (I've had better smoked salmon and bagels). Nice decor and decent place to go in Gold Coast. Also, no fountain Diet Coke. Seems to be a trend in my reviews.

Great Service from Makayla, John the Manager also was Fantastic and Very Hands on.  The food is good and so are the drinks. I Don't dig that the bathrooms are on the second floor.  But this is a great spot.

What's wrong with a little bit of fun in the Viagara Triangle? We were hungry and I just finished a devastating round of class and desperately wanted my escape. Having earned my freedom, my friends met up and we all strolled over to LuxBar. With a large group we were seated at several tables locked in but there were not enough seats for everyone and the staff didn't do anything like make room or ask if some of us would have liked to have sat at a particular table. I quickly ordered a drink and took awhile to digest the menu but I eventually decided on the Sunrise Burger. The drinks eventually arrived and my group had fun but I had to stand to get near my friends since they sat me about a mile away from everyone else. The trappings were fancy with white cloth tables and plenty of room in their dining room. People looked like they were from Gold Coast proper, but I didn't mind. How was the food? The burger stacks up pretty well to many burgers across the city. The bacon? Perfect slabs of pork cooked to crispiness. The fried egg did not explode so the burger maintained its integrity. I didn't have to lace the burger with condiments to enjoy it and it definitely whetted my appetite. The fries are best done with truffle as I learned when I began kidnapping fries off my friend's plate. Overall Luxbar serves up the goods if you can get them, but don't try to stroll in there with your personal army.

Add me to the list of those who like this place, esp. for the truffle fries. Th flavor is amazing.  They serve it w/ catsup and garlic mayo but I would say skip them as you want to enjoy the truffle flavor all for itself.   The service was friendly and the atmosphere was welcoming and comforting.
Business meeting.  Fun food and great drinks

I've gone here more times than is reasonable.  The prices are reasonable for the area and the food is always good (not spectacular).  Some of the best crab cakes in the city.  I tend to stay away from the weekend crowd but a very solid place is looking to go someplace nicer for a weekday dinner.

Okay folks. Luxbar is weird. Weird as in its got these lovely dark mahongany panelings, great chandelier fixtures, and decent wine/beer list. The waiters are all in white button downs and the manager personally checks to make sure you're happy with your food. The lounge area upstairs is comfortable and feels like its out of a corporate boardroom atrium... ...with sports screens. And hip-hop music. Now, I'm not complaining, cause I love baseball and Kanye as much as anyone else, but it was...unexpected? Mismatched? I'm not sure. Oddness aside, the food was fabulous. I'm throwing my hat into the circle of previous reviewers who swear by the truffle fries, cause god are they good. Also, hummus appetizer plate is delicious! I got the special of chicken breast with veggies and brown rice. Fairly priced and delicious, though the breast was a little dry. Went up to the lounge area for drinks after and those lovely bartenders sure know how to make a good double vodka tonic. :) All in all, a solid place.

I felt like the boys from the Delta house going to see Otis Day and the Knights when I walked into Luxbar. Yep, I'm out of place here. All I wanted was a low key weekend lunch. The huge table of extras from Zoolander that greeted our arrival let me know it would at least be an entertaining experience.  Packed to the gills, my wife and I were fortunate to score one of the cushy booths that bordered the bar area. My ADD was in full flare as I drifted....beers, interesting menu, cool place, I'm under-dressed, the people watching here is outstanding, Noah jersey (when will we get him back?) , is that toddler wearing a Burberry sweater?, I could sure use a brew and what will I be eating?  Our waitress arrived and we got right to it. A round of the Bell's Winter White for both of us. We split the fantastic sweet chili calamari which was tossed with bell peppers and hoisin-chili sauce. Those may have been the best I've had and we cleaned that plate in no time. Kris had the Autumn Harvest salad-brussel sprout leaves, arugula, butternut squash, wild mushrooms, dried cherries, pumpkin seeds, bacon, beet chips and mustard vinaigrette. It was a huge salad and she loved it. I had the Crosstown classic, which was kind of like a brat burger. Stay with me on this because it was great. Sheboygan brat patty, Paulina mkt polish, sauerkraut, mustard and onions on a pretzel bun. Add to that the very tasty truffle fries and I was in heaven. Portions were huge and we enjoyed everything we had.  The upstairs lounge looked like it would be quite the scene for happy hour or nighttime. The glitterati that seemed to be surrounding us during lunch simply confirmed that we are literally much more at home having our weekend lunches at our usual West Loop haunts. That said, we still had a nice time here.

If you like the downtown after work bar scene than this is probably one of your favorites, just not really my scene. Luxbar definitely is a sight to be seen, very classy interior. Came at 6 after work and it was very easy to find a table in the bar area, the service was great and the wine was delicious!  For dinner I had the Lux Club with Roasted Turkey, Avocado, Jack cheese, Cucumber and Chipoltle mayo. Served with Chips for $12. After overhearing that you could substitute any side other than the truffle fries for no additional charge I quickly switched mine to the Mac and Cheese and it was delicious. Like most club sandwiches the portion was huge and I had half packed up for lunch the next day. The sandwich was fresh and good but nothing I will be craving in the future or running back for. My friend got the Roasted portabello sandwich and it looked amazing though it was completely unrealistically to actually eat. It came out on two long and very skinny baguette slices and fell a part as soon as she picked it up. Great classy place to eat if you are in the area or love being IN the SCENE but its just A-OK in my book.

I have always loved the place for its variety of people and its ability to blend in a high end area. This is the place to go to for sliders, the vegetarian burger (it MELTS in your mouth) and their too die for truffle fries.  I was there on Martin Luther King's birthday when it was quite crowded. Without missing a beat the manager (of both Hugo's and Gibson's its sister restaurants) gave us water. It was a nice touch to know that the management was on top of things- even if it means getting something as simple as water. I can't say I've been around for their brunch- but their desserts are worth the calories as well. If you are looking for a casual place where you can bring friends from out of town- this is the place. If you are looking for a nice place to take a client- this is also the place. The food is comparable to Rocket- but a better atmosphere to sit back and relax.

I know most people wouldn't think of coming here and ordering oatmeal, but it hit the spot this past weekend morning when I knew I would be going out drinking/eating crap the rest of the day to watch football.  The oatmeal was the  bomb.com !  It comes with marinated, plump raisins and brown sugar.  The waiter happily gave us some sliced banana upon request, which was delish.   One MAJOR issue: I ordered the half grapefruit, and it was literally impossible to eat because 1) they gave me a tiny little seafood fork to eat it instead of a grapefruit spoon, and 2) the chef did not appropriately cut the grapefruit for me.  I literally asked for a STEAK KNIFE to free my grapefruit from its pithy chains, and I ended up mangling it.  I was only able to salvage a few small, sweet bites, and after my grapefruit struggle, how sweet they were.

I went here with a guy as part of a night out and did not realize that someone could fall into the people watching scene. Part of me wanted to ditch him and walk around solo, just mingling with people and seeing the scene. However, I didn't and we settled into a nice table near the back, however, it was a busy night and the noise level was a bit offputting. If you're just out and about, I'd definitely check this place out for the truffle fries alone, but if you're trying to woo someone, I'd go somewhere more quiet, and romantic, like Hot Chocolate. We noshed on a couple of appetizers, and it shames me to admit that I ate almost all the truffle fries...LOL. But we shared the truffle fries, the sesame seared tuna and filet mignon sliders. I had a martini that had grapehead candies on the rim, and while the alcohol was strong, I suddenly felt like I was 9 years old, fighting my best friend for a box of jellybeans (we really fought over them, just so you guys know). So, I had a great time.  I take off one star for the noise, and another for the search for parking, even though the hostess (I called for an exact address) told us that parking was no problem. I'm not complaining that the parking was almost nonexistent, I know the area can be crowded, but don't lie to me just to get me to come in. We were less than 10 minutes away as it was....

It really shouldn't be a surprise that I like this place. I spent a little of my New Year's Eve here having dinner and enjoyed myself. I love to people watch here and this particular night was made for awesome people watching.
On vacation with my husband and I must say Luxbar was a great late night bite! It is great food even after hours and I would definitely go back if I am in the area!

Despite my Matt Forte hairline, Willem DaFoe smile lines, Vince Vaughn belly, and Demi Moore boobage, I am not a frequent visitor to the VT. Yes, I realize that by the aforementioned comparisons, it sounds like I should be but I have a few (few) years left in me before I completely shut down. That's when I'll, likely, be 'that guy' hanging out in the VT. By necessity. I'm not there yet, so I hang out there by choice (and not often). Luxbar was a surprisingly good time. For some reason, I always confused it with Grand Lux, so the fact that I found it without winding up on Michigan was a triumph for me. I quickly made my way through the throngs of un-uncologned masses downstairs and made my way to the second floor, where I could gaze out the windows to my kingdom, walk out into the balcony... and realize that, without baggage, this is a pretty choice locale. It's pretty, y'all. I see why older guys with money and younger gals looking for it hang out here. Time to break out my freakum heels and get those dollars! Ugh. Distracted. Okay. Yeah. Balcony. Windows. View. Yes. Here. What a nice venue to suck down some cocktails, eat some apps and network with pretty folks. The apps are pleasurable. The quesadillas were my favorite. Red chili chicken plus asthma-hound chihuahua cheese is awesome. I threw in the asthma-hound, but wouldn't that be righteous? The chicken tenders are generous in size and the honey-mustard dipping sauce will make you say 'yum.' The wings are tasty and the people I was with went to town on the silders (I am not a big beef fan). I found the service to be efficient to conversational and the bar almost kept me on a liquid diet thanks to its expert rendering of the Greyhound (vodka, not gin).  If you need a place to pre-game on a late summer/early fall day and check out some cool scenery (of the non-human and inorganic kind), you could do far worse than Luxbar. You just might see me there in five months. But, you might have me confused with a celebrity. It happens.

Went here for dinner on NYE & the food was pretty meh. Luxbar loves to douse alot of their food in truffle oil i will tell you that and although I know truffle oil is of the bourgeosie palette, I gotta tell you I don't really care for it too much...so if they served regular fries as opposed to truffle fries I probably wouldn't care either way.  I ordered the steak salad for dinner since I didn't want to eat something super heavy...had to save up room in my stummy for the heavy drinking instead!!! The plating of my meal wasn't very nice either they had three pieces of steaks thrown to the side of my "iceberg wedge" smothered in bleu cheese..steak wasn't too bad though but presentation was a bit lack luster. I did enjoy my winter mojito though & several glasses of champagne!!!

I will keep this short and sweet.  There are many thing I love about Luxbar and only one I don't love.  First, I wish they delivered.  Other than that, I am fan. When I used to live right down the street from Lux in the Gold Coast, I would often order and pick-up food on my way home.  I love the ability to order breakfast all day and speaking of breakfast, their weekend brunch isn't half bad, though I typically whip up my own weekend feasts!  They have other delicious salad choices.  I would recommend the Ceasar Salad if that is your bag - they do a good job.  Be careful, the lettuce come in strips, but its always crispy and delicious. So, if you have a chance, go for it.  You probably won't be disappointed.

Though we just missed Vince Vaughn, we were still quite chipper as we slid into our seats.  I was feeling adventurous and snatched the Sunrise Burger (bacon, fried egg, cheese), medium rare.  A fried egg on a burger = messy plate, happy tummy.  My friend's turkey burger?  Eh.  My husband's slider plate?  Hilarious!  The sliders were minuscule hors d'oeuvres (2 bites each max), though I heard the filet mignon choice was rather good - not enough food to share with the wifey. The beer cheese soup was a tasty side for a hot day.  I'd go back...during happy hour.

LuxBar is deluxicious!  Don't confuse this place with the touristy Grand Lux which is owned by the Cheesecake Factory.  This is one of my favorite places in the Gold Coast area of the city - also known as being in the heart of  the V Triangle.   I love the airy and woodsy feel of the dining room/ bar area.  It's a comfortable place with great service. It's filled with a diverse group of city people, some tourists and also kid friendly with a coolness factor.   There's not too many places that cater to all three types of crowds - the Chicago single crowd noshing on great hangover food on Saturday afternoon, an older crowd that appreciates the menu and the families with children who love the fact that everyone is welcome without feeling likek they don't belong.   So let's talk about LuxBar's food!  It's all fabulous.  The appetizers range from some yummy sliders (beef, steak, turkey selections)  ahi tuna and  just about everything is great off the apps list. The burgers are fantastic and even though I'm not a big burger queen, I love them.  They have wonderful hand cut truffle fries - crispy and seasoned perfectly.  The salads are huge and my favorite is the seared ahi tuna - rare and just not just a couple of pieces of tuna.  The salads are a meal and repeatedly come here to try them all out.   Next door is the Original Pancake house which is always busy on weekend mornings but what many people don't know is that LuxBar serves breakfast - it's a great selection of eggs, omelettes, pancakes and a beautifully served lox platter.  I'll take a mimosa please!  Thank you LuxBar, I think I will!   I can come here with my husband and have a great meal and time, I can visit with my girlfriends and have a great meal and people watching and I can come here with my small kids and not feel like we don't belong there.  It caters to everyone and serves up some great food!

How do I sum up my feelings about and experiences of Lux Bar? It's almost impossible, but here we go.  **Brunch** Lux Bar used to have a brunch buffet upstairs on the weekends, but even after abandoning the brunch bar, brunch is still excellent. Lux Bar follows in the tradition of Hugo's and Gibson's around the corner (conceptualized and owned by the same group) in their brunch menu. The menu isn't exactly what I would call innovative, but it's incredibly high quality.  **Burgers** You just can't go wrong. Again like Hugo's and Gibson's, these burgers are large, juicy, and lovely. Take it from a burger aficionado - I'd definitely recommend the burgers here. The filet mignon sliders with truffle butter are also really, really good.  **Fried chicken** You can get a bucket of super high quality fried chicken, and though you might have a heart attack after eating it, it's so worth it. Crispy, juice, salty.... it's all good.  **Drinks** All the drinks are yummy, but my new favorite is the "Two Passions," which has passion fruit and pineapple juices with vodka. It was so good that I had three before I knew it the last time I was in town.  **Dessert** While the dessert menu isn't as extensive as that at Hugo's and Gibson's, the desserts are certainly still on the same scale, by which I mean HUGE. Seriously, don't order a dessert for fewer than four people. These desserts are sumptuous, indulgent, and oh so good.  **Atmosphere** Lux Bar is always fun, always packed, and always feels like a party. It can get a little loud in there at night sometimes, but these is a great place to run and grab an upscale-casual bite and/or drink. I love swinging by when I have tons of energy but don't necessarily want to go somewhere very far or very fussy.  **Negatives**  - There are only a couple of things I don't like about Lux Bar. Living in the neighborhood (across the street, actually) the fact that they keep all the doors open on the second floor all night every night during the summer is a major detractor. It's fun if you're on the inside, but not if you're on the outside trying to conduct your life. It's very loud, always, inside and out, and you have to be in the mood for that much noise (even on a quiet night).  - While the servers are always efficient, they're not always the most friendly (nor are the hostesses) . Other than that, I think Lux Bar is great and I'd really recommend it (and a number of things off the menu) to anyone.

Upscale burgers, sandwiches, soup and truffle fries. Try the truffle macaroni and cheese. Delicious brunch. The real draw is the people watching. One of my favorite places to people watch in the summer. The wait for a table outside is well worth it. The Triangle at its best.

A friend was in town and we were trying to work out where to meet for lunch. Through a happy coincidence, we both happened to be within two blocks of this place. We just wanted burgers and a cocktail, and Yelp gave this place the fewest $ for burgers in walking distance of where we both were. Her husband and son were with her, the kid is 11. He liked his Lux Royale burger. I got the sunrise burger and it was delicious. My friend got two sliders and they weren't bad but they weren't amazing. She also got a bowl of the Wisconsin cheddar soup and she really liked it. I can't remember what burger her husband got but he liked his, too.  The service was excellent; friendly and attentive. We got there around 1:30 so it wasn't crowded and since I'd taken the there and they didn't have a car parking wasn't an issue, but there is public parking right around the corner on State. Prices were perfectly reasonable, too, especially for a neighborhood with some really pricey alternatives. Four stars because I'm not ready to commit to the "as good as it gets" label based just on a burger and a rum & coke. I'll be back, though, to try out appetizers and dessert.

I have drank in a few bars, 10 tops!  I may never have the opportunity to hand out a 5 star again and I am proud they're my first. There is no way I can ever come up with enough congratulatory quips.  I spent my first weekend ever in Chicago and all three nights we went to this bar and sat in amazement at the speed in which they worked and the team work between bar keeper and wait staff.  Easily they turned 300 to 500 if not more covers a night? Never not once we're they in the weeds.
