We on average tipped them 40% and we were drinking $14 martini's with an average in house time of 4 hours so the tabs were healthy!  The people watching was "off the hook"!  AMAZING!  Thanks Tim for the comps and the execution, I will be back!

I've been here for a few times for dinner.  Honestly its been less than memorable, the entrees are good but nothing to write home about.  Brunch on the other hand is pretty solid.  I've had the egg benedict and the lox platter, both would be worth getting again.  Nothing on the menu suit your tastes?  I've seen the wait staff grab a steak from their sister restaurant upon request, more than once Honestly, you're not coming to lux bar for the food.  Its a great scene for people watching.  When I was at brunch on Sunday,  I thought it was Father/Daughter brunch day....turns out it wasn't....

I went there only once and I had the filet mignon sliders.  It was for the Hurricane Katrina benefit.  Those were the BEST burgers I have had in my life and people should try them.  Obviously a great cut of meat. Do NOT put condiments on it because it is good all by itself. Oh and nice decor.

Luxbar used to be a great neighborhood place, a real neighborhood place where you knew everyone but now it seems like a revolving door.  They have "lost" a couple of great managers, the wait staff is constantly changing, and even the chefs are coming and going.  We used to go three to four nights a week but even we didn't even know the people.   The food has become inconsistent (did they shrink the ribs??) and while the menu seems to change, it always stays the same.  It is a nice place for sitting outside in the summer, but for food and service, skip it.

I came here for a birthday party at the bar on the second floor. The service was outstanding. Everyone was on their game. The drinks were great.  We had the chicken strips, chips and guacamole, steak casadias and cuscus. It was all very good. I want to come back here for dinner as a good time was had by all.

To be honest I'm giving Luxbar 5 stars simply because I went in yoga spandex for lunch the other day and not one hostess looked at me funny or treated me any differently than the hott girls and guys walking in and out of the restaurant.   But seriously the food here is great.  I've had brunch lunch and dinner and have yet to stumble upon a subpar entree.  Even better, the dishes are relatively cheap for the area, and you can't put a pricetag on the people watching.  Out of this world.

My cousin's brunch after his wedding was held here.  I was underwhelmed.  Everything was good but not great and pretty standard.  Lox and Bagels, plenty of pastries and fruit and a omelet station.  I did love the eggs Benedict.  The hollandaise sauce was very light, a nice touch with the push towards healthier food.

My friend and I took another friend out to dinner here for her birthday while we were in town visiting.  The truffle fries were quite good and had good truffle flavor.  We were able to compare them to plain fries, since my friend ordered a burger. I got 3 sliders sandwiches (pulled pork, kobe burger, and fried chicken).  The kobe burger and the pulled pork were delicious, perfectly seasoned.  The fried chicken sandwich was a bit disappointing, so I'm glad I didn't t a whole fried chicken sandwich.   The portions here are quite large, including the order of truffle fries.  My friend couldn't finish her caprese sandwich, which she said was very tasty.  My other friend really enjoyed her kobe beef burger.  I'm not surprised considering how tasty my kobe beef slider was.   It's definitely noisy here but I completely understand why large groups come here.

I used to work on Mag Mile, and Luxbar was my favorite local place to go for a sit down lunch.  I've had dinner and drinks there as well, but I've enjoyed it for lunch the most. In the warmer months, wait at the bar for an outdoor table for some always-great Viagra triangle people watching.  The things I've seen/heard there...so hilarious. In the winter, get a side of mac and cheese; it's slightly sweet, as I think they use pub cheddar in it. All club sandwiches are good, but the fried chicken (a house specialty) club is especially cronic, and the lux burger is good with a side of truffle fries. The service is consistently B to B+, and I vastly prefer the atmosphere to it's brethren Hugo's and Gibson's.

Quick afternoon stop here on a Monday for lunch before heading back home to NYC. I opted for the fish sandwich which was tasty but nothing that blew my mind. Service was friendly and attentive. It was so hot outside we took a seat inside so we could not enjoy the outdoor seating and take advantage of the prime people watching real estate.  This seems like a great spot for the lunch time business set and for tourists on the weekend.

so i have to say it was quite an experience. made a reservation 2 days prior, arrived on time and had to wait 20 min for a table. then after we had ordered and gotten our appetizer we were asked to move from our table to the bar because the management had overbooked and didn't have enough table space. they were very apologetic but really?!? if you don't have enough room then don't take the reservation!!!   they offered to pay for our app if we moved, but ended up paying for the entire meal. i think that was because a very very drunk patron started eating from our food, and to top it all off, dropped her drink spilling wine and broken glass all over my leg. (which wouldn't have happened if we weren't at the bar) the food was good, the service excellent, and they stepped up to compensate us for the inconvenience, but not sure if i'm ever going back. i think the key maybe to stay away on the weekend nights if you actually want to have a meal instead of just drinks

It's ok - I've eaten here for breakfast and lunch.  The lunch menu offers some more creative options than the breakfast one does. It seems highly overpriced for the quality but the service and atmosphere are nice. There's not a whole lot on here if you're vegetarian, vegan, or gluten free.  I think the Original Pancake house next door might be a better breakfast/bunch option although the decor isn't as nice.  I wouldn't necessarily suggest this place to anyone but I wouldn't scoff at it either, as such, a nice and neutral 3 stars.

Good call by my local friend Adam. My husband and I were in town for the Rock N Roll 1/2 marathon this past weekend, and later that evening we wanted to meet up with a few friends. This place is the kind of place I love. Nice ambiance, big bar, indoor and outdoor seating and a great menu.  Our bartender was very friendly and even bought us a round of drinks. If we weren't so tired from the 13 mile run that morning, I would have loved to hang out there all night long. We shared stories and laughs over delightful truffle fries, edamame and hummus. Our entrees ranged from a steak salad, to a turkey burger and grilled white fish... all of which we enjoyed.  If I wasn't enjoying my company so much, I would have loved to people watch a little more closely after hearing all about 'Viagra Triangle". Perhaps next time.

We were looking for some good Sunday Brunch and stumbled upon this place.  Eggs, pancakes, french toast, bacon, belgian waffles... it has all the staples.  It's close to Michican Ave and the best part was that we could eat outside.  Not sure if they have breakfast outside all the time, but the Sunday brunch was well worth it.

This was my first visit to Chicago of any decent length since my mom moved from the suburbs to Gold Coast, so I got the opportunity to discover a few of her new neighborhood spots. First on the itinerary was Luxbar. Apparently she does really come here pretty often because the manager stopped by and personally checked in on us, introduced himself to me, and wished us a good evening! Now that's good service for regular customers. It was way too hot to eat out in the street tables, but the inside didn't at all feel like a red-headed stepchild to the outdoor setting. Just eating there made me feel like I was really cool, and the place had a very young and funky vibe. The list of specialty cocktails and mixed drinks were quite extensive, as well as the wine list. There weren't a lot of food options outside of burgers and sandwiches, but they had a whitefish special that was prefect and pretty tasty. Prices are quite reasonable for the area. Our server misunderstood that we wanted salads before entrees and brought them out at the same time, but he brought back our entrees and had the kitchen remake them after we'd finished the salads without a fuss. Other than that miscommunication service was great. If I lived here I don't think I'd make Luxbar a regular dinner spot, just because of the somewhat limited menu. However, I'd definitely come chill here with a drink, appetizer, and some friends.

You step into the bar, located rite off of Rush, and you are immediately overwhelmed by the rich wooden walls and dark marble accents. The tables are placed in a simple manner, yet they manage to look very elegant. Service is very quick and the menu is relatively cheap, offering a variety of specialties. I was introduced to the joint by a friend and have begun to introduce my other friends to it, too. So far, all good responses. My favorites on the menu are the Colby Slider and the Truffle fries. There's something warm and comforting about a burger and fries but this combination just reinvents the classic and just takes taste to a whole new level from the second it hits the palate. The beef in this particular patty is perfectly moist and paired simply with caramelized onions and truffle butter. Honestly, doesn't get any better when it comes to sliders. The fries are also to-die-for. Though they may be a couple dollars overpriced ($7), you do receive a generous portion and are obviously paying for the truffle oil the potatoes are cooked in. To finish off the plate, the frites are dusted off with plenty of Parmesan cheese and parsley. I can go on and on about the entrees but to be completely honest, I would say skip out on the dessert and grab some ice cream or gelato from a nearby shop. The dessert is very mediocre and technically could be easily replicated in my own kitchen. Just not worth the money and the waiting. Three words to describe the Luxbar: delicious, cheap, unique.

Went here to watch the World Cup final with a group of local friends.  We had a good table in between 3 TVS, which was key given the occasion.  The hummus plate was tasty, and big, and the truffle fries were AWESOME.  Unfortunately - no one really loved their main lunch dishes.  I had a salad that was mostly romaine, though the avocado was good and fresh.  The other problem was that the waitress came over every five minutes, asking us if we wanted anything else, even though it was clear we were watching the game.  I'm sure I'll be back, since it's nearby, but will remember to skip for sporting events.

After a full day of walking up and down the mag mile in 90+ degree heat, my friends and decided to look for somewhere to recharge and get something to eat in this restaurant-dense area. Luxbar's cute patio and simple, typical American cafe/bar food menu was exactly what we were looking for. I had the veggie burger, which was made out of an assortment of rice, veggies and nuts, along with a side salad with the house dressing, which was white wine balsamic vinaigrette or something like that. The veggie burger tasted OK but it was a little on the mushy side and the salad was pretty worthless - lettuce with two cherry tomatoes, some red onions and the dressing either was absent or tastes like water.  The service was perfectly nice and attentive and our water glasses were constantly filled, even with our parched selves eagerly gulping it down. My choices were probably not the best representation of the quality of their food as a whole, so I would not be opposed to going back and trying other things or just enjoying a drink on the patio on a nice day.

Nice bar for relatively well-off people who live in the area. There's plenty of seating for everyone, but still room to dance too.  The music is top 40's pop hits for the most part. I have to add that while I haven't been to as many bars as some people, I have been to a lot of different kinds of bars that cater to different kinds of people (college grads, older crowd, young rich crowd, weird types, etc).  Out of the bars that I've been to, this place had some of the worst dancing I have ever seen lol.  Let's just say that everyone should keep their day jobs.

Lux Bar is a personal favorite. Is the food amazing? No. Is it within 3 blocks from my apartment? Yes. It's our neibhborhood joint. The food is decent, prices are fair, and the ambience is acceptable.  However, 2 things need to be fully recognized. Their coffee and grilled cheese and tomato soup. My boyfriend and I go to Lux on the weekends and usually both get a cup of coffee (which is delicious) and the grilled cheese and tomato soup. The soup is creamy and comforting and has fresh permasan shaved on top. The grilled cheese is basic challah with lots of american cheese melted to plastic-fake cheese perfection. The grilled cheese isn't anything special, clearly, but the soup really makes the dish. It's a hangover cure-all.  Lux is a good deal for the money, but don't expect to be wowed by the food.

One of my favorite places to go for a low key dinner. Always good, i've never had a bad experience here. Gets crowded on weekends. All around great food. Everything I've had here is great. I'm still a little sad they took away the pub cheese but the burgers are still great. Awesome calamari. Great place to go grab a drink and very reasonable for the area.

Honestly, being in the PR-AD-Marketing world, I know a good industry bar when I see one and Luxbar is definitely one of my favorite industry bar's.  As always the atmosphere is reviewed first.  I feel like I'm in a bar from 1950 with the cast of Mad Men surrounding me.  All of the wood floors, banisters and tables, not to mention the extended bar, makes me feel right at home.  The high pub tables are great for conversation about the day and the perfect size for appetizers and drinks. My favorite thing about Luxbar is the menu- not necessarily the food (I'll get to that in a second) but the menu size, it's small/limited, which for someone that can't always decide between A, B and C- is fantastic.  They have a great variety, but only a couple of burgers, a few sandwiches and salads.  The sides are really great with truffle mac&cheese and a baked sweet potato (of course they have fries as well!).  The food is pretty great, but the dirty martini's are wonderful.  The food and drink combo is great for any day after work for cocktail hour, but I really enjoy going here on a Friday to get my weekend started. Luxbar is a great place for a date client drinks.  You really can't go wrong with any occasion (they have a great party room upstairs!), but I highly recommend Luxbar for cocktail hour and apps or a light dinner.  Enjoy and say hi to the industry peeps for me ;)

After a rather mediocre lunch yesterday all I wanted was to sit outside and stuff my face with fried chicken. Yep, I'm easy to please. Met Keri H here (and I'm supposed to mention that hell hath indeed frozen over since she arrived before I did), who was sitting at the bar, enjoying a glass of wine. We went outside to look for a table and were greeted by the host who said that there was nothing available but would take our name and let us know when a table opened. Fine. We went back to the bar and I needed a drink. The bartender never once made eye-contact with me so I finally asked to see a drink menu. He gave me a wine list, but there were no cocktails listed, so I asked to see a martini list. He obliged by practically throwing me a menu. I ordered something called a Luxbar Sling, which was Stoli Blueberry, Stoli Razz, muddled strawberries, lime , and club soda. Sounds delicious, right? It was a little boring actually, and it didn't help that it was made by the most apathetic bartender ever. He never smiled, engaged us in friendly banter or even seemed like he wanted to be there at all. A little while later I needed to pay a visit to the ladies room and asked the bartender where it was. To my chagrin, he told me it was "upstairs" and since I am on crutches, I braced myself for the trek. Thankfully, Keri remembered that they had an elevator I could use instead of the stairs. Why the bartender couldn't have told me that, I have no idea. I hobbled to the elevator and I couldn't figure out what floor since there was no signage of any kind. I just guessed at the second floor and walked out practically into a busser's station. I asked him where I could find the ladies room and he pointed down a hall. It was just weird. Anyway, I got back to the bar and ordered another drink. I didn't feel like picking anything different out so I went with the same drink I started with. This time it came with muddled blueberries instead of strawberries. It didn't fare any better and so much for consistency when making cocktails. We noticed that we had been waiting awhile for our table, so Keri went to check the status. She was talking to the host a long time before she motioned for me to come out as they finally had our table. I asked her what happened and she said the host didn't have our name and acted surprised that we were looking for our table. I wasn't that surprised; that's the kind of stuff they pull at Gibson's too - saving tables for "regulars" who may or may not deign to eat there on that given night, but god forbid you don't have a table for them. So the rest of us stare at the open tables wishing we could sit down. As I mentioned, I wanted fried chicken so there was no pondering of the menu for me. Keri ordered some kind of whitefish and a side of mac and cheese and we also split an order of guacamole to start. The guacamole was pretty good; it had a nice little kick to it and the chips were crispy and fresh. It was quite an ample portion as well. Our main courses arrived. My chicken came with hand-cut fries which were fantastic. The chicken was really greasy (kind of par for the course, I realize, but this was overwhelmingly so) and the breading, while crispy,  wasn't really stuck to the chicken and kind of fell off when you took a bite. It was good enough, but I want to eat the crispy crust on the chicken, not off the plate. Keri said her fish was not good and that it tasted like ass. Well, she didn't really say that, but I can't recall the actual adjective she used. Ever the asparagus whore she is, she didn't even eat all of that which came on the side, so that must not have been good either. Underwhelmed, we paid our bill and left. I suppose I'd come back and have some drinks and maybe the sliders people seem to love, but Luxbar didn't really do it for me.

Ive been here for lunches, dinners and a wedding shower-no complaints here! Im a HUGE fan of their sliders and salads. Its best during the summer to sit outside and people watch, but its always bustling inside too whether at the tables or the bar. A Viagra Triangle staple.

Visiting a friend, we thought we'd grab a quick bite for lunch.  The menu was just what we were looking for at a reasonable price. I ordered the Lux Royale burger (2 beef patties w/ American Cheese, sauteed onions, lettuce, tomato, ketchup, and mustard), I asked them to hold the ketchup and mustard. Our order arrived after quite a while and they left off my lettuce and tomato and slathered on the ketchup and mustard.  The french fries were also cold.  I kindly ask to have it redone, and they comply.  The manager came out to apologize too. The new burger comes out with just cheese and beef patties.   The patties were some of the thinnest I've seen at a restaurant and overcooked.   Too frustrated to bother them further, I eat the greasy, overcooked, flaccid burger.  I've had better quality food at McDonald's...and at least they still get the order right the first time.  Appropriately, I was not charged for the burger. For a chic restaurant in this location my expectations may have been high, but I never expected such a deplorable meal.

Get the sliders!   I had 3: Kobe beef (my least favorite of the three, but still very good) Filet (my favorite!) Fried chix (finger lickin' g-o-o-d) They are tiny, but were perfect to fill me up.  They were also cooked to my liking of medium.  I washed it down with a glass of dreamy gruner veltliner followed by a prosecco.  What's up with my current obsession with prosecco??  Who knows?  But I'm embracing it!   It was very crowded for a weeknight, however, we got seats right up at the bar immediately.  Interesting crowd--some were there to watch the Blackhawks game and some were there to look pretty and flip their hair around.  I'm not sure if I'd go back any time soon, but I am glad to have tried it out.

Great service deserves great compliments.  My best friend and his investment banker brother joined my wife and me at LuxBar.  Eating outdoors in great weather--what could be better?  However, two of us ordered Prime Rib.  We were told by our server that the kitchen was out of very rare, but that they had medium rare.  Two of the three of us said "OK".  When delivered, it was anything but medium rare, unless you call borderline gray "rare".  Here's the cool part.  The manager, John Damas, asked us how everything was going.  I was polite.  "OK". He could tell by my voice that it wasn't "OK".  He said "Please--I'm here to help. Is there anything not to your satisfaction?"  I told him the problem.  He said, "Order anything else off the menu, and this meal is on me."  He did this for three entres.  AND, he then said, "I can't help if I don't know.  Be sure to let me know if you ever have a problem."  FYI, we drank alot of good wine that night, and the server received a $200 tip, and I also tipped John nicely for "over the top" good service.  I told him we would see him again soon, and believe me we will.  You should too.  Great food, great service. Great location.  Check it out!

I've been here a few times, and I really like Luxbar.  The service and ambiance are top notch.  Their patio is great spot for people watching.  The food here is really good too, and the prices are pretty reasonable compared to other restaurants in the area.  I recommend the salads, soups, and burgers.  Oh, and the drinks are pretty tasty was well.  :)

Bar/restaurant in a hoopin' area! Dine el fresco if u can get a seat! I had the King Crab salad- excellent & fresh- perfect for a hot summer nite- the dressing was a bit oniony though. Service is a bit slow. The onion strings were tasty, crunchy and not greasy. The Mojitos were OK- I've had better. But this is a hot spot- you can lounge/bar hop easily from here....nice people watching too w a real broad mix of ages.

Okay, this review isn't completely fair because I only had 1 drink while at Luxbar but take it for what it's worth. My friends and I came here while we were waiting for the Drawing Room to call us for our reservation so we each got a drink. I ordered the perfect margarita martini. My friend had the grapehead martini and my other friend had some yellowish martini with a cherry at the bottom. Everyone seemed to love theirs but I LOVED mine! I could have had 6 of em! It was perfectly boozy, very boozy but sweet and acidic and frothy like a martini should be. I don't care if everything else there is terrible. I would come back for that. The gradpehead rim on my friend's drink was pretty creative too.

A good friend and I made a lunch date to meet at Luxbar and I had no idea when I stepped in the joint that I would have a mind-blowingly delicious burger. I love burgers and all, but I tend to stay away from them. After you hook it up the way you want and get all the other fattening burger accoutrements, you've ingested about 5,000 calories. However, after reading the description of the BBQ Burger, I just HAD to have it. This burger, which I had prepared medium, was stuffed and layered with bbq, jack cheese, "tangled" onions ( huh?) and served with a side of thinly cut fries had me making noises  like I was the star of a Vivid production. Yeah, it was that good. The two glasses of pinot grigio were icing. The restaurant is classy, service is fast and friendly and I will definitely be back soon.

Came here for dinner and our table ordered a bunch of different things. I started off with some chicken noodle and thought it was the next best thing!!! Our table split ribs, skirt steak, truffle fries, truffle mac and cheese, and it was all excellent!!! I would like to come back here soon.

Lovely outdoor seating area that is great for people watching on Rush Street. Great place for happy hour drinks. Also a great spot for an outdoor brunch. We came in on a Saturday between breakfast and lunch and I couldn't quite decide if I wanted to order from the brunch menu or not. So I compromised and got a bloody Mary to go with my lunch entree. Ordered the slider combo, which comes with your choice of two sliders and either a soup or salad. I had the Wisconsin cheddar ale soup with the filet mignon and kobe burger sliders. The kobe burger slider with caramelized onions was good but the filet mignon slider was fantastic--I'll be ordering two of those next time. And although it's not listed on their drink menu, my bloody Mary was pretty decent--at least it had a piece of celery in it. On my first visit here for drinks we received fabulous service, but this time around our server was not the greatest, a bit snooty, but I didn't let that ruin my meal.

I went here for brunch with one of friends and it's a very nice place. Looks like a nice place for evening drinks. I had the Denver omelette and my friend got the corned beef hash. Both were excellent! Very swanky bar. Lux reminds me of an old school Jazz Chicago Bar with the red leather lounge boothe. I feel like it would be a great night spot for a first or second date.  Definitely recommended to hit up in the Gold Coast.

Quick lunch here with the bf after gettin' my hair did.....we sat at the bar....service was easy-peasy 1...2...3.....We both got the slider lunch special.....house salad with a choice of 2 gold coast sliders.......me, 2 fried chicken sliders.....god I love these little fried bits of love.....comes with mayo and a tomato slice.....so so good.....I crave them! He, 1 fried chicken (on my rec) and 1 pulled pork.....he was a happy bf indeed....pulled pork hit the spot and of course he loved the fried chickie slider almost as much as he loves me :) Great spot for lunch/brunch.....prices are reasonable.....food is good.....and great people watching when the patio is open and the sun is shinin'....
Love this place. Great menu with a ton of options. Good drinks and friendly waitstaff.  Perfect option for any night of the week.

Came here on a Sunday night with a friend to have a couple drinks. The drinks were good, did not try the food, but the atmosphere is very loud.  The hockey game was on and it was hard to have a conversation with the friend I was with.  The menu looked good, so maybe next time I will have to try out the food.

Came here for a late night dinner (on a Sunday) after reading decent reviews for this place and it was by our hotel.  Food: I ordered the Slider combo with 2 sliders and soup. I ordered the Filet Mignon and Turkey slider along with the steak and black bean soup. The Filet Mignon slider was VERY tender and juicy. Flavoring was a little bland for me. The turkey slider was good but a little on the salty side. My favorite part was the steak and black bean soup. I added all the toppings for an additional $2 (cheese, macaroni, onions, sour cream and jalepenos). The food orders in my group were good as well, but I can't recall what everyone had.  Friend 1: Which sliders do you recommend? I'm looking at the filet mignon and pulled pork. Server: They're all good. Maybe the pulled pork.  Friend 1: Hmm...maybe I'll get the combo and try both. a few minutes later.... Friend 2: What do you recommend on the menu? Server: Everything is good.  Friend 2: Have you tried _____? Server: No. I'm a vegetarian Friend 1: ?!?!?! WTF??!?! (Why did she recommend the pulled pork?!) ANYWAY! Service here was inattentive and slow. After getting our food, it took a REALLY long time for the server to come back to check on us and it was nearly impossible to flag her down. There was a problem with our order because my friends REALLY hate pickles in their food, and they brought out the sliders with pickles in them after they already requested their food without pickles. After sending it back, all they did was take the pickles off (uh, hello! if that was all we needed, we would've just done that ourselves!). The pickle juice was still on the bun. After many failed attempts to get our server's attention (she was busy talking to her friends at the bar), we finally asked the bus boy (who was GREAT by the way. very attentive and on top of things!) to talk to the manager. We just wanted to let him know that the service was bad and that not only did they mess up on an order, they refused to fix it. The manager comped my friend's meal and apologized for the bad service. Maybe we were just unlucky and came on the server's off/bad day. Overall, I'd say food was good but the service left a bad taste.

Luxbar is a bit of a jack of all trades place, and your experience here can vary greatly not only day to day but also depending on what you head there for whether it be brunch, dinner, late night dining or drinks. Although I've experienced probably every type of experience Luxbar has on offer this review focuses on my most recent experience for brunch. Food: 4/5 The general consensus around the table was the food was good, not amazing but good. I had an omelette, it was fluffy and fairly large and the filling was fresh (ham, peppers, mushroom) Booze:4/5 The bloody mary was pretty good but I've had better. I bumped this section to 4/5 because I know from previous experience that they have an impressive booze selection here and some of their more signature drinks are very good. Service:5/5 Attentive, quick, polite. It wasn't terribly busy but I had absolutely no complaints about the service. Ambiance 4.5/5 It's a viagra triangle staple, need I say more? Nearly every place in a 1 block radius is nice and the place is owned by Gibsons so you know the ambiance is gonna be trendy/upscale. Value:3.5/5 The place isn't cheap, you could go next door to the original pancake house and have a better brunch for cheaper (but they don't have booze - I need my bloody's) but it's not expensive either. The ingredients are quality, the ambiance is nice and the service is good so to an extent you are getting your money's worth. However, that being said I generally wouldn't opt to come here for brunch (hell I wouldn't come to the river north/gold coast area at all for brunch) because I know what can be found elsewhere, but if you're in the area it's not a bad option by any means.
A coworker's choice. Sliders and mojito are good, but are they special enough for me to suggest this place? Probably not...

Holy Christ. Their BBQ burger is outstanding! It was perfectly cooked medium rare and the cheese was so melty and delicious. They have this delectable pretzel bun and the onion frites on there were tasty. Fries were good, too. My date said their mini-burgers were scrumptious.  They have a great beer list. I wasn't personally impressed by the cocktail list... but I'm sure their drinks are good.  Make a reservation for this place, especially on the weekend. Like most Gold Coast restaurants, the environment is energetic with nice low lighting, but it's quite a clusterfuk and you'll have a long wait if you walk in with no reservations.  The service is fast but a bit awkward.  Awesome food, though.

Another long over due review from another great restaurant/bar in Chicago. I ventured in for brunch last Saturday and realized I had yet to review this place to begin with.  If you're coming in for brunch on the weekends, it's going to be a long wait, but it's certainly worth it. You can always try to snag a table in the cocktail area as well which is what I would prefer as it's better for people watching. In the summertime, they've got an awesome patio which is fantastic for day drinking as well as people watching.  Lux was voted one of the best brunches in the city, so I knew I had to get in on this. They have continental breakfast options, plenty of fluffy omelets, pancakes, french toast (the norm). I wanted to stay healthy so I stuck to the Steel Cut Oatmeal with brown sugar and raisins on the side. YUM. Oatmeal typically doesn't have the best presentation and usually comes out looking like a bowl of mush. I'm not sure how they make theirs, but it came out fluffy, light and amazing. I had a side of the Turkey Patties and the Applewood Smoked Bacon as well, both of which were great choices.  Other than that, the bf had an omelet which he loved (I didn't try because of the mushrooms he put in there) and the side of hash were perfectly crispy. Everything was hot off the press and ready to be consumed. The chef was coming around to all the tables making sure things were fine as well which is always a nice touch. Service is always quick and friendly. They serve their Bellinis old school in larger glasses and I was in love. Love my champagne cocktails in the morning. Other than that, the dinner and nightlife scene is great. This is one of the few establishments I would choose to frequent in the Viagra Triangle. Typically when I'm there, I do appetizers and drinks to keep it light. You can't go wrong with the Shrimp Cocktail, House Cured Salmon, Tuna Tartare and the Crab Cakes. They've also got a fine variety of burgers and sandwiches, steaks, soups and salads. Their drinks are always strong and delish.

I have only been here for lunch but I am a  fan of this place.  It's close to work and surprisingly well priced for the area that it's in.  I always go with one of the sandwich and salad combinations and have yet to be disappointed with anything.  I highly recommend the chicken, bacon and fried egg club. Service has always been quick and I have never experienced an issue.   Although not perfect, it is a quality place to go for a quality lunch downtown in the middle of the workday.

Nice bar with surprisingly good fare (think seared tuna, and blackened tilapia sliders) and dueling pianos upstairs that attracts a slightly more mature crowd than the rest of the Triangle. Large TVs to watch a game while you eat to boot.  As normal for the neighborhood, it gets pretty crowded at nights.

Went here for brunch with a friend today.  Had my first mimosa which was great.  Coffee was solid.  Tried the truffle fries which I really liked.  My meal came out wrong twice but they brought it out, it was ok.  Didn't complain but the waiter took it off the bill which was totally unnecessary.  Speaking of the waiter--they eye candy at this place makes it totally worth it.  Will definitely be back.

Had brunch here this morning and it was very good.  Great, attentive service, no wait, and delicious food.  I had the egg,sausage, cheese breakfast sandwich on a croissant (with hashbrowns).  mmmmmmm mmmmm mmmmm.

I've been here a few times and have enjoyed it everytime. The tuna tartar is good, the hummus appetizer is good and Ive had a delicious salad from there once with a great champagne vinagarette. And yes, This place does live up to its reputation for being in the viagra triangle!

Some food updates: - fried chicken is surprisingly very decent. - Tuna Tartare isn't bad but could be fresher (iw wasn't very red) - Chicken Sandwich - the roll was rock hard. The chicken was dry. - Pulled pork - 1.5 thumbs up.

I recently tried this place upon the recommendation of a co-worker.  Still relatively new to Chicago, I was fairly impressed with friendly staff and service.  A friend and I ate a decent lunch at a decent price.  Nothing spectacular but it was good nonetheless.   I heard they have dueling pianos - I'll be sure to miss that night on purpose.

I've been here many times, mostly for brunch (I miss the omelet station), but I've been told that since they're a part of the Gibson Group, they have the same meat that Gibsons does.  That said, every cut of steak that I've had their is great.  A bit pricy for drinks, but worth the spend.

I came here over a year ago on the recommendation of a friend ... she said they have the best bloody mary she's ever had..... it became the best bloody mary I've ever had. Besides this wonderful concoction, I got the steak and eggs and .... a kobe beef slider. It was brunch... I really wanted eggs, but I could pass on a kobe beef slider. The slider was excellent, but the eggs.....I ate them slowly... I chewed every single bite. There seemed to be nothing special in their preparation but somehow these eggs were absolutely magical......a year and a half later I am still left trying to explain how that could have been.

We stumbled in (not literally although we have have stumbled out literally) for some happy-hour drinks and appetizers. Ok, so I realize going here is not a cheap adventure.  .  Yet, I felt like I got my money's worth. My martini was made perfectly and our table enjoyed their drinks as well. We ordered calamari and some of the mini burgers. All tasty.  Service was amazing.  Our waitress was friendly and everyone was on top of it. For instance, there may have been a party-foul at the table that had disappeared within minutes.  Location is great and it's an easy place to meet. I'd definitely stop in here again.

Having visited on a Sunday afternoon we thought there would have been more people. We ordered and the food was somewhat of a disappointment. The chicken breast looked like it was boiled. The veggie burger looked like a crab cake but tasted bland and had no kick. The French fries were good but aren't all fries? The best part was the champagne we ordered. $30 and delicious and smooth. The server was kind of dry and didn't make it enjoyable either.

went for brunch on sunday we were able to get seated right away!  they offer two menus, lunch and breakfast, we ordered the lox and bagel plate....there is something about ordering it in a restaurant that I can not duplicate at home..  Bagel comes beautifully toasted(and really soft!!!) accompanied by thin slices of tomato, cucumber, onion, capers, and scoop of cream cheese.  waffle was done to perfection, crisp edges yet soft on the inside accompanied by fresh fruit.  Service was good and well paced, keep in mind you are in the gold coast, clientle seems to be of the see and be seen crowd, lots of Hollywood kisses etc :)

I am not normally a person who writes a review, good or bad, but my experience this time warrants a couple of accolades.   I took a client of mine to Luxbar last Saturday and had a wonderful experience.  I arrived shortly before he did, so I grabbed a couple of seats for us at the bar while I waited.  Instantly, I was approached by Clint the bartender.  He was very cordial and friendly as I quizzed him on the specialty drinks he could make for me.  I settled for a Blue Cheese Martini and Clint even gave me an extra Blue Cheese Olive at my request which definitely made me happy!  When my client arrived he sat down, had a drink and we then moved to a table to have some food and talk about business.   When we moved to our table we were seated in Karlyn's section (sorry if I botched the spelling).  She was prompt in greeting us and brought our drinks out very quickly.  We appreciated her upbeat attitude because we could see the place was pretty busy.  Karlyn was also very helpful in helping us make a meal decisions.  We took her advice and she was right on the money!  The food was fantastic and our table was cleared as soon as our meal was finished.  I had a coffee after the meal and business was then underway.  Customer service is important no matter where you work.  It's important to keep your customers coming back, especially if it's for your staff.  Our experience was more than great from the beginning with Clint to Karlyn, to the bussers and the Chef making our great food.   As I said, I am not one to write a review but since my client mentioned our great dining experience today (remembering it from last week) and it was on my mind, I had to write a review about this place!  Not only was my client impressed by his experience, but he was impressed that I took him to such a great place.  Thanks for making me look good Luxbar!  I'll definitely be bringing more clients into your establishment to wow them...but I have to request Clint and Karlyn...they were exceptional!
best sliders I have ever had, especially the steak one. very juicy and tender. I come here every time I'm in Chicago

We planned a Chicago New Year's Eve trip quite late, so needless to say, it was quite hard to find a nice place for dinner.  With a friend's suggestion and the proximity of this place to our hotel, we decided to give Lux Bar a go.  We were lucky that with no reservations, we managed to get a table for dinner.  The place was nicely ornated with balloons, and it had a nice size crowd -- feeling good about this place already. We got some cocktails: LuxBar Sling (blueberry Stoli! one of my favs!), Manhattan, and Cosmo.  I love the Sling, Cosmo was alright, and the Manhattan was strong!  We had sesame seared tuna, kobe sliders, and filet mignon sliders with truffle fries.  All of the food were exceptional! Given the "lack-of-planning" situation on my end, I was incredibly pleased that my dining experience went so well.  Would definitely go there again if I was in the area.

I didn't have high expectations. The pretentious name, a location in the heart of the Viagra Triangle -- how could it possibly be anything but an overpriced Gold Coast sausage-fest? Or tourist destination. I'm not sure which would be worse.  Luckily I was mostly wrong. Went after work last week and ate/drank at the bar. Friendly service, lower d-bag quotient than expected, and most surprisingly, reasonably priced good bar food. I had the soup & slider combo (choose any two sliders pus a cup of soup). Got the kobe beef + caramelized onion sliders (yum!!) and Wisconsin cheddar & ale soup. Can you believe it was only $10?! I was full by the time I finished. The sliders were good - I mean, hard to mess up that combination, but still. The soup was also tasty, the perfect soup for a cold winter night. Still not as good as the Vermont cheddar & ale soup they used to make in my grad school cafeteria though :)  Stop in if you're looking for a nice place to grab a drink & small bites after work or shopping.

I felt the need to counter Misty B's review below.  My wife and I live less than a block from Luxbar, and eat there pretty much every week.  We know all of the servers and managers, and Brooke has always been one of our favorites.  In fact, we have often requested one of her tables when we've come in.  Obviously, we think the food is quite good, and we especially are enjoying the new menu, which includes a number of selections from Gibson's list of steaks and fish. My five star rating is based not just on the food, but also on the terrific and friendly service we always receive from servers like Brooke.  We eat there so often, many of the staff are like family.  Unfortunately, we can no longer enjoy Brooke's friendly and efficient service.  She's been let go by the restaurant, apparently, at least in part, due to Misty B's review.  I just think that we Yelpers need to be careful when we criticize a particular employee by name.  Anyone can have a bad day, and a customer can certainly take a comment in a way it was not intended.  We're going to miss Brooke's winning personality going forward.

With a great drink list and a that sought after Gold Coast location Luxbar is the ideal place for a see and be seen drink after work or on a break from a shopping voyage. It had been a year or so since I'd ventured here and was excited to give the place another go see. After perusing their extensive drink menu I opted for a great blue cheese olive martini (very dirty of course) and deemed as good as any other I'd ordered. This time I didn't feel like one of their mini burgers or sandwiches (though they are tasty) and instead jumped on the truffle train ordering both the truffle fries and truffle mac and cheese. Both were...OK. Nothing wrong with Luxbar for a drink with friends. There's lots of good people watching and if you can grab a table in the bar area (or outside in more pleasant weather) you'll be a happy camper. If I'm going to dinner I'll visit one of their partner restaurants Gibson's or Hugo's Frog Bar.

Not bad.  The prices are pretty good for a trendy, nice-looking place.  There was a $20 prime rib special the night we went, which wasn't amazingly tasty but was a good amount of meat.  Service was great.  I'd go back.

Lux Bar is basically Tavern on Rush turned down a notch or two.  It's still quite the scene but isn't as over-the-top as Tavern can often be.   I only come in here to drink at the bar.  The one time I ate I had the sliders with fries, which was pretty good.  The bartenders are generally on top of things as far as quick service. The one thing about the bar area that should be addressed is the narrow aisle between the tables and bar.  I'd love a little more room to be able to squeeze through there. The crowd is generally 30s and up in the bar area.  You'll find it to be a mix of locals and out-of-towners.  There's usually eye candy in here that's more toned down than what you'd see next door at Tavern, so there will be less laughs generated from the people watching.  For some reason, it's easy to spot people you've seen out and about town in this place. Lastly, this place has one heck of a bathroom.  It's almost like you're in a hotel.  Best bathroom in the Rush and Division area as far as bars go (worst goes to Dublin's).   Recommended for drinking and people watching.

Food: I went for brunch and found the food a solid "C+/B-". Pretty average eggs/bacon kind of brunch. Our meals came staggered...which I put on the kitchen, not the wait staff. Service: Very nice upbeat service. Though, our waiter asked me to put my Starbucks into one of their (Styrofoam) cups! WTF? Decor: The space is nice looking...nicer looking than the food is tastey. I'd give it another try for dinner...I want to like the place.
Absolutely love their steak sliders!! Great ambiance and a good place for people watching across the street from Gibsons.
Lux Bar is one of my favourite weekend (late) lunch spots. Beyond the food, the drinks (old fashions!) it's also right down the street from the Adidas Originals store...

Food is good and they have a decent draught beer selection, but the manager is a total shank.  He screwed up our reservations for a private party made last week and because of the Pacquiao fight, he refused to make any effort to fix his mistake saying he was just too busy.  In the mean time, he spent the entire fight staring at the tv.  They finally found us a table and stuck us in a corner as a minor consolation but that was due to the effort of a nice waitress.

oh Luxbar, Luxbar Luxbar... how you disappoint me so.   I decided to take this fella I was dating out for a nice meal. He's very steak and potatoes but i did not want to pay chop house prices, Luxbar seemed like a good place to try out. I made a reservation 24 hours in advance for a Saturday at 730 , they called to confirm. Awesome. Tonight's going to be swell. Guy's going to love eating some steak and I'm going to eat something delicious too.  We arrive on time and our table's not ready. No biggie, I'm a fan of pre dinner cocktails. I asked the hostess if they had a coat check and she replies, "yeah, it's in the back" so I inquire if I needed to walk to the back to check my coat and she tells me that she'll do it, it's just in the back. Really lady? Is your job so hard and stressful seating all these hungry tourists all day that you can't do your job and take me and my date's coat? No. it's not. you just suck.  OK, fine whatever. Our table is finally ready and when they take us to our seats, it's at a high top basically still in the bar. I look at the hostess and tell her, that I'd like to wait for another table. Seriously? A high top? I didn't make reservations at a restaurant where I'm going to drop 200 on food and drink to sit at a bar table. So we go back to the bar and wait for another table.  Our new table is finally available and it's this tiny four top stuck behind a set of booths. the area where the table is is so small that if i were to sit down in the chair, it would have been in the isle. not my idea of comfortable.  So we left and went to go eat at Tocco and it was delicious. This may or may not be the most epically long review... There's more to tell because I actually went back yesterday for brunch but I'm really tired of complaining right now.

Great Casual Eats Bar... It was Friday at 7:30 and the place was packed. They told me 35 minutes for a table but it turned out to be more like 50 minutes. We did manage to score seats at the bar. The place was really crowded both up and downstairs. It seems like a lot of middle aged people treat this place as a singles bar. When we finally sat and got our food we were starving. The food is ok. It is nothing special but is isn't expensive either. I think you get what you pay for.

I am giving this place low marks for making my blood boil with anger. We came in with our 6 year old son and opted to wait for the next available booth. We waited 30 minutes at the bar only to find out that the people were just camping out at the booth and their check had been paid! Shame on them and the wait staff that knew we were waiting and said nothing.....so we left and went to CheeseCake Factory where we were seated immediately with great service!

We went here for breakfast and it was really really good. The service was fast and friendly and we didn't have to wait for a table (there was a line out the door for the pancake house next door) and the food was delicious. I got the smoked salmon benedict and the husband got the corned beef hash. It was really reasonably priced, too. Less than $30 for both meals, coffee and juice.

Friday night Chicago, 7:15 pm, no reservations & one tired, wet and hungry child.  This was us last night.  When we walked into Luxbar (our 4th stop looking for a place to eat) the manager John was the first person behind a eservation stand to see us as a family struggling to hold it together rather than another faceless patron to shrug off with a "sorry, it will be 45 mts at least.". He brought our daughter (& frankly us) from the brink of tears with a small basket of rolls he grabbed from a passing waiter--then he did the impossible--he squeezed us into the 30 mt window between reservations, all the time we needed to get a warm drink and small plate in our bellies.  Our sever was kind, the kitchen insanely fast, and the salads and appetizers we enjoyed were fresh and flavorful.  I can't recommend the place enough--good food served by good human beings.  We will surely be back.  And this time we will make a reservation.

A great neighborhood spot where the staff is friendly, the atmosphere is fun and lively without being too touristy-crazy, and the food is always good. I love the veggie burger; it's moist and rich, lots of flavor, and if I skip the fries and get roasted vegetables on the side, I feel very virtuous and satisfied.

Luxbar You have let me down... First and Second Time at LuxBar 5 Stars My new Favorite place Third time 4 stars, Fourth Time 3 Stars... I think you get the point.  LuxBAR HAD and I stress HAD the most DELICIOUS Buffalo Chicken Salad I have ever had before. They Also HAD this is ALL in Past tense the most delicious French Fries with a beautiful Truffle Sauce.  Oh LuxBar What happen? The servings got smaller, the Lettuce became as if it was a garnish, it is a SALAD!!!!  The Chicken might as well be gold because the way you search for the tiny morsels now.  This is SOOOOO DISAPPOINTING! This was my Mom and my Spot. We would CRAVE these salads and make it a every 3 week ordeal~ Summer was Beautiful in the Garden area, or sidewalk, but the waitress would forget us! It took about 30 minutes to get our check that time~  This most recent adventure to my once favorite spot has lead us to sadly find a new place for wine and salad. We started with the Truffle fries, I am sure they forgot to cook them! The Fries came almost raw and soooo Greasy!  Next move on the the Buffalo Chicken Salad, at one point my most favorite Salad in the entire city, but honestly there was hardly any salad at all!  The amount of lettuce was as if I ordered a garnish! and they completely over dressed it!  Then came the Snickers pie which was good, I am sure they don't make it there but it was the only great thing we had, and as always spent about 100 dollars with drinks and all that jazz HOW DISAPPOINTING HOW SAD!  I almost want to give you one star, but I remember the good old times which there were many, until the complete de-fault. 4 disappointing times in a row~ Which this last time was so bad... One it is I will MISS you dear Luxbar

I went here on a Saturday night with 4 of my girlfriends.  We sat outside which was very nice, though I don't think we felt the same atmosphere of the restaurant.  All of us ordered burgers or sandwiches.  Important to note that you can choose any side without any extra cost.  I had the lux club, which was actually quite expensive for a basic turkey sandwich.  I also got the side of roasted vegetables which were good.  Some of my friends had the mac and cheese side, also good.   Cocktails were quite pricey.  Our server was great, very friendly and didn't mind that we had to wait for a friend who was running late.  There menu is huge, something for everyone, although now that I think about it, it was a bit more expensive that I thought it should have been.  I guess you pay for the atmosphere as well, which we didn't really get sitting outside.  Oh- and be sure to ask for free challah rolls!
Delicious, great service, and nice environment.  Good pricing too!

Great atmosphere,great service .a Perfect place to grab a cocktail after work.Food is o.k.,nothing spectacular for me,but I'm not a fan of American cooking anyways.We came in at 6pm and there were plenty of seating,by the time we left at 7:30 ,place was boomig.As i said-it's the place for cocktails and mingling with others.

Such a great ambiance for such lackluster food. I was excited to try the brunch here being that it's in a very central area of other restaurants. The coffee was really really great, the table inside was comfortable and there was no wait. The tables outside had a wait.  I decided to try the fried egg sandwich with the eggs cooked over easy. The apple wood smoked bacon, onion and tomato were really great on the poppy seed bun. The eggs came out cooked much more than over easy. there was a side of hash browns that weren't very crispy. In fact, there were kind of slimy. The oil from these hash browns started to soak in the bun of my sandwich causing it to fall apart some. The side order of turkey patties was a good call. They had a little bit of spice to them and were cooked perfectly.  The waitress was a little standoffish. I get it, you were out the night before or whatever but really, not my problem. Cheer up. You make money if your guests have a better time.  I thought this place had too many TVs for the look of it. They are trying to look classy with the tables and menus and logo but all these TVs are screaming sports bar. At least I got to see some of the Cubs game.  If I go back I'll see if the upstairs patio is open--that looked real nice.

Finally got to Luxbar for sliders, and so worth the rate. We ate outside so I didn't see the decor, but the outside was quite nice; I only wish they'd ask the smokers to go further away from the eating area. Onto the sliders: we tried all seven and liked the burger & the filet best, but the fish & the crab cake were also delish. Wasn't crazy about the chicken b/c I'm not a fan of bacon-flavored things (love bacon, just not bacon-flavored) and the chicken was small and deep fried (boo).  The fries with truffle oil were divine and whatever that mayo was that they served it with, I'd like to bathe in!! Also had a beat salad which is something I'll probably get again.

Upscale bar food, in a pretentious, (yet I love it) atmosphere. I like to go here for a light dinner, or appetizer combo with many drinks with the girls before trashing it up at Hange Uppe late night. I really like the chili here though, random, but delicious.  A good place to try for a bite to eat and some drinks before heading on to bigger and better things.  A great place to sit outside for appetizers/lunch on a sunny day and people watch!

After a day of shopping, my two friends and I ended up here for a late lunch.  I took forever to get service once we sat down, which was slightly annoying, since we were starving, but the food was really yummy. I had two sliders - turkey burger and crab cake burger - with a side salad.  The turkey burger was by far the tastiest and pretty salty, just how I like it.  The crab cake was okay and the pink mayo was tasty, but I would probably try something else next time. With a decent price and cool atmosphere, I would love to come back and check out the nighttime scene.

A few weeks back, I made plans to have lunch with an old friend and as usual, she suggested we meet-up somewhere in her 'hood.  My friend is a permanent fixture in the Gold Coast, so I trust her to provide some interesting recommendations. Let me just say that Chicago during the summer is my favorite place and time of the year.   In selecting a place to eat, my only requirement is that we have a table outdoors. We were lucky to have been seated right-away as it was a beautiful day and there were plenty of hungry people looking for a place to eat. We decided to split the Buffalo Chicken salad and Monaco Club sandwich from the extensive menu.  Although the staff was friendly, the servers were unattentive and slow.  It would have fared well as we were not in a hurry to go anywhere and had a pretty good vantage point for people-watching; but, we were really hungry and our meal and drinks took a while to get to us. If there was availability in any of the other venues near-by, I would have chosen to go there instead.

Luxbar is one of my favorite spots in the Gold Coast!  The prices are pretty reasonable, but above all, the service is good.  For lunch or some sidewalk people watching, I adore Luxbar.   Compared to it's neighbor (Tavern on Rush, whose food I actually love), there is a decidely-less-pretentious attitude.  There are no skanky looking hostesses outside.  There are no judgemental, evil eyed maitre'ds.  The atmosphere is warm and fun, where you could go for a nice dinner or a casual drink with friends. The food is pretty good, it's the same stuff that comes from Hugo's Frog Bar and Gibsons (from a different kitchen).   Honestly, it's nothing to write home about, but combined with the atmosphere, it's quite a pleasant experience.

With so many choices for dining in the area I'd probably skim right over this place in the future.  It's really sad because they have a great menu full of different options with wonderfully descriptive sides and entrees that will make your mouth water.  The staff was attentive and friendly in every area from host to bus boy filling water.  The atmosphere was comfortable and they have fantastic outdoor seating.  So why the low rating?  The food was just bad.  BAD!  The sliders, while not as bad as the entrees, were small and you only got one!  I ordered a simple burger that was undercooked from what I asked and very greasy.  The cheese on the burger looked "nuclear-waste orange" and was strangely lumpy.  The jumbo lump crab salad was inappropriately named because it was far from jumbo.  It was small and the pieces of crab were few and far between.  Oh and the truffle fries that sounded so fabulous when ordered were a complete disappointment; greasy, soft, and very salty.     I would only ever come back here for drinks and to sit outside and enjoy their outdoor space. There are too many other options for great food in the area.

I've  been here a few times. It's good, solid comfort food in a boisterous setting.  The skirt steak is a good entree choice and on the last visit, the Kobe burger was the selection of the day (though it was dry, the accompanying french fries made up for the dryness).   Service is efficient and the portions are large.

I just love this place. It's got some ridiculous cougar/geezer/more money than god watching, and an incredible all-american menu with everything from grilled cheese and tomato soup, to avocado crabmeat to corned beef hash, at all hours. I've eaten here about a billion times, because the food just keeps bringing me back. It's pretty reasonable, and they have anything and everything someone could be in the mood for. Considering I ate here both last night and tonite, having ordered the exact same thing, I'm either in a rut, or have found the holy grail of bar food. Kobe beef slider w/caramelized onions and truffle butter, add bacon and make sure it's done medium is pretty much my utopia..Throw in the house salad w/avocado, olive oil and lemon, and a side of truffle Parmesan fries w/garlic aioli and I'm over the moon.  Don't be surprised if I"m back there tomorrow.

I absolutely love Lux Bar. I have now been living in the city for about a year and I would have to say that this is probably on my list of top 5 restaurants in Chicago. I live about 2 blocks away and every time I go, the food is consistent and delicious. It's unpretentious but has a high end crowd being in the "Viagra Triangle" area of the Gold Coast. I think the prices are extremely reasonable considering the area and clientele. My favorite is the Gold-Coast Sliders, you can choose 2 and a bowl of soup for about 10 bucks, not bad at all. The chicken noodle is something I would normally not eat unless it was made by my grandma but I was in the mood and it was awesome! The vegetables and chicken were fresh and flavorful. The drinks are great too with an awesome bar. This place gets PACKED! Go early or make a reservation. It's a great alternative for a trendy place to go without the prices of its sister restaurants, Gibson's and Hugo's.

I mostly come here for drinks - the wine list is great and I love the cocktails (especially the St. Germain).  Service is very nice and the place is awesome for people watching!  The food is just ok - but you can't go wrong with the fries or a hummus plate to go along with your drinks!

Stick to being a bar.  Just got back from a brunch (day after wedding) for about 40 people. Food was cold, greasy and crappy quality.  No stars would be more appropriate....eat elsewhere and then come by for drinks would be a better call!

Great food and atmosphere for a casual good meal!!! Has a lot of food and its focus is comfort food which is good for a cheat day. Their tomato bisque is amazing and is served an equally amazing mini grilled cheese delish. The drinks are good and as for the deserts, they are wonderful and huge! Definitely  a good large group spot.

Chic decor. Tasty apps. The movers and shakers crowd. Great place for an after hours drink but I didn't really feel like I fit in. But then again I haven't found a place in this area that I do anyways.

So I've been to Luxbar before for cocktails or brunch or lunch outside.  The have a great little outdoor area with great people watching.  Along with tables on the second floor balcony. The first floor can be very loud and since I was dining with a friend and his mother we decided to sit upstairs.  They must have had some servers and cooks call in sick because this lunch was hilarious.  They had ONE server covering the entire second floor.  The manager was trying to help out lugging food and drinks up and down the stairs.  They appeared to bring food out as it was cooked instead of waiting and serving the entire table at once.  My friends mother waited 30 minutes for her omelet after my friend and I were served.  There were two large tables nearby and half the table was done eating before the others were even served. While they seemed to have tons of busboys, you still had to snag them just to get simple condiments that should come with your meal Ii.e butter or jam for your toast). Thankfully the manager advised us she would be taking off the omelet from out bill and I believe the larger tables were compt some free meals.   I will certainly go back there.  I believe this was an isolated incident.  And felt the Manager handled things as best she could.

I know this place gets a lot of flack since they're a.) in the triangle, and b.) a restaurant/bar that attracts suburbanites & posers.  However, I feel compelled to defend them.  I think they might just have the best cheeseburgers in Chicago, and believe these could the best cure for a long day at work or a wicked hang over.  Perhaps too revealing, but I end up here fairly often for lunch or happy hour.  The service is always great and the food is consistently delish.  Though I can't vouch for the crowd, it's a fav spot of Gold Coasters living in the neighborhood.

A 3-star rating for a bar/restaurant hybrid in the VT (I refuse to type this lame-douche-box acronym aloud) is really like a 2 star review in its parallel universe, 'the real world'. What you have to realize is that establishments in this area simply can not be based on merits of typical expectation. Everything will be exceedingly, well, excessive... more expensive... more see-and-be-seen... more crowded... you can bet on it. The ridiculous people watching you see here warrants the additional cost though. Where else in our great city do you ever peep a severely collagen injected 65 year old with triple D boobies and a yorkie in a pink swarovski stroller?? Only in the triangle, ew, damn, I sorta said it.  Luxbar gets the semi-star seal of approval though for having the following:  + Righteous outdoor summer seating that extends almost the full length of Rush & Bellevue. Watch the comings and goings of Chicago's most reedonkulous. Feel better about yourself instantaneously while working on your tan. Plus!!!  + A really sweet cocktail list. I love, love, love the Fresh Fruit Sling -- Sling's the Thing!!! With Lemon Vodka, Seasonal Fruit, Lemon Juice and Simple Syrup it's a total one-up on a sangria done vodka-style. Drunk-a-licious!  + Decent menu at not-completely-outrageous prices. Think staples like steaks, chops, burgers, ribs and even nontraditional bar selections like sesame crusted ahi, buttermilk fried chicken and fun 'lil rock 'em, sock 'em sliders from the likes of kobe beef, crab and turkey at approx only $3 apiece. Not too shabby for the house that the Rolex set built, eh?  + SUPER PLUS... consider this your freebie... on Sunday's, if you're willing to forgo patio seating, there is a $15 p/p Brunch (yeeeah, brunch!!) on Luxbar's second floor. All-inclusive fabulousness with unlimited portions on a waffle station, omelettes to custom order, eggs benedict, bacon, sausage, fresh fruit, nova lox with accompaniments, pastries, the works! Add a nummy Kir Royale and this is a great starter to your lazy day of shopping in the area/downtown.  Service can be spotty, and at times, snooty. Overstay your welcome on the patio (past the 11pm city outdoor ordinance) and you'll get a HUGE taste of this... shuffle me out like the trash? Only if it's Eurotrash, Baby!

I don't know whats happened to my relationship with LuxBar. I used to think of it fondly & desire it's delicious offerings. Unfortunately I've gone back & it seems as if LuxBar has forgotten about my needs. I've been there & tried to venture away from what I normally ordered. Each time I've been just kind of bored or unsatisfied. I've ordered the "awesome fish & chips" & was very disappointed. It was too dry, no flavor, and the malt vinegar was just not doing it for me. I kept pouring more & more, but it was still so bland. I've ordered the Monaco club, which was good but bacon, chicken, lettuce, and mayo (minus the fried egg) isn't too hard to mess up. I also had the french onion soup & just a word for you-do not use shoe string sliced onions in the soup! You need bigger, chunkier slices to satisfy this little lady. I do want to try it out for breakfast because a) you can't really screw up eggs & oj and b) the outdoor seating is calling my name with these unfair teases of warm weather.  I'll only bump up my rating if LuxBar comes crawling back with a bouquet of yellow flowers & something so yummy I simply can't say no!

Stopped in here for a late lunch on a sunny saturday afternoon. Only a quick 10 minute wait at the bar for a table outside. Browsed the whole menu but we decided to go with an array of sliders (they have 6 or so different types to try) and a hearty side of mac and cheese. The kobe, regular beef and fried chicken sliders were each awesome and perfect slider size meat wise, though bread was a little too large for my liking.  The mac and cheese though was pretty awesome and definitely went with the completely unhealthy meal we were aiming for.   The bar itself is nicely done, service was perfect and we had a great afternoon. Being right on rush its definitely a place to go and people watch, and on a sunny day the food menu and listing of awesomely tasty drinks will keep you occupied for a few hours.

I had always been here for dinner, but a few weeks ago I came early-ish on a Sunday. We decided to give the sunday breakfast buffet a shot. IT WAS AWESOME! All the hashbrowns, bacon, waffles, fresh fruit, etc.. you can handle. Unlimited coffee. And they have eggs cooked to order. All for $15 a person. This is my new spot on Sunday morning.
Met some friends here for a quick dinner on Saturday.   Definitely nuts-to-butts busy.  Had some beer and a few sliders.  The fried chicken one was the best.  That's all.

This place was alright. It is one of the few more casual options in the area. The staff was nice and I think 2 managers even asked us how everything was. The food was on the greasy side though, so just be prepared for that. The tables are also very close together.

came here for a late dinner.  i got the kobe burger and it was sooo good!  it was my first time eating kobe beef, or american kobe in my case.  my friend got the chicken noodle soup.  hands down the best chicken noodle soup i've ever tasted.  the bread they gave was good too.  my fries with the burger was waaaay too salty.   our server was pretty rude too.  he came to our table in a rush and was almost shouting at us.  after awhile he sat down with a table across from us and started talking stories with them -_-.   we tipped him 15%, the lowest i've tipped on my trip to chicago.  we would have been more generous if he probably didn't stereotype us asians to be poor tippers.  whatevers lol.
Good signature gin martini.  Others were enjoying many of the froo froo selections from off the cocktail menu.  Lots of 'ladies night' activity.

"Wake up in Kissimmee, and go to bed in Chicago! What a night eh Howard!!? You son of a bitch!"  The business men were in the bag, downing gin and tonics and hanging their heads as their undone ties grew collectively heavier. God bless the alcoholic traveling business men and this swank restaurant near their hotel.  When all of my options disappear at 10:30pm, I know I can grab a nice meal at Lux Bar. Seriously, it's nice! If you eat downstairs on a weeknight, the place is nearly empty (apart from the executive layover circus) and the price is pretty affordable for the quality of food you get! I don't live in Gold Coast, so when I venture over there, I usually pretend I'm on vacation. We had an awesome shrimp cocktail, of huge prawns $6 by 1/4th LB. Fantastic Fish and Chips, and two pints of Guinness. Everything is pretty delicious high end American cuisine prepared by a chef.  And even if you stop in for just an appetizer, its great people watching, ala Glenn Gary Glenn Ross.

Tried this place for dinner-Knew it wasn't some upscale place just a place with a decent little menu that was low key- We had reservations at 7:30 got seated right away but it's very tight seating, you are *very* close to your neighbors and you hear everything- I got the filet, cooked rare- When my filed came out it didn't look all that appetizing, kind of pale in color, but it was cooked perfect- Wait lacked attention, not good- I don't think I'd go back here, it was so loud, crammed and the food was just "ok" nothing stood out to me or I wouldn't want anything else from the menu- I think the location makes the place stand out-

I've been here a couple of times.  Of the places I've tried in the Triangle, it's definitely my favorite for a casual meal.  It's not quite the pick-up joint that other restaurants around there can be - probably because it's not expensive and it's not pretentious in the least.  The wine menu is small but well done.  The food is really good.  We'd recommend the sliders, truffle fries, and Monaco club. Oh, and I almost forgot - best calamari EVER!  They put some sort of sauce on the calamari, which is unusual but really brings it alive.  The manager came over to our table the last time, and we were able to convince him to send us a free dessert.  We thought it was very nice of him.  We were given a "piece" of chocolate cake.  I have to put "piece" in quotes because it was the largest slice of cake I've ever seen.  There were six of us and we hardly made a dent in it. It was good, though.  I'm sure it's not made in-house, but it did taste like it was.  I would recommend that others give this place a try, and I will be back.  You're not going to get a date night out of this, and you're not going to get a "night on the town" out of this.  What it's good for is a weekday dinner, or a laid-back weekend dinner.  If you want a "night out," seek your dinner elsewhere...but certainly give this place a try when you're in a casual mood.
Luxbar has the best chicken fingers I have ever had. every time I have been there the service has been great.  some many great times have been here. Can not wait to go back.

If I could pick one word to describe- trendy.  It was extremely crowded when we went in on a Saturday night, and even though we had a reservation they were running about 30 minutes behind schedule.  That would have been fine if we had a seat at the bar, or at the very least some elbow room!  It's been awhile since I ate there, but I know I had a fish and vegetable dish w/ teriyaki sauce.  Our waitress was not very attentive, probably bc they were so busy and had a million other things going on.  The thing I do like about it is the location and the fact that you can go to a lot of fun places afterwards.  We went to Cindy Crawford's restaurant/bar- Whiskey Bar.  It was really cozy and warm inside- it had almost an old mansion library feel.  They had leather chairs and we surprisingly got a seat.  Pretty tiny but fun!

Lux bar you are just ok. I went last night with my sis for a late late dinner.  It was quite as it was a week day and we were seated quickly.  The service was fine enough but the food was lacking.  I got the jumbo lump crab salad and it was ok... It said champagne vinaigrette but it was very creamy, I wish that the would have said it was cream based... Maybe Just my ignorance?  The other ingredients  seemed bland .. Bland crab with bland avocados and tiny teeny amount of small tomatoes...  eh uneventful .. but got the job done...  My sis got the turkey burger and truffle fries... I tried the fries  and they were soo good! I could have ate the whole plate!! She loved her burger. We also got an app of seared tuna and that was actually really good!!  all and all just ok.. I like their drinks so I'll be back for those.. Maybe not the salads though.. :)

I did not partake in the alleged "club" part of Lux Bar... I assume it's on the top floor? I only dined downstairs and was very happy with my experience. I got a pear-tini which was a total delight and cost about half my total bill, but that's to be expected. My friend and I split the calamari and oh...my...goodness. It was wonderful. It is covered in some sort of spicy chili sauce but it's not soggy, still crispy. A great departure from your regular calamari. I got a burger and loved it, and I am very particular about burgers. The truffle fries were fine, but I wasn't in love. I am an extremely non-fancy eater so maybe I just could not appreciate the truffle fries but I did like that they had their own unique flavor, I just wasn't obsessed with said flavor. My friend got some of the sliders and soup and said they were great. All in all, LuxBar was delicious and I'll definitely be back.

This is such a cute spot!!  Close to the crib so that's just another plus.   The kobe sliders are great, the mac and cheese is wonderful (topped with breadcrumbs), and the asian style calamari was a hit as well.   Great atmosphere and the super friendly, attentive waitstaff confirm it:  I'll definitely be back.

Great atmosphere and the food is great too.  Appetizers are fantastic for bar food that is.  Don't expect 5 star restaurant food but it's definitely good.  Try the sliders if you are there and if you want veggie, ask for them (usually not on the menu).  Drinks are expensive though. Fun place, good looking people, great area for a pre-drink, small meal before going out.

Gotta say, I like this place. Though I wouldn't go out of my way to go there solely for dinner, it's a great, casual place to meet friends for drinks and grab some Kobe sliders with a side of Truffle oil fries. Good stuff!!

3.5 Food, love their sliders, fries and drinks. Do love the food and service but the crowd in the evening is an interesting bunch. I'll leave it there. Rush street.  I think I will need to go back in the daytime...a plus was the decor was nice and atmosphere was cheery.

I'm not sure what the appeal of Lux Bar is.  To start, we walked in with 8pm reservations and were greeted by a snotty hostess who said she was "waiting for tables to get up."  Then we waited for a while until finally she told us to follow her, and dropped menus on the worst table in the restaurant - you know, the one sandwiched between a corner and the bus stand?  That they added for a reservation they forgot to take into account?  Our server appeared to be a bit out of it and rushed us through dinner.  Their martinis are not worth $12, and their food was average.  If you like having to cut your own lettuce for your salad, I guess you should go here. To top it all off, a group of managers hovered near our table for most of the night, playing with their cell phones.   Not going back.

I'm not a fan of this restaurant, but maybe I just went on a bad night and ordered the wrong thing... It was extremely noisy, more so than other noisy restaurants (my friend and I were sitting right next to each other and were screaming to hear one another). The service was terrible.  They barely came around and switched servers on us without even say anything.
