I ordered a salad (apple walnut or something).  I didn't care for it.  My friend ordered the chicken pot pie and he wasn't a fan either.    For some reason, people love this place.  My opinion...There are a TON  of other restaurants in the city and in this area with much better food, service and atmosphere.

If you're looking to brunch, you may want to take your time. Although the lower level was filled will a delicious aroma of hearty food like sandwiches, potatoes and omelets the upper level is where you will find the brunch buffet.  You cannot deny that $15 for a brunch buffet is reasonable, however you can ask yourself... what will I be receiving? Honestly, there wasn't much to choose from and that could have been different if we had arrived earlier, but if a restaurant is serving a buffet it should be attended to and replenished at all times.  Things to look out for: -Traditional choices: this could be good for the bruncher who just wants some french toast and hash-browns, but if you are looking for egg-white scrambles, homemade granola, or blueberry pancakes this is not your place. -The melon was crunch and tart  - Presentation is minimal, so don't expect an artistic display - Drinks are not included Positives: -$15 for a brunch buffet is cheap - The mimosas were great ($8/ea) - The smoked salmon was delicious Luxbar could use a little innovation and needs a bit more attention to detail. Once they achieve this they will be able to double there brunch price and maybe even gain a few customers.

I like Luxbar a lot! Not only is it close to my house, the service is great! They have great dinner and Sunday brunch. The fillets are fabulous! The sliders are also very tasty. The truffle fries are another one of my favorite things on the menu! I love that they have a range of things to eat on the menu, so everyone at your table is bound to find something! The desserts are also quite delicious and huge, so make sure to split with everyone at the table!

You know, I've lived in this area 2 years and there are still places I haven't been...  Searching for a brunch spot this morning, and realizing the line at the Original Pancake House was ridiculous, we tried to the other nearby venues. We walked into Lux Bar, not even knowing if they had breakfast... Come to find out, they have a full breakfast menu and a brunch upstairs (I think it goes from 9am-3pm?). We went with that. Hashbrowns, Sausage, Made to order Omlettes, Pastries, Waffles, French Toast... and then an entire array of desserts. Seriously, everything! It was all really good, and the servers are really attentive (and fun!) They were all totally talkative and nice and really made our experience a good one. Also we asked if mimosas were included in the price of brunch, and they said no... And as we were making our trip up to the buffet bar I saw one of the waiters drop off two and winked at me! On the house, so nice of him! Anyways - $15 a person, but I think it's totally worth it. I've never been to this place at night so I have no idea about the bar scene, but the brunch, the servers, and the overall atmosphere - 5 stars.

Luxbar breakfast not so luxurious!  Went to Luxbar around 11 on a Saturday with a friend from out of town and was expecting more than just the normal. The breakfast menu which we ordered from was small but had all the classics. Eggs Benedict, Corn Beef Hash, Steak and Eggs, etc. but in this new Gourmet food revolution who really wants to pay $12 for classic breakfast? I'd rather eat this type of food at the Golden Nugget because there you expect a no frills approach to dining.  That said, the quality is perfect and the atmosphere is what we were looking for. I'm a big fan of morning Drinks and the Graton 75 was really good. Wouldn't say I'd go there again for breakfast but maybe drinks and dinner.

Everything I had for dinner at Lux Bar was fantastic - including the service. We started with calamari and guacamole, both of which were among the best in recent memory.  A few of us went for the Lux Burger, and I don't think anyone was disappointed.   Pretty sure I will go back just to have the truffle fries again...

Sunday luncheon at Luxbar was scrumptious. The menu had great options for our hungover crew and the baby bottles of Heinz made me giggle. I like small things. They're cute.  The Monaco Club and fries were delightful. I'd recommend splitting an order though. My club sammich was large enough to feed 3 gals. Seriously. GARGANTOUS. I'd go back for a dinner date with the BF and try steak/salmon/halibut.  Viagra triangle, I secretly like you.

I would give it 5 stars for the company I was with and the food. The service however, was just plain weird. Our server was like a robot, she came over and asked if we were ready to order, we said we needed a few minutes. She came back a second later and asked again and we gave her the same answer. When we were finally ready, she took our order, grabbed our menus and left. The food came out fast and was really delicious. We had the club monoco (Chicken, bacon, tomato and lettuce), the mini filet mignon and fried chicken sandwich and the chocolate cake for dessert (This cake is so big, it could feed a small country). We loved them all! When it was time for our check, she brought it over and gave us the most artificial smile and "thank you" I've ever seen in my life. We couldn't help but laugh and make fun of her. I would recommend this place for the food, we really enjoyed it...and if your server is a woman and really creepy...just laugh and think of my review!

Ok, it seems as though a lot of people come here for the food. Gotta be honest, haven't ever eaten here. However, I've come for drinks a handful of times, which are DELISH!!! The caipirinhas are simply heavenly. It's worth it to come here just for one of those. The crowd...not so much. If you come here, come with plenty of friends - not to look for an entertaining crowd of handsome young gentlemen. More like desperate, delusional middle aged men. No music to groove to, so sad.

I never expected to write a review about Lux Bar because the "superficial" Leyla is too sophisticated to admit that she is a regular here.  But, the "realistic" more down to earth Leyla had an epiphany the last time she was at Lux Bar.  I will keep this short... My father and I both live in the Gold Coast, about 4 blocks away from each other with Lux Bar in the middle.  We go out for breakfast every Saturday and maybe ever other Thursday for dinner.  9 times out of 10, we end up at Lux Bar.  At first, I would complain, "not Lux Bar again" but as time went on, I realized that my dad was right. The menu is big enough where there is something for everyone.  The Sirloin Steak Chili is great and so are the mini burgers.  Salads are delicious too.   The service is always perfect.  Very young, cute staff, who are so eager to be helpful.  I don't know where they find these ladies but they are all so happy and pleasant.  No attitude whatsoever.  Our usual server, don't know her name, but she is super helpful and VERY patient with my dad who asked 100 questions and can't make up his mind.  And then, sometimes, after he's ordered and his food comes, he insists this is not what he ordered (even though it is).  They always accommodate my dad.   Bottom line - great neighborhood place that is good to the locals even though they are flooded by tourists and suburbanites.

So here is how it went down.  i live within a 3 min walk from this place, and have always avoided it for brunch because it seems so touristy.  but finally gave in bacause i wanted to try something new.  So i walk up to the host...twenty-something-old holding a clipboard...and asked if there is a line for brunch.  She said, "no."  then silence.  a couple of awkward seconds later, i asked, "can we get seated?"   again, silence.  she now has her attention on a dog strolling by, and actually bent down to play with the dog, with me standing there, not knowing whether i am gonna get seated or not.  Trying to contain my frustration, i said, "hello...i am up here...?"  that finally pulled her out of her daze and responded, "sorry, would you like to get seated?"   YES!! My freaking GOD, YES!!  Why the hell would i be standing here wasting my time!?  I felt like unleashing my anger on her, sorta George-esque on Seinfeld.  but i sat down like a good little boy.  and proceeded to realize that she never gave me the brunch menu, even though i made it clear that's what i wanted.  so had to go back to ask her for that.   i was seething at this point, and i can't even remember what i ordered.  the food i am sure was average, nothing spectacular.  but this lead to some introspection on my part.  Should i have just left after that initialy encounter--cut my losses and moved on?  Should i have told her or her manager about the issue--would that have made me feel better?  Or am i blowing this whole thing out of proportion--maybe i am just so snobby now that i expect the waitstaff to focus on me 100%?  or should i even have allowed one lousy hostess to ruin my entire brunch experience?  i don't know.  what i do know was that it was unpleasant in a way that i can't really verbalize well.  and i don't intend on putting myself in that situation again by going back.

Great place for drinks after work or group dinners. The menu isn't huge, but after a few cocktails who wants anything but baked macaroni and cheese and sliders anyways! It's like upscale bar food, and the prices are reasonable. I didn't taste much "truffle" in the truffle fries but that didn't stop me from eating quite a few. It's nice to go with a big group so you can try a little of everything. A good alternative to other Viagra Triangle hot spots which can be less forgiving on the corporate card.

I was pleasantly surprised.  My whole meal was a little less than $30 with the tip included, and I had the Slider Combo (with a buttermilk fried chicken slider and filet mignon slider and shrimp gumbo), a martini, and the skillet cookie divided up between a bunch of girls.  I was with 4 other girls and they all really enjoyed their meals as well.  I loved that they have 5 different sliders to pick from.   If you really want to dine in the Gold Coast, but don't feel like spending mucho dinero, I would recommend LuxBar for sure.  Also, they have lots of outdoor seating!

On a recent trip to Chicago, we were advised to go to Rush Street for nightlife...We needed to eat first, and Luxbar caught our eyes. Got a great seat up front near the window. Big bar on the right, white tableclothed tables aplenty and another floor upstairs.  Good wine list, great menu choices. After having a huge Chicago style pizza lunch, I needed something healthy. And there were plenty of things to pick from. I got the Herb Grilled Chicken Breast with brown rice, baby carrots, snow peas and meyer lemon vinaigrette. The rice was nicely flavored and was a great texture - unlike most brown rice. The chicken was light and well seasoned and the veggies were nice and al dente - perfect. My friend ordered a scallop dish which was also light, fresh, and enjoyed. (See pictures) All in all great experience. Great service too. I'd go out of my way to return next time I'm in town!

Lux Bar had a surprisingly good-for-you menu complete with veggie burgers and salads topped with salmon and tuna.  While I was drawn to the heirloom tomato salad, it's lack of protein made me order the turkey burger which was stuffed with peppers and pretty tasty.  We sat upstairs, which made my dining experience much more enjoyable; not only was it PACKED downstairs but it was also ridiculously loud.   The waitress was trying to serve the bar and 7 tables upstairs so she wasn't super attentive and forgot our drinks the second time around - but that's ok.  Their wine list wasn't very good and it a bit overpriced featuring La Terra wines which sell for $3.99 a bottle at $7.00 a glass.  Eh.  I guess the whole place is just whatever.  Fine.

I have only been here once and it was with some of my much older coworkers.  Our group mirrored pretty much the rest of the crowd in the bar: older after work crowd mixed with the just turned 21 (or on a fake id) crowd.  It was a bizarre mix.  I stayed for one (pricey) drink and was ready to leave.  Surprisingly crowded and standing room only for a week night.  I glanced at their menu that looked decent, but not worth dealing with the crowd there to go back.

I have been to Luxbar maybe five times and I would say the food is pretty good.  The desserts are phenomenal and I have definitely had some good burgers, salads and appetizers too.   However, the last time I was there, something strange happened: I ordered a burger with cheddar chesse and bacon (and no bread- yeah, trying the Atkins thing AGAIN) and I kid you not, the cheese was identical to the cheese they use at Weiner Circle. Yeah, the flouresecent creamy cheese that they use for their cheese fries and burgers, that's right.  Now, don't get me wrong, I really love that cheese at 2am when I'm stuffing all kinds of greese into my mouth, of course, it tastes delicious but to be honest, I was really surprised to see that on my burger (or my patty completely smothered in heaps of this stuff) at Luxbar.  Perhaps they could use just regular, more natural cheese, if you will, as their cheddar cheese.   During this same meal, my fellow diner and I also ordered the shrimp cocktail as an app and that was of very high quality.  I will definitely go back but will be steering clear of the cheese.
Around the corner from the house, so easy to stop in for a burger or brunch. Food is decent and pricey!  Not a fan of the outdoor seating - WAY to busy, but great for people watching..

I have never gone into Luxbar, I have only had it delivered for lunch at work. From reading other yelper reviews I'm glad I never ventured in and I don't think I ever will. Luxbar's food is decent but nothing that great. What they charge for a single slider is just silly, why would I want one slider for that price when its not even going to fill me up. Skip the truffle fries they are not very good.

This review is based off of one lunch and one glass of wine at night, so please keep that in mind.  I had lunch with associates at Luxbar a few weeks ago. The patio was great. The hostess tried to seat us right next to the entrance- not an ideal spot, especially since there were several other tables available. I asked to grab the spot in the corner, she said no problem, but seemed very confused at my request. Everyone else's meal looked and was excellent, I was told. My turkey burger (I think it said it was "famous") was not good. At all. Lot of onions inside, which wasn't great for me, they make me sick. The patty was dry and bland, possibly bland because I wasn't eating the onions, but still. Our server was attentive and very sweet. i would definitely try it again for lunch, but stay far away from the t.b. I had a glass of wine with my sister one night after dinner. It was great. It was around 10, and they informed us we could only stay on the patio a short while- what is with that law, by the way? 11pm?! The wine was reasonably priced and very good. Not too large of a selection, but definitely gives options. We had the same server I had had for lunch. She seemed a little flustered at night; perhaps she had worked all day. It wasn't too busy. Lots of people watching and listening. It is the Viagra Triangle... I liked Luxbar. I think it is a nice spot for drinks with a girlfriend or coworker. Definitely not some place I would want to hang out on a Friday night, but there isn't really anywhere around there I want to be on a Friday night.  This is possibly the most boring review I have ever produced. My apologies.

I hate... HATE the Viagra Triangle area. I really do. There is a certain feel that makes me want to come home and take 15 showers. Perhaps it is because I'm not a wealthy 50 year old male looking to hook up with a 18 to 24 year old girl. Or with a hooker. However despite this wonderful and Disney clean feeling, Luxbar is a place I would return to. The place is full of dark oak, which lends itself very well to hiding in the shadows to avoid the ex wife that just walked in. A large bar area to wet my whistle and enjoy some conversation with a girl barely the age of 22 and flaunting everything God and a plastic surgeon gave her before she snubs me for a potential sugar daddy. But I digress.... The food is good, is it groundbreaking? No, but fairly solid. The drinks are good, decent beer selection, though not one to get a martini here, several friends have enjoyed them here. Service can be a bit spotty, especially when the place is packed to the top with people, though usually fairly good. However if you do get stuck in the Triangle, come here, grab a drink, check on the game on one of their many flat screens or watch the many opportunities to be entertained by all the people watching available.

We were glad to sit outside....originally it seemed like they would not have a table for us but they did and that made us happy. The food was good but I had specifically asked for my eggs to be dry  and cooked with pam (I have a digestion problem and I can not eat anything saturated in oil).  The waitress said it was not a problem. We waited a very very very long time for our food.  Almost 30 minutes...the waitress had not checked on us and we were famished.  When the food finally came out we were back to smiles but when I checked out my eggs they were oozing in oil...boooooooo! The over all quality of the food was good, the weather was nice, and once we were able to eat we were def. happier.

Went to Luxbar for lunch the other day with three friends, and it was great overall.  Service was totally on point and we didn't want for anything.  Our waitress gave us recommendations and they had a lot of drinks to choose from, wine included.  I had a grilled chicken sandwich that was delicious, albeit nothing special.  My friend had the Lux Club which looked great, and another friend had a different club sandwich that was amazing, I should know, I tried it!  Oh, and the guacamole here is not to be missed if it's coming on or with your food.  Will definitely be back!

more like 3.5 stars With the big "Luxbar" sign in gold out front how could you not miss this place? Good strong drinks...check Girls half naked...check Hot guys with rockin bodies...check So & so bar food..check They feature a varied list of specialty drinks from different countries (bellini,mojito, caipirinha, pimm's cup). The fresh fruit sling, brandy ice and chocolate cherry martinis are must try drinks.  The crowd is was mix of mid 20's to mid 30's. For the 4th of July weekend it was pretty packed. I assumed that everyone would be in the country side in their summer homes. The space has a warm modern feel and design. Mirrored walls with wood trimming throughout. Basically, this is SF's Matrix. Brunch is served on the weekend with the option of sitting in the outdoor area and upstairs.

Stuffy, unappealing and a little expensive!  The people that hang at this bar love themselves, a lot!! Full of self-absorbed people, Lux is a perfect home for the insecure and delusional. Once again, the same cougars that hang at Blue Agave can be found here as well. The drinks were way too expensive, and the oysters are not as appetizing as advertised. Cool thing about Lux is the open windows. Sometimes a cool breeze will find its way in, which is always nice. If the windows are the best attribute of a bar, then definitely find another bar to chill at.

3.5 stars.  Went here for a lunch one day and was satisfied with the meal.  I had the sesame crusted tuna salad which was quite tasty and flavorful...I thoroughly enjoyed it.  Dessert was coffee with a humongous, humongous chocolate mousse pie.  My friend refused to eat it with me (something about watching her weight...makes me sad when a gorgeous girl wants to diet!) so I had to battle it out on my own.  I lost half way, accepted defeat and took the rest home where it became a decadent snack later that evening.  Yes, all was right with the world that night when I was bopping my head to music and taking huge bites of mousse in between bops.

I have a feeling that if I actually stepped foot in this place, my rating would be just three stars.  But, alas, I ordered and had the food delivered to me.   And, well..  you know the rest.   I had the salmon with a DIVINE red wine (I think) kind of sauce, asparagus, spinach and potatoes.  It was so good, that it has inspired me to recreate this in my own kitchen.  I also ordered a fried chicken slider, just because I couldn't believe they would charge you so much for just ONE slider.  But, it was finger licking good.
I like this place. The food was good, prices are reasonable and it is pretty good people watching. I highly recommend the mac and cheese and the crab salad. Both were great.  Service was OK...

You know you're in major trouble with your friends who have known you since you had bad acne, no job and bad grades (i.e. since you were 12 years old) when they smack you across the head after you tell them that LuxBar is your neighborhood bar.  Almost as bad as saying the Gage is an authentic Irish pub.  Yes, I've said both :)  And I wasn't even drunk on both occasions. LuxBar is a neighborhood bar, though - at least in the sense that it is one of the more familiar, low key hang outs in the Gold Coast.  So, to the extent that the Gold Coast is your neighborhood, viola... LuxBar, being in the Gold Coast is a neighborhood bar for those who live in the Gold Coast. Alright, enough of the justification.  Let's just say that the food is above average, generally well prepared and fresh.  I like their heavy pours of wine, their hummus app and all the sandwiches and baby back ribs.   Sunday brunch was actually pretty good too (just had my first experience with brunch this past weekend) - all you can drink of the typically $6 per serving orange juice, coffee, tea, properly prepared Eggs Benedict, ham, turkey, bacon, sausage, waffles, french toast, mac and cheese, pastry... what more can you ask for on a Sunday morning when you're hung over?   I can't complain about my neighborhood bar.

The stuffed mushrooms were divine, the veggie burger delicious, and the fries well done! The weather was fab, so we sat outdoors and caught up while people-watching... And definitely agreed on why it was the Viagra Triangle. The waitress was nice too, and checked in on us often. In fact, I told her I wasn't terribly hungry, so she recommended the mushrooms. I already feel fat, but totally sated.

Four stars only because it appears to be a scene and they didn't have McTers Bourbon. My Manhattan on the other hand was fab. YEAH nice and big got me a little sauced. Although there should have been an orange rind instead of a cherry. However totally relaxed atmosphere and people of all ages and backgrounds which makes for a fantastic mix. Our waitress (not a PC term but i don't care was such a doll. We were in the upstairs bar which seemed a little more low key than downstairs. They have a nice drink menu and great people watching. Def. recommend.

Great martinis, fun atmosphere, and fantastic people watching.   Watching 40-year old-bleach blondes compete with 22 year old bleach blondes for the affection of some 60 year old Marlboro man is priceless!!  And there's always a few normal souls out there to chat with as you're taking in the show!

went for dinner, short wait, got a fairly bland mojito. crowd is vibrant, loud, business folks.  Good spirits abound.  Fewer HOTIPs (hookers on the installment plan) than other VT locales, but some egregious displays of siliconicity. Service was excellent-- servers, bussers and runners fly through that room rather amazingly.  beer list is a huge flop. the best there is is flat tire, which is fine enough, but it's not a 'beer' place, though they have 8 taps or so.  we were quite happy with the veggie burger, and very much appreciate it being there for us. 'chick pea salad' was a flop. fries are awesome, but the available mustard is an awful sugar bomb. like mustard flavored jelly.  a star was lost due to the older african american bathroom attendant (who himself was very pleasant). So amazingly outdated and wrong seeming.  Is it wrong?  It made us want to puke, and my date figured she'd rather 'hold it' than go see what the lady's room had to offer.

YUMMY!  I looooove food... I'm from the country and know a good piece of meat;) The hummus is outstanding and their burgers are delicious!  I'm not really a thick burger fan, but the Lux burger was so good I'm craving it right now!  Juicy beef, bacon, cheese... oh my goodness!  Not exactly healthy, but you have to try this.

I was pretty impressed with Luxbar given the mixed reviews I've gotten from this place. If there's one thing you need to take away, they have some mean sliders - try the kobe beef! I liked their wine list - try the kim crawford sauvignon blanc. we also had Frog's Leap cab (one of my fav sustainable vineyards/wineries in Napa).  Yummy! The truffle fries were a little on the greasy side (oh well), and they surprisingly have good tuna tartare (random? yes!) I'd def. come back for drinks on a weeknight when I'm in the area.  Don't really care too much for the crowd.

I know I'm a little young to be hanging out here.  Like most VT establishments, the average male is usually 45-60, and make for quite an interesting evening.  Despite the "action", my friends and I gather here for their food.  No, it's not out of this world, but they have a decent and well priced menu.  While the appetizer menu isn't so hot, the salads and burgers are worth it.

Been here a zillion times and I have never had a bad experience! The service is great, very attentive! They have a fantastic patio in the spring/summer that you can sit on and people-watch (or watch old guys that live in the neighborhood get rejected by young chics) while sipping on a Bellini! Try the Buffalo Chicken Salad it's delicious! Or if you can get up before Noon they have a fantastic breakfast menu! Two thumbs up for this place.... and their Snickers Pie!

It isn;t that Luxbar was bad. To the contrary, the fried chicken was very good. Well breaded and tasting of rosemary, it was some of the best that I have had. The potato was very good as well. The bad is location and atmosphere. This shouldn't be a surprise, but I was a little caught off guard when the average age of males was 50 and the average age of females was 25.  I guess that the moniker "Viagara Triangle" is right on the ball.

This is one of my go to spots for brunch.  The bloody marys aren't the best I've had, but they're definitely worth a try and the blueberry pancakes are almost as good as my Mom's :) I recently stopped by here for drinks at night too and sampled some of their martinis. If you have a sweet tooth like me, try the chocolate!

not quite my scene, but it's close by and open late. the food and drinks i have experienced are as follows. the steak salad is yum! the chili is not. the crab cake slider is disappointing. the pomegranate martini is perfect! the raspberry martini is not quite.

How is it that I've lived in Chicago for nearly 8 years and have never fully experienced the Viagra Triangle? Quite a travesty. I've been/around for dinners, shopping, etc but never for the nightlife scene... I'm rating Luxbar (and corresponding 'hood) a Top Ten selection for people watching. Truly, out of this world entertainment...for free! If you've never been (like me) this is a good place to get your feet wet... Major thanks to John C (world renowned  smart ass) and the fab Carol K for running commentary. I was sober as a church mouse, and still found the entire night  marvelously entertaining ;)  A Viagra Triangle virgin, no more.

This place is smack dab in the middle of the Viagara Triangle, and you can tell just by sitting at the bar. Cougars abound, on the prowl for young meat, while their male counterparts, the DOMs (Dirty Old Men) prowl for young chick meat as well.  That aside, I like the bar, and love the food. Have been there for both bar and dinner outings, and have enjoyed myself thoroughly both times. The food is acutally REALLY good, and their dessert is good as well, always a plus in my book!

ooo, nice and fancy, but also for the average person who likes to have a good meal and a good time. Very spacious, with an upstairs, this restaurant/bar has a very large menu. The salads are traditional to non-traditional and their breakfast/brunch is to die for. Their appetizers are excellent, except for the spring roles, which I didn't enjoy. Go for the crabcakes or mushrooms instead. The service is good and so it the atmosphere.

This is pretty close to a one-stop shop for all your entertainment needs.  You know how there are some places with great drinks, but terrible food, or tasty food, but no scene, or fantastic scene, but poor drinks, etc?  Well, Lux Bar rates a very good in every category.  You definitely want to make reservations if you come on a busy Friday or Saturday night.  If not, you could be waiting for a table for over an hour.  Luckily, we had reservations and were seated within a few minutes on a recent Friday night.  The place was packed and super loud.  The crowd was mostly mid 20s to late 30s.  The ratio of guys to girls was pretty even and it was definitely a good looking crowd.  The room is divided into two areas - the bar area with TVs showing various sports events and a dining area.  The dining area had high tables and stools and also some regular booths.  The bar area looked pretty chaotic and was super crowded so I was glad we were eating dinner instead of just getting drinks.  The menu is your standard upscale bar fare with burgers, salads, sandwiches, etc.  I heard the sliders were good so we tried the crab cake and the regular burger.  I thought they were very good and the portion size was decent.  The stuffed mushroom appetizers were awesome.  The order came with three large portobello caps stuffed with breadcrumbs and cheese.  They were really flavorful.  I also had the sesame crusted tuna salad which was great.  There were lots of big pieces of tuna and I liked the dressing.  The portions at Lux Bar are generous, but more importantly, the food is good! I had wine with dinner so I can't comment on how well the drinks were made, but my date said his Jack and Coke tasted just fine.  The waiter was very nice and the manager even stopped by our table to ask how our evening was going.  The hostesses are tall and busty and overall, the scene was very happening.  There was a lot of fun people watching, too. Bathrooms are upstairs; the ladies room is all mirrors inside (including the stall doors) which made it a bit confusing to see which one was occupied.  Luckily, there was a bathroom attendant to call out which ones were free.  There is another small bar area upstairs and what looked like a room that can be used or private parties.  The bar upstairs was pretty dead so it would be a good place to hang out if you got tired of the crowd downstairs. Overall, I loved this place and would definitely go back.  Lux Bar would be great for all different kinds of events...dates, parties, group dinners, etc.  I think it would be a fun place for brunch as well.  The prices are reasonable and I really enjoyed my evening here.

If you are looking for an upscale bar that consistently has good food- than LuxBar has to be on your list to try. I love the 1940's feel to the place- black and white checkered floors, the black marble staircase with the brass railing, mahogany bar, and the dark stained wood seating clusters- all lend a feeling of opulence to a place that couldn't be less stuffy or pretentious.  My favorite place to sit is in the smaller bar area upstairs but it is not always open so you may find yourself in the larger, downstairs bar. The food is good and given it's linkage to Gibson's and Hugo's should come as no surprise.  We had the tuna tartare, and a selection of their sliders (you can order as many as you like and in ground beef, filet mignon, pulled pork or turkey- all delicious)  We also had their hand cut fries which were a hit with the table. The only downside that we had was that we were trying to watch the Bears game and the TV's on our side of the bar had another game on them.  We asked several people to change the station and finally found a manager who was able to do so- but we missed part of the game.  Oh well- we lost anyway! All in all- go to grab a drink with friends and have a bite to eat.  The atmosphere and food will keep you coming back.

Why the 3 stars, you ask? The drinks. I had a caipirinha (which was fine) and I finished off my meal with a Makers Mark whiskey sour. Delicious! Fresh lemon juice makes all the difference. The food was fine. The fresh spring rolls were, perhaps, a little too ambitious. They were too large and floppy to pick up, and some of the flavors were too strong (mint is delicious, but perhaps in smaller pieces?).  The roast chicken had great flavor, but was a little too dry. Overall, the food was overshadowed by high flattutin' ingredients, but should have had enough faith in its freshness.  When I'm back in town, I will most likely go back for drinks. And probably for food - because of the influence of drinking...
Nice atmosphere, decent drinks... didn't try the food.  Typical Viagra Triangle crowd.

Cool space and a promising menu, but I've never seen a place screw up steaks so much!  A request for a steak done medium resulted in a lump of coal.  I would have made a fuss, except for being in a group on a tight schedule.  Thankfully, the sides were well-executed and served family style, so I didn't leave hungry.    On the plus side, their Snicker's Cake was very well done and saved the dinner.  Not sure if I would come back here - place has promise but execution remains poor.

I've now been here 5 or 6 times, and I love this place.  Basically, any time someone comes in from out of town, this is where we go for dinner.  The bar area is a bit crowded, but I've never had a drink here -- I come for the food, which is spectacular.  I've never had to wait longer than 20 minutes for a table, so it's a good place to go for dinner even on Friday or Saturday nights.  Service is great, but for some strange reason, every time I've been here, I've been randomly seated in the same area, and have had the same waiter, who is always great. My personal favorites:  The chicken and the tiny burgers.  Try all 4 kinds -- all great. Summary:  Come here for the food.

As a caveat to this review, I go there for the food.  The 'scene' to me is more funny than "happening".  It's part of the viagra triangle, so ladies beware - unless you're hunting for a middle aged divorcee (in which case, this place would be awesome). I've been here a couple of times for drinks and dinner, and have yet to be disappointed.  While it's crowded, the wait for tables has never been excessive.  Yes, some of the conversations you'll overhear are ridiculous, but get beyond that and judge this place by what they do - not the people that hang out there. Drinks: A bit on the pricey side for my taste, but I'm willing to pay the price when I know that they're making their own simple syrup, muddling fresh mint in mojitos, or actually knowing the recipes to some classic cocktails witout having to look 'em up.  Hell, even the manhattens taste better somehow. Food: The aps are really good, and the main courses are solid.  Nothing to write home about, but everything it consistently good across the board.  I do have to say that they did make the best tomato soup I've ever had in my life last fall.  Nothing fancy, but somehow the flavors came together to form something wonderful. So enjoy the food and the crowd.

I have been to LUXBAR for two high-class parties (one an alderman fundraiser, another a 25th birthday party), the most recent being two weekends ago, and will say that it has been nothing but excellent. The bar is very open so it has an airy feel even when crowded.  The waitstaff was very friendly and assisted in every way with a smile.  The appetizers and food tasted great and were always readily available.  I'm sure the drinks were a little pricey (I really don't know cause I never paid for anything) but they were definitely not lacking in the alcohol department. While I normally prefer the type bars of Wrigleyville and Lincoln Park, LUXBAR was definitely a nice change from the college-y scene.
The filet sliders are a MUST.........that and the tasty eye candy!!!  LUXBAR is loaded is beautiful women and the drinks are by far amazing.

This place was happening the night we were there.  We didn't eat, just had a drink.  They had an extensive drink menu that looked very yummy, but we didn't try anything from there, but ordered our usual suspects.  The crowd was mixed and if it weren't for the whole smoking thing, the place would have been better.

Only been here for breakfast, so I can't comment on the night scence, but it was pretty decent.  Always a wait on weekends and the menu has some not-your-typical brunch stuff, like an egg sandwich on a challah roll.  Prices are 10-12 per entree, and yes, the coke is a tiny bottle.  really paying for ambience and convenience.  For better food, but ususally an equally long wait, I recommend the pancake house next door.  Seems like a sibling to Evanston's Walker Bros.

Was invited here for a friend's birthday and now I just keep going back. Not to mention the birthday party was a huge success. Granted they sat ten of us around a relatively small table (we managed) but, the service was great. We're a rowdy crowd and the waiter adapted to work with us. Best part of all, after three weeks of SUPER expensive birthday outings, this $40 a head party was much appreciated by all.  The atmosphere is pseudo casual and the crowd is mixed. I'd love to go and try their brunch, but haven't quite made it down there yet.

Went there a few times when my buddy still lived in the Gold Coast. Great spot for brunch on the weekends and a quick bite after work during the week. I recommend the French Dip Sandwich and, if they still have it on the menu, the inexpensive Top Sirloin Steak. Both are great! Staff is friendly and service is quick

Brunch: After living in Chicago only for 7 months i have looked high and low for a breakfast buffet that is both inexpensive ( for good food) and close by, that being said I finally found ....The Luxbar!! The breakfast buffet is amazing for only $15.00, they have everything the regular menu offers expect for pancakes, even coffee or juice is include w the meal. The service was great, the manager came by twice to make sure everything was good.  Anyway I could write forever about how good the food, service, etc  was but, go check it out yourself....also can't beat a place that offers 3 flat screen TV's showing different stations!

I had to stop myself from giving this place 5 stars because I have only been here once. I came here after a horrifying experience at Melvin B's and it renewed my love for Chicago bars.  Great atmosphere. Bars tenders were the best I have seen in awhile, people were nice and when the drunk guys hit on my friend they caught the hint early on and moved on. I would definitely come back here again! I wish we could have arrived earlier so we could have had more then 2 drinks before last call... all well, next time!  Thank you Luxbar for not being even close to Melvin B's! Thanks for having great bar tenders who know how to make a drink and tend to the customers!

Maybe I'm not the best-qualified person to write a review of Luxbar, since we were only there at the end of the night, but I really must mention its 4-star-worthiness based on the fact that we escaped here after a horrifying experience at Melvin B's, and it was like paradise. They knew how to mix drinks. It was neither crowded nor smoky. The bartenders were nice. And there were not nearly as many frat boys in their layered polo shirts, so it got two (million) thumbs up from us.

I had a brunch reservation this weekend at LuxBar. It was a mostly pleasant experience. After being shuffled between the two hostess stands, we were seated immediately at a table outside. We were seated between the bee-filled flower pots and the bee-filled condiment cart. There is not much they can do about this, but they did place vinegar cups around to discourage them from swarming. Our server was excellent. She had many tables and handled them promptly and courteously. When our food arrived, it was nearly perfect. The fresh made croissant was tasty, the omlette had a generous amount of ingredients in it, and the fruit cup was nicely varied. The bacon, however, was still uncooked on one end. We finally reached a server and asked to have it crispy instead. What they brought us was burnt crisp! So, no bacon for us. Unfortunatley, the charge was still on our check when it arrived.  Two Warnings: The morning cocktails (Mimos and Screwdriver) were very expensive. (No prices on the menu either.)  If you make your reservation via OpenTable, verify that they are giving you credit. Although I checked at both stations and told them I had a reservation, they neglected to give me credit. I had to call the restaurant later to ask them to fix it.

My friend and I ventured into Luxbar after she told me she knew one of the managers. The bar/lounge was half empty with lots of place to sit and stand. The service is quick, maybe a little too quick. My friend's drink was taken away before she even finished it (granted, she was almost done).   There are two floors, with enough room to accommodate any size party. The bathrooms are on the second floor, so if you're drunk, going up and down the stairs isn't a simple task.  We got there way past midnight, but the manager said that the upstairs bar area also serves as a dance floor. When we were there, it was pretty empty - so I'll take his word for it. The crowd was definitely over 30 - probably because Gibson's is right across the street. It's a really relaxed atmosphere with indoor and outdoor seating.
Went on a Sunday afternoon. Yum sliders! filet slider- amazing. simply amazing. mmmm mimosa. perfect before my day of shopping. Really try the sliders, some of the best around.

Went here last night and really liked this place.  The menu had a good selection, and prices seemed reasonable for the serving sizes.  I had the meatloaf with mac and cheese, and burger and filet mignon sliders (it's a glandular problem, mind your own business).  All were excellent, especially the filet slider.  If you get any burger, get it with the "pub" cheese.  Amazing stuff.  The bar seemed like a good place to hang out on the weekends, and I would definitely go back.  Just a warning, an 8 ounce bottle of coke is $3, so you might want to avoid that.  And the desert menu looked awesome.  I'll be getting that next time.

I went to Luxbar for the first time last night and LOVED IT. I had dinner and would highly recommend everything I had: hummus platter, Gnocchi, and peach fruit cobbler. If you cannot tell by reading this I was absolutely stuffed by the time dinner was over and found that for the (high) quality of food I got the price was very reasonable. My only words of caution are to be careful when ordering drinks (my well vodka cran turned out to be $9.50 which I am not used to...) and you may want to be a little more dressed up on a Saturday night than in a Cubs jersey as I was as I had just been to the game.

I really like coming here and sitting outside!  Even though it's in the triangle, it's kind of tucked out of the way so you don't feel like people walking by are staring at you.  I love their filet quesadillas!!  Their glasses of wine are generous and mixed drinks not bad either.  My only complaint is after coming here for a friends birthday and ordering quite a lot of food and drinks, our waitress actually had the nerve to come back to our table and ask for a bigger tip!! We originally left her 20%, so I don't know if she just thought she deserved more because it was a big party (in that case she should have added gratuity anyway), or if we were a little drunk, but it still left a bad taste in my mouth...

My aunt's concierge at the Ritz made reservations for us for a Thursday evening.  Yet when we got there at our appointed time, they weren't ready for us and we had quite a wait.  It was packed and we could barely get to the bar.  When we were finally seated, our table was squeezed in an aisle so we felt like we were in the way.  Luckily 2 minutes later a table more to the side opened up and we were able to sit there. Our food was very good, the service just adequate.  We felt our servers attention was somewhere else.

I finally made it to Luxbar for a late brunch on the July 4 holiday - it's perfect if you're looking for something more refined than the Original Pancake house, but more affordable than the Tavern on Rush which flank Luxbar on either side and share that very pretty sidewalk space on Bellvue lined with tables and florals, that bring a glimpse of sunny Europe into the goldcoast hood. Food is good, not great - loved their Belgian Waffles and potato-au-gratin but the french toast wasn't exactly delectable; The wait was long but not unpleasant. I would have loved to sit outside and people watch but had to settle for a white-checkered tablecloth spot, in the proximity of the large screen tvs that we couldn't hear above the cacophony of our fellow brunchers. Granted this popular neighborhood bar is probably better served after sun-down, so I'll have to reserve my overall judgement , but for me it's a skip-it for a quick brunch trip.

Not bad, not great.  The Filet sliders do indeed slay, as I have heard. I could eat dozens of them.  Everything else frankly seemed pretty high-priced for what you got. The burger I had was average at best, and frankly any place with a bathroom attendant gets on my nerves. I can pee, hand wash, and dry off just fine with no help, and have been since I was about 3.   Another beef I had was their Boddington's.  I got one glass, sent it back, and the second was the same way.....flat as hell.  That beer is supposed to have a nice head on it like Guinness, almost like Guiness lite.  The server was nice enough about it and very apologetic, comped 'em and all so we were cool there.  Overall the place just seemed pretty average for what they were charging.

So I heard a rumor that this place is so large that there is typically no need to make a reservation. I completely disagree. Though I actually had a reservation, I still had to loiter at the door almost an hour before my party was seated! By that time, I actually found myself tempted to trip the next person that shoved into me as they tried to get to the bar. Though that was pretty darn annoying, by the time I was comfy in my booth, I was very excited about being there. I really dug the menu. It was a fabulous blend of classic favorites. We ordered a variety of sliders for aps and they were DELICIOUS. It took me forever to choose between entree's because they all looked really good, but I was stoked with my choice and the price was definitely right. I think I paid less for my entree then I would at some place cheesey like TGI-Friday's! So, bottom line, I definitely recommend it and I will definitely go again. Just be sure to make a reservation - hopefully it will work out better for you.

I've never eaten at LuxBar, but I hustled over to watch the Mayweather-De La Hoya fight last weekend and was horrified. The bartenders were incredibly slow. The drink prices were absurdly expensive. The crowd was snotty and more Los Angeles than Chicago. At one point, a manager strolled downstairs and instructed hosts to remove people from the bar who were "just standing around." That lead to many fight fans being bumped out because they didn't have seats. Worst of all, the crappy house music was playing so loud that no one could hear the fight. I ended up deciding the fight wasn't worth watching in such a crap atmosphere and headed back to my beloved Logan Square for real drinking with real people.

We ate here on a Sunday morning/early afternoon, the place was not overly crowded in any sort of way to excuse to bad service.  The only excuse possible is that perhaps our waitress and the entire kitchen staff were hungover from the night before.  I know that I was, along with the others we were dining with.  Luckily for me, 2 of my fellow eaters that day were from the good ol' UK, renown for it's shoddy food and barely there service...so I was not completely mortified for bringing them to this place.  Some sort of cream of chicken (maybe) soup to start - inedible.  I can't remember what I had after that, but I know I didn't finish it.  Someone else had poached eggs and something tartare - I think they said it was alright, but then again, they are british.  My boyfriend had some sort of omelet which was okay, but by the time he received his food he was so hungry he would've eaten anything.  No refills on our water without begging for it.  Never asked if we wanted a second beer or bloody mary until almost the end of the meal when we just wanted our check.  I've had drinks here before in the evenings and service was just fine, but I will never eat here again.  Maybe dinner is different, but I would not recommend eating there earlier in the day.

I really didn't want to go to this place.  It has been some time since I went down to the "Viagra Triangle." That being said I really enjoyed this place.  I loved the interior, had a nice crowd - was really a great place to go with some girls.   I will go back.
I was sitting here with my co-workers trying not to puke after a long night of drinking... they said the sliders were really good but looking at food just made me want to puke...

I recently ordered about $75 worth of appetizers from here to take to a wedding shower for a friend. I called in my order on saturday afternoon, went to get it about 30 minutes later, and it was all ready to go with lots of additional side sauces and everything you could need to make the food just as appetizing at home. Anyhow, there were 12 of us, I believe, and we actually could have used more food. The hummus was my favorite, and the stuffed mushrooms were very popular. Everything was delicious and ordering the food from luxbar made the party so much less stressful! I highly recommend ordering food to go from here if you have a small party that you'd rather not cook for! Just be sure to order enough.

I was here for the FIFA World Cup between Italy and France. Great space, GOOD food, tho our waitress kept messing up our order. It was kinda of understandable considering the event and how packed it was!!! on a side note: I loved the editorial they had in Image magazine that was pretty cool, ur able to appreciate the space a bit more!!

This is sort of trendy, well not all that but just marble checkered floors.  They have plenty of room; upstairs as well and best thing about this place is....  you don't have to make RESERVATION.  Other restaurants around this viagra triangle, you have to, no doubt about that. So you'll be mixed in with tourists but its fun and good people watching.  Lot of families come here to eat during the weekend.  I think most people come here because they can't find seating to other restaurants.  Yea so you have to wait a little bit here but good food and reasonable priced for this area.  I came here numerous times for birthday parties and just walk in dinners, and even at 1-2am, they have not done me wrong.  Food is 3.5 stars : )

This place has a very classy buildout- lots of marble and wood. We had a large group and were seated near the fireplace.  The fireplace is a nice touch, but I'm glad I didn't sit next to it. I hear that the service can be a bit dodgy, but our service was good- we had a couple of drinks at the bar and this may have helped. The bus-boys were a little on the grabby side of the spectrum. For appetizers we had fried shrimp (off dinner menu), guac, oysters, and hummus.  Each item held up.  The hummus platter came with some nice olives as well. For dinner I had the Steak Pom Frites.  It was delicious.  Now, the cut of meat itself wasn't the best, but it was perfectly marinated and cooked.  It showed up hot, and the pom frites were shoestring- different from their regular french fries. I also had some of a friend's Filet, and it had good flavor and texture.

As a rule of thumb, I try to avoid the "Viagra triangle," unfortunately we were trying to find a restaurant near the loop yesterday, and ended up here...  I guess it was just a bad night, all of the other reviewers here seem to like Luxbar, I may just have to try it again.  Last night, however, it was on the whole a disappointment.  The waitress took 20 minutes to get to the table, I ordered a salad that sounded great on the menu but ended up a big pile of chopped iceberg lettuce with two tomatoes in it, and I guess I was expecting something else of the decor, not a glorified Maggiano's.  Although, Luxbar wasn't completely lacking in all departments.  The wine list was decent, not to mention they pour big glasses, and the "Sliders" (mini sandwiches) were really good!  Maybe if I try this place on a different night it will be better!

Saturday morning breakfast here kinda sucked.  Though the service was great! I ordered the Steak & Eggs, the steak was poor quality, the eggs over done.   $6 fruit cup, ok ill deal.    His eggs benedict seemed smothered in cheese rather than hollandaise.

I have only been to the LUXBAR for lunch but I love it. They have the best mac and cheese. I also love that you can get half salads. The Bloody Mary's have a ton of garnishes which is fab. It is not great for a group.We had 9 people and they smashed us into a corner. Also, the host was wearing legging so tight and up her butt- I would not even wear them to bed. POOR GIRL. get a clue.

Came in for lunch and was slightly overwhelmed by all the people that make triple the income and just sit around lux bar and shoot the breeze while I sip on my $3 coke in a glass bottle longing for a large free refill fountain soda.  But the food is worth the price tag and my butter fried chicken club sandwich must have been the size of my head and very delicious.  My coworker and I split a round of pub cheese and it came with a variety of tasty little toasted breads.  My only plea is to just go with the fountain drinks, this girl has got to have her fill of caffiene!
Let me preface that I've only been here once, but it was so indulgent.  This is true comfort food and it's a great place to eat on the sidewalk and people watch.

Had dinner with a couple of friends here last night and thought it was great!  The boneless ribeye was "Gibson's quality" and a couple of bucks less.  It was a perfect medium rare and arrived hot.  Mashed potatoes were good (as was the Caesar salad), though I like a few lumps in my potatoes.  The service was excellent, the "vibe" in the room was typical Rush Street, and the drinks are generous.  I'll be back...

Decent. Went upstairs on Saturday night. We sat in the area by the fireplace and there were quite a few cozy tables. Decent wine list and very reasonable. I don't love this area either but it's one of the less old-man-hitting-on-young-women places I've been to there.

Love the food.  Hate the neighborhood. I'm not a big fan of this area, but when I am shopping and need a bite, Luxbar is great for good old comfort food.   Mini kobe burgers are fab (by the way, did you know that kobe beef actually comes from massaged cows in Japan?).  Drinks were eh ok. Salads were eh too.   Always an interesting mix of viagra triangle crowd, corporate types and tourists.  Not really my scene.

review for the bar, decor, and crowd -  went here for a b-day party on the top floor.  it was trendy and fun, good crowd.  bartenders were attentive and the drinks were good without being river-north overpriced. can't speak to the food or service.  i would love to try the food and the dining room sometime soon.

Luxbar is located in Viagra Triangle area of downtown Chicago.  For those not in the know, this is where 50+ guys (divorced, separated, or wife is out of town) hunt for ladies in their 30's. Luxbar advertises ultra fresh ingredients but to me it was a glorified Cheesecake Factory that specializes in steaks, burgers and seafood.  With the exception of the ahi tuna appetizers which were nearly as cold as ice cubes, the food was competently prepared.  Not the best but the portions were large (like most Chicago restaurants).  Would have given 3 stars if not for the ill prepared appetizer.

My friend and I went to Lux Bar last night for dinner and I could not have been more pleased.   The food was delicious and came out promptly.  The service was over and beyond.  The waiter was attentive and even brought us a complimentary snickers ice cream pie dessert as he knew we were celebrating my birthday - I am still having dreams about the dessert - UNREAL.  Fun atmosphere, although beware it draws in a crowd so make reservations ahead of time.

I've been to Luxbar for drinks many times, but just ate here for the first time tonight. The food and service were both amazing, but I guess I should have expected that since it's owned by the same peeps as Gibsons and Hugo's (my favorite!). This restaurant was absolutely packed tonight, which was very impressive for a Tuesday evening. Many people seemed to be enjoying happy hour, but all the tables for dinner were filled as well.   My friend and I started off with their hummus appetizer. I haven't been able to eat hummus after eating it for 10 straight days during a trip to Israel a few months ago, but it's definitely back on my list because it was delicious this evening. I had the halibut for dinner, which was cooked in a very tasty Asian sauce and my friend enjoyed her chopped salad as well. I made the mistake of mentioning to our very nice and attentive waiter that it was my friend's bday and a huge piece of snicker ice cream cake ended up on our table.  I had no choice, but to forget my diet and dig into the cake...YUM!

I had one of the best burgers here.  It was a bacon and blue burger I believe, and it was great.  Seeing as how it is a restaurant owned by the same guys that own Gibson's, this is not surprising.  Make sure to check out the Gold Coast Sliders, too.

So far I've only been here for the food, brunch mainly.  I love the omelettes, that's all I ever eat!  Service varies... sometimes quick and attentive, other times slow and frustrating.  I don't worry about that too much though... serving is a tough job!  Overall, good location and good atmosphere.

Pleasantly surprised by their food!  I had dinner here last night for a friend's bachelorette party, and we had a good time.  I tried the chicken quesadillas which were quite tasty- they had a good amount of chicken, with spinach and guacamole and green onions.   Some of the girls had the sliders or chicken sandwiches which they enjoyed.  Besides those items, the rest of the menu is fried chicken or steak~ not too much else to choose from.    The sangria was really good as well- lots of fruit in it and not overly sweet.    Note:  they try to pack quite a few people in the restaurant, so if you make a reservation- make sure to request a table not right in the front as we were sitting right up against the windows.

More for the scene than the food... a decent menu of burgers, sandwiches, salads, steaks. I'd rather hang upstairs at the bar then with the cigar smoking old men and the young girls at the downstairs bar. Definately a Rush Street kind of crowd (older men and the woman who love them) but worth checking out. Some people really like the food, I think it's just ok. A good meeting place for cocktails and a fun atmosphere. Warning: this place gets pretty noisy for dinner downstairs. My friends and I didn't realize just how loud we were taking, and these nerdy older suburban women next to us yelled at us to keep it down!

I liked this place. The outdoor seating is perfect for people watching and just off the side from Viagra square...My friend and I enjoyed some wine with a huge cobb salad and stuffed mushrooms. The salad was like a an entree itself! The stuffed mushrooms were fantastic..I mean fantastic...I devoured them!  The only problem with this place was the service. Yes the waitress was all smiles, but she was slow as hell...it took us 15 minutes to get our check after asking her...It took us 20 minutes to get our food. Its a damn salad and mushrooms! What are you doing growing the mushrooms yourself? That was the only annoying thing.. Oh yeah, and the table next to us talking about how drunk they were and whose car was better...stupid suburbanites.

Lux Bar holds true to the area it is in, upscaled bar food served to rich business men who are probably looking to hook up with the goo gobs of younger girls that flock to this place.  When I walk in I can't help but think that this place is Chicago trying to do Miami, it is overly flashy to the point of tacky... that being said the food is actually really good.  I went here planning for a corporate party so I was fortunately enough to try most of the menu and, in theory, was afforded some of their best service (we were told this at least).  While their "best service" was mediocre, the food was pretty good, upscaled sliders, lots of fried tidbits, the only thing that really let me down were the ribs as they were tough and not flavored well.  The crowd is a little bit of a set back but as someone mentioned in another review, the upstairs is far less crowded and the people were nicer, oddly enough.  As a rule I try to steer clear of the Gibson/Hugo's crowd and restaurants, but between Lux Bar and Quartino, I feel a little bit better about giving them my money.  Unless you want to fight your way through a sea of 50-something bachelors and the women who love them, I would avoid this place on the weekends.

I really like the atmosphere of Lux Bar.  It has a great location and once you walk in it feels very upscale and classy.  I prefer the bar location upstairs because they have plenty of seating and great service- it's easier to get a drink up there than at the downstairs bar. It is great people watching and they have good service so I definitely enjoy going there.

I had a great time after work with some friends at this bar. Its very large, and the ambiance is warm and cozy. Tables were not too hard to get, and the bar area was crowded but not in an annoying way. Since its right in the Gold Coast, its an ideal location for after-shopping or bar-hopping depending on the time you go. We had great chicken fingers and if I remember correctly, a quesadilla. Lets just say the drinks were good.

any place that can make gin, sour mix, and egg white taste good together shoots straight to the top of my list of yum. the cocktails are bright, inventive and darn tasty. the food is pretty ridiculous. don't pass on the filet mignon slider. yeah, you heard me.
